description:
My best friends and I went many times! Sometimes we get like 4 shots each, me not paying of course, sometimes we go and just sit there for 20 minutes and not buy anything bc we want to be sober for our movie at the Roxie. Either way, I love this place. Delirium #1 

They have a dance floor behind the bar, so if you wanna dance, don't be deterred by the fact that it just looks like average bar, it is soooo much more
author: James C.

description:
If, like me, you worry that dive bars are disappearing, fear not. Delirium is here and happily welcoming you to be part of 

The bathroom looks like it has some really interesting stories to tell. I found it to be spaciousness enough to fit all my sisters (assuming that they were all here with me.) 

A pool table in the back, strong drinks on the side, and enough places to sit to enjoy all the activity. I easily made friends with people whose names I totally don't remember. Good times.
author: Loli L.

description:
My friend was attacked here. 4 of us -- two women, two guys -- were standing in a circle near the pool table when my friend was grabbed from behind, thrown to the ground, and punched in the face repeatedly. The woman who attacked my friend got away. Security did nothing to stop her.

We learned later that two women got in a fight on the dance floor. One ran out and the other attacked my friend thinking it was her OG nemesis. 

Security could care less. Ended up calling an ambulance for my bloody and shaken friend. 0/5 cheap drinks not worth the concussion
author: Marie J.

description:
Came here after a few other bars in the area. I will say that if I had a few more drinks in me this place would have been more fun, but the crowd here is definitely a bit too rowdy and inconsiderate. 

The place itself is a bit older looking, could use an update. The people working here were nice enough, but the drinks were very much kinda half-heartedly put together. 

Overall not somewhere on my list to revisit.
author: Garen A.

description:
One of the better dive bars I've been to in SF!

First of all, the prices cannot be beat. The drink menu contains the regula dive bar standbys of beer and well drinks. However, I was delighted to see a cocktail of the day! I had to order it, and was very pleased with the flavor and amount of booze. 

Delerium does not serve food (wisely) but it allows patrons to bring takeout food into the bar from neighboring restaurants. 

This is a very cost effective establishment. We will be making it a destination for cheap drinks and good times in The Mission!
author: Andrea H.

description:
This is literally a locals home. Straight San Francisco love in that bar. From the updated jute to the graffiti covered dark walls it just feels like home. This bar knows no color, creed, or denomination and I've personally witnessed this time and time again. 

Atmosphere: dark, lazy, and wooden. Doesn't sound like much but to a person getting off a 12 hour shift and wants to see familiar faces, this place is great. Plenty of seating and even a back room for dancing. There is also a pool table but what sucks is you have to pay to play. I understand they want to make money but I'm already paying money for drinks... this is a good tactic though to keep the "bar sleepers" out. I didn't check out the video games but the machines were still there. 

Staff was nice but a little slow to make the drinks. Then announced she had to walk the bars resident dog. Gross. 

Will I come back? I always do. Even with 3 stars I keep coming to see the people I've known for years and to meet new ones.
author: Bobbi A.

description:
A horrible place! I was there with my 2 best friend, so I can definitely say it is the unsafest place for girls! There were a big group of drunk guys who wanted us to sit and talk with some of them. After we told to the stuff working there about this situation, they just said: "Do not pay attention." I think that, a lot of people who came in that time were afraid of them, so after a 30 minutes, when we drunk our cocktails, we immediately vanished from there.  
I surely won't go there again.
author: Anna C.

description: Had an awesome time... we love Jessica she is the besttttttttttttt. Visit them . Very nice play . Everyone there was awesome
author: Jennifer G.

description:
It's a great place for a day drinking. Nice mix of friendly local freaks and weirdos. There's a pool table, strong drinks and it's totally unpretentious. I'm glad somethings don't change too much. No visible emphasis on "mixology" thankfully. Appropriately branded "service for the sick"
Cheers!!!
author: J L.

description: Went to Delirium on a Thursday night and wells drinks were only $5! Fun place for cheap drinks and good music!
author: Laura K.

description:
This was my first tome attending this Bar, it was a suggestion from my best friend who knows all the hot spots! When we first walked in we were served right away.

Pros: The drinks are good and they have a cute dance area for guests that enjoy dancing with fun disco lights

Cons: No complaints, even the restroom was clean 

Tips: Ask the DJ to play your favorite hits

Overall: I was so impressed and Im looking forward to returning
author: Quania J.

description: Wow, what can I say? This place is lit AF. I really loved the $2 tecates, but since they painted the walls, they raised it to $3 tecates, which is just a too pricey. Jkjk, I still love you guys!!!!! There's a bartender who's worked there forever who is so nice. I'd tip my hat to him, but I don't have a hat. Also really love the mystery shots. I've never choked at this establishment, which is a miracle because I choke a lot.
author: KT D.

description:
Definitely a dive bar with a room to dance in the back! You enter into a long bar and if you make your way to the back, there's a pool table. There's a separate area with a dance floor. The DJ plays some bumpin hits that go along with the music videos on the TV. 

So why the 3 stars-- there's a $5 cover. Not totally worth it for this divey joint. And once you leave, there's no re-entry. 
Also, the bar is cash only. How weird.
author: Courtney O.

description:
WARNING: UNSAFE!!! men inside are RAPEY PREDATORS!

Horrible experience. This isn't necessarily about the establishment. It's about security and the folx who go here. I am born and raised in the Bay Area. 

This place is full of predatory dudes from sac and Stockton who are fucking losers. Nerds. Scrubs. Go back to Stockton and keep repping u from the bay when you live in a fucking cow town. 

Some dude kept touching my friend after she said no 3 times. I guess he didn't like the rejection so he punched her in the face and then threatened to murder her. I don't like this for multiple reasons. For one, i am tired of entitled piss baby, tit calf, mama wiped my ass till i was 8 years old men acting like they have agency over a woman's body. 
I'm tired of people who escalate things to the point that could possibly invite police presence. Right there shows you don't give a fuck about our community, don't give a fuck about your own self and you're willing to act like a moron pretty much BEGGING police presence and what good will that do? Nothing. All that does is create space for police to be violent and harm us and our community and possibly yourself. 
Especially since all of us involved were POC and indigenous it creates a very unsafe environment to what if the police actually have to show up because someone can't control themselves. 

Now my friend is having to deal with the emotional trauma of this. This was emotionally violating, physical assault. Straight up bullying and pathetic. 

The security guard kicked us out and did nothing about it. 
Yes that's right. We were kicked out and big "i poopy in my pants and don't know how to change my diaper so i punch girls" man got to stay. 

This is scary for me because my cousins are going missing to never be found over instances like this. Stop the abuse, stop the genocide. 

Oh and guess what. Real gang banging isnt threatening women because they don't dance with you. It's moving with silence and handling shit with NO ONE EVEN KNOWING. You don't go and scream to people that you will murder them. That's how you get caught up dumbass. 
I'll pray for you fucking losers. Hope you have some protection. 

Nukátôtam Hapamakô t'qunuqiyan.
 

#MMIW
author: Katlyn B.

description:
$5 cover on a Saturday night. Minimum tab of $20 to pay by credit card. 

This place was pretty crowded around 11pm, but we managed to snag a spot near the bar. Drinks are cheap and place has a good vibe. There is a pool table and dance floor in the back, but didn't venture over there since it was too crowded. Overall, liked the place although sometimes it was a bit loud.
author: Edward W.

description:
Pretty cool dive. Friendly bartender. 

Was here on a Saturday and they played nothing but hip hop. Hip hop is fine in my book but it'd be cool to have some variety.
author: Maria E.

description:
I always really enjoy going to Delerium. The bar is pretty small and divy but it has a lot of character. 

They do a great pineapple drink (it's super dangerous, the pineapple masks the vodka well!) that I always get. I believe it's called the Russian Splash.

They also have a pool table and dance room with a DJ in the back. If you're with a bunch of friends who are outgoing, it can be fun! 

I wouldn't pay an entry / door fee to get in as there's tons of other great bars within a block, but if it's free, definitely give it a shot!
author: Michael C.

description: This bar is my local bar and it's the most lit bar in the mission good drink good music good people good bar
author: Victor C.

description: Typical shitty dive bar .  There are many other bars around this area.  I would recommend skipping this place because of the ratchet bartender and customers inside.  It's an older crowd also.
author: Randy P.

description: This place is trashy af, we paid a cover and then there was a bar fight and my friend and I got tons of blood splatter all over us.
author: Anna K.

description: Had a pretty abysmal experience here last night. First of all, the highly unpleasant door guy rummaged through my book bag with a flashlight, like I was checking into the county jail or something (in 20-plus years of going to bars in the Mission I've never had a bag checked, and I actually felt like I was being profiled). Secondly, I ordered a dirty vodka martini, and ended up with some sort of sweet frou-frou concoction that maybe Liza Minnelli would appreciate, but not me. With so many quality bars in the Mission there's no reason to have to endure this joint.
author: Miles Y.

description: Don't order any drinks that do not come in a bottle, you might end up with HPV or something. The white guy bartender is a DB, maybe he is nicer to you if you buy coke from him. That seems to be their only real business here. Reminds me of those old films about the mob where there is a "restaurant" that does not sell any food, but has a proprietor that exchanges small packages for money.
author: Kevin S.

description: Stalwart neighborhood Mission bar. Not too crowded this Saturday night. Decent beers and stiff drinks although they're not the housemadesyrupswithherbswegrowourselves craft cocktails and they don't even make an attempt to make a Manhattan and serve it in the correct glass even though the correct glass is right damn there. Still, that's part of the charm of the place. It's full of people the Google bus people haven't priced out of the Mission yet which is awesome. Not a handlebar mustache in the joint which is appreciated even though I'm sure your handlebar mustache is amazing.
author: Brian B.

description:
I almost wasn't sure if I was reviewing the right place because a lot of the older reviews were so highly rated. 

First of all, there's a $5 cover, which I immediately regretted paying for approximately 0.2 seconds after I walked in. I don't understand why there's a cover to begin with, as this place was not particularly packed and/or poppin. Secondly, the bar is cash only. I know cash is king but who really carries cash with them nowadays? The only cash I really had went toward the stupid cover. There is a dj and a back room to dance, but like everywhere else, it's super hot in there and super crowded...something about it made me feel like I was attending a college house party, which is definitely not my thing anymore. The bar itself looked old and outdated as well.  

A couple positives worth mentioning though, is that the drinks are supposedly cheap. There's a single pool table that we were able to use while we were there. And although we hardly went into the back room, the music was a decent mix of hip hop/r&b/pop. Also, because it wasn't so crowded it was very easy to grab a seat and table. 

We were there for about an hour or so but overall, there was nothing particularly outstanding about this place.
author: Gabrielle S.

description: This is exactly what I want in a bar, a dark respite from the outside world with good inexpensive drinks, a solid juke box and great staff and regulars
author: Lyon H.

description:
Dive bar meets dance floor.

I don't live in the city, so ventured out with some local friends who brought me here.

Started off a little divey with a few people playing pool, then around 10pm, the bar started to fill up and music started playing in the back. Bam! DJ and a dance floor full of people! Good times.

Not sure when the cut off was for when drink price increased, but it started $5/beer and couple hours later, turned into $6/beer. Maybe they just knew I wasn't from the areA/ 

Overall good place to chill. Whenever you have good company, you'll have a good time.

Cheers!
author: Tasha P.

description: I love this bar so much!!! Absolutely favorite bar in the city. Don't listen to any of the negative reviews. Also, Angelo is a straight-up homie. So many down-to-Earth vibes in Delirium.
author: Michael J.

description: Thought this might be a friendly laid-back divebar with good drinks/service after film at the Roxie. Worst Margarita ever -- mango or some other ungodly syrup instead of Margarita mix, concocted by a low social IQ snotbag bartender who could/would not recommend a cocktail. AVOID this bar.
author: Monty P.

description: Such a fun dive bar and they have a small dance floor!!! There is a $5 cover during the weekend I believe and most of the drinks are strong.
author: Yas J.

description: Angelo is splendid. Fun bar to dance at and have cheap drinks great music great atmosphere
author: Richard R.

description:
Hubs and I stopped in after Pride this past Sunday.  Not empty, not crowded, perfect.  After sitting for a bit thinking about what I wanted to drink, I spotted a container filled with celery sticks.  Lightbulb!  I love Bloody Maries and I hadn't had one in far too long, Eureka!  I ordered it and to my delight, the barkeep started juicing limes, dishing out dashes of prepared horseradish, administering splashes of Guinness (who knew?), and finally topping off with a lovely looking tomato mix.  It's been a while since I was served such a carefully crafted Mary, and it was DELISH.  I think it set me back about $7.

Color me impressed.  If for nothing more than that Mary, I'll be back.
author: Rachel S.

description:
I've been coming to this bar for a long time and it never lets me down. Some nights they play great hip hop in the back that's fun to dance to. 
Always one of my first spots when bar hopping and have always been treated with respect their. 

Verrrrry different than their other bar in Park Merced called The Lister which isn't nearly as diverse or entertaining. But I've heard rumors from the locals that the park 77 staff might start being at the Valencia spot :-[

None the less, this bar near Valencia is always welcoming and in control. So hopefully they keep the staff the neighborhood all know and love.
author: jessica c.

description:
My favorite bar in the Mission. 
Bartenders are awesome, and can make damn good drinks. The ultimate dive bar you want to slink into whenever in town. 
Check out the bathrooms ;)
author: Kat R.

description: Was here for May Mac night. They advertise the cover everywhere as $20 but raised it to $30 when I got there. Good business decision but at the same time that was a low move. Would have given it 1 star but the extra star was for the nice bartenders.
author: Trung N.

description:
How am I the duchess here right now?

This place is one of my favorite divey, dancing bars. Always a mixed crowd. 

One time I came on a weekday and saw a homeless guy trying to steal some bottles. Hahaha.
author: Angela L.

description:
All you need to know: $3 MYSTERY SHOTS.

Okay, we later found out it was Jim Beam bourbon whiskey, but still...$3 shots!? Damn.

Side note. Their Moscow Mule is considerably lighter than Unicorn's. Ehhh.
author: Adele F.

description:
The "ALL YOU BITCHEZ ARE HERE 4 DAT SK8R DICK" in the bathroom stall is everything. 

you only go to Delirum to get shitty, that is all.
author: Angie H.

description:
Drinks are dirt cheap and they play super fun music. When you just want a low-key spot where you can dance to oldies + hip hop, Delirium's your spot.

Also, if you order a martini, they give you two glasses of drinks (one glass can't accommodate their pours). And I think a martini costs approximately $4.

Like I said, cheaaaaaaaaap drinks. Dirty bathrooms. Pool table. All you'd expect and more in a good dive.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
The first bar I ever went to when I turned 21 was a dive bar in San Diego...

and it was nothing like this.

Well, I'm being a bit dramatic.  Delirium looks and smells like a dive bar, but it doesn't feel like a dive bar.  Delirium this past Saturday night was filled with 20-30 something year old "hipsters" rolling their eyes at me for wearing 5 inch heels and a short tight skirt.  In contrast, my first dive bar in San Diego was filled with ex vets, old dudes, beach bums... that didn't give a fuck about what I did or how I dressed.  You don't get that "IDGAF" attitude at Delirium.  You'll get that "I'm trying really hard to look like I'm indifferent and that I didn't try really hard."

That being said, I really don't care about what other people think.  I just wanted to go on a little rant about hipsters.  Delirium was dirty, grimey, cheap... and the back room was great.  Whoever was controlling the music was playing Prince, The Darkness, Nelly, Rihanna... you name it!  Pretty sure my friends and I were the only ones who knew the lyrics to every song... and of course we started a dance party + got some high fives + got some dirty looks.  You can't win 'em all.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Not my kind of place.  Very dirty and music selection is not the best.  Definitely not coming back and parking was horrible!
author: Jessica A.

description:
This dive bar just oozes an aura of "unsafe for women", starting with the crowd of soooper-drunk, douchetastic, over-testosteroned guys loitering out front, intentionally blocking the sidewalk, smoking week, and yelling at each other, and continuing with the same element inside the dark, densely-packed interior.

I'm not a risk-taker or an adrenaline junkie.  I've never jumped out of a plane or eaten Fugu, and I'm not about to start now.  So, safe to say, this bar just isn't my scene. 

It *might* be your scene if you identify as a bro, douchebag, unwashed hipster, aggro problem drinker, or generally as a 20-something dude who just likes getting trashed with his buddies on a Friday night.  If you're female?  Well, I just hope you are a black belt at Krav Maga if you head to this scene...
author: Amy L.

description:
After bar hopping in the mission it seems as if this is the place to end up at towards the end of your evening. After coming here many times of course because my drunk friends left me no other option I have finally came to the conclusion that I am not crazy about this place. Bouncers are rude, there's ALWAYS fights out front (causing me to not want to return for safety purposes), they yell at you for sitting on the curb while waiting for your lyft, drinks suck, service sucks, the crowd is annoying-smelly-and rude, and music USED to be good now it's just stupid (not to mention that WHOLE back room smells like a dead homeless person and is a HUGE clusterfuck.) 

Save yourself, go somewhere else, you're welcome.
author: Courtney S.

description: Went here as a last minute resort after 12:45am and figured it would a sweet place to check out, having not been there ever but hearing things about it. There's a back room for dancing so I'd advise you to stand in the back in front of the huge fan to get your Yonce glow up. Don't recommend there since people physically move the flow of air to their backside like they can do whatevs they want. Watched a strong independent woman grind on a dude on the couch which then transferred to the floor and then everyone pulled out their phones so it became a snapchat story thing: super difficult to walk through dancing people, spilled my beer on some girl but luckily wasn't stuck by her slow mo fist of hormones. Would recommend standing in front of the fan tho if you have a sweating problem
author: Laurie M.

description:
I like this bar. I like to start my nights off here in Delirium and then venture further out in the Mission. The $3 mystery shots are always interesting, the crowd is great for people watching, and the bartenders could give two flying effs about any of it. The drink prices are low for San Francisco, keep in mind 90% of the Mission is cash only so don't say I didn't warn you. It's fine for what it is.  

Yes, it's not technically clean... There's no mirror in the women's restroom probably because someone smashed it at some point? Yes, I would describe the crowd as being border line pretentious/hipster-y. But I've never had any issues with the patrons here! They have seating around the bar, tables with high chairs and a corner booth, there's a pool table, and a back room where there's music and more tables with room to dance. Really can't complain. 

I had one incident here recently though where the bartender targeted us and kept accusing us of ordering a drink when we hadn't... I assumed some drunk girl had ordered it and then run off, forgetting that she had ordered. We tried to explain this to him, but he then counter attacked with "THIS AIN'T THE ORIENTAL AISLE" which was crazy to me, even for the Mission. Whatever. 

Delirium, you be crazy sometimes. *shrug*
author: Mariko M.

description: I went here on Feb 16, 2016 on Tuesday 11:30pm'sh for karaoke, Jess posted on facebook that he's throwing a gig.  I bought three beers: lagunitas ipa, blue moon, and Heineken, for $5.25 each(reasonable prices).  It's definitely a local hangout, I was able to sing three songs, this is for sure has a karaoke vibe versus other bars/clubs.  Regarding the beers, if they can just make it a few degrees cooler, I'll enjoy 'em that much more, I went to the restroom--interestingly filled with graffiti, but surprisingly wasn't dirty/stinky, but they could put some soap there. I met a few new friends here,
author: Jer W.

description:
I go more on the afternoon's/early evenings....But this is one of the gems of the Mission.....The Bartenders can actually pour!  Fair prices, pool, TV's, Jukebox make it a winner for me when I'm in town!
If you're a club kid they do have DJ's several nights a week in the back.  No idea about that cuz it's not my scene, but I do like the bartenders there.  My 2 cents!
author: Jim P.

description:
There's a ripe sense of self entitlement and everything wrong with San Francisco can be found here. If you don't have facial hair or dress like you jumped head first into the dumpster behind the good will you will be treated as an outcast here.

Bartender only served his hipster friends and waved me off when I called him over. When he did finally come over, I was over it, so I told him to fuck off and the sensitive little girl called the bouncer to kick me out! Eh, maybe I shouldn't have told him to fuck off but I have no regrets dude was a self entitled man child. I REGRET NOTHING
author: James R.

description: Really bad service and attitude from everyone that works here. Must be a locals only bar that caters to other douche bags.
author: Marlon R.

description:
Delirium is the kind of place my friends and I go when we're already a few drinks into the evening. We want a change of scenery, but feel stumped as to which Mission bar to indulge in a second round. For some reason, Delirium is usually one of the first bars suggested. Perhaps I have really grimy hipster friends, but I have no qualms about that. 

It's a classic example of a dive bar. The interior is really dark, so it might be a good place to bring a casual first date (unless you're going for something more romantic). The music wasn't too loud, so it was easy to carry on a conversation without screaming at each other. 

Drinks are cheap, but poorly executed. We ordered whiskey gingers, and the consensus was that they do not use ginger ale, but a mix of Coke and Sprite. It was more obvious with my friend who ordered a ginger back for her shot of whiskey. I tried a sip and pretty much gagged. 

Speaking of gagging... the bathrooms. Yeah. Enough said. 

The crowd was pretty much all dudes, with a few cute dogs sprinkled into the mix. I pet someone's pup (without asking, sorry!), and they did not seem very enthused about it. My bad. When I get a little buzz, I often throw common courtesy out the window and just go in straight for the puppy cuddles. I apologize to them in this Yelp review and hope that I can exercise better behavior on my next night out.
author: Brandi W.

description:
I had no idea there was a back room. The back room is what totally makes this place awesome. They were playing all sorts of great music back here and it's a good place to chill in the back.

Last time I was here they were playing punk and it seemed more divey-dive and cramped and crowded. Not sure if the back room is a new edition but it totally makes it worthwhile. 

I also spied pinball in the back...who wants to play?
author: Amy J.

description:
Yet another Mission dive bar. Not too impressed. We were actually waiting to eat next door at Monk's Kettle, but they were at max capacity so we decided to grab a drink here in the meantime. I will say the happy hour price is GOOD. We were there on a Sunday night and all the draft beers were only $4, what a steal!

The bartender was not attentive, it took awhile for us to order our drinks. And then our friend came out of the bathroom and it took awhile for him to get his drink too. We were trying to figure out how much it cost for way too long and got ignored a bit. I was trying to be friendly but maybe he was just having a bad day? 

It's kind of dirty/grungy, which is the typical mission dive bar appeal. Worth stopping for a happy hour drink but not somewhere I would hang for awhile.
author: Mandy A.

description: Extremely gross. Bouncer was rude and think he's the shit. No! You are just a short white, dumb asshole with anger issue and no one will respect you. Bartenders are mostly friendly.The bar itself is small and smells. The drinks are cheap, small and water down. This place trying to be a cheap dive bar but instead they make themselves trashy and ghetto. Only boring people and bros come here. Failed. I used to come here more often years ago with my friends. It was bad already. But now this just became my least favorite bar in the mission. Delirium was those bar where you just get one drink then you can move on to the next bar. Now I won't even bother to go in. Why would I go to a bar full of assholes, ugly bitches and bros again? I live and partying for 7 years in sf. I would just say this placed had changed and it is not worth going anymore.
author: Jd S.

description:
Ok so from the outside not really sure what you will get. But after desperately needing a beer and a bathroom decided to give it a shot. 
So it's a cash only bar, with a good selection of beer. And a very well stocked full bar. Two beers for under $10! My kind of place! It is your normal dive bar but if you don't need fancy this place is great for a drink.
author: Allison P.

description:
Somehow, inevitably whomever I go with to The Mission always wants to either start or end at this bar.

Always.

There are soooo many other bars in the area, yet my friends are drawn here.

It's a chill dive bar to grab a beer and play some bar pool in the back, because before 10:30 p.m. the place is empty, so that's where we started our pub crawl this time.

We hung out for a bit, but after an hour, we were ready to move on. 

There is a limit to the amount of times you must step aside while you're playing pool as people try to walk past you in their attempt to find the bathroom, only to discover that it's a doorway to nowhere. The bathroom is around the corner from the bar, people!

Come 10:30 p.m., it starts filling up to the point that you're packed in like a sardine if you weren't lucky enough to grab a table.

I've found the bartenders to be okay, however I've always just ordered a beer on tap and also had my ID at the ready, so that might have helped.
author: Diana V.

description: It's a fun place to have a drink. Bartenders can be rude. They are pissed off if you try to get their attention. Doesn't matter if busy, or slow
author: Irma P.

description:
Dive bar in the mission. Dark lighting with regular patrons who might give you a scowl or two if you don't have a facial piercing. 

Pros: Good music selection on the jukebox. $1 pool table and generally people who are down to play if you just want a pick up game. Mediocre beer selection.

Cons: As usual, the beer is overpriced and the patrons have an extra dose of that weird too-good-for-you attitude that is all too prevalent in the Mission. The bouncers have an especially uninviting attitude.
author: Jason K.

description: This place is to alcohol what a crackhouse is to drugs: a dark, depressing place full of depressing people who sit around getting obliterated and talking about nothing. Shit like this is why I moved out of the Midwest.
author: Jack P.

description:
I'm not sure if this bar is my excuse for going to Monk's on a busy weekend night, just so I can guzzle a few cheap cocktails while waiting for a table, or if Monk's is my excuse to have a reason to stop here.

Either way, Delirium may not be the best destination bar, but it is one of my favorite pitstops on the way elsewhere. Cheap, cheap drinks, the bartenders flex strong pouring muscles, and service is rendered fairly and quickly. 

If you're asking for anything more than a great dive, please take your hightail outta there so I can have that seat at the bar.
author: Ting S.

description:
Used to love this place. Would come any night of the week for the 70s 80s 90s generation djs & familiar faces.

Delirium in the last month has COMPLETELY changed their staff and the crowd has changed with that. Everything is different. 
Genuinely feel unsafe here now & do not trust the crowd
author: Gabri L.

description:
I'm gonna go somewhere else.

The crowd here sucks - a bunch of very young, judgy, hipster types. It was crowded and people were less than polite.

It's cash only. Sure, I know tons of places are, but I'm still gonna dock 'em a little bit for lack of flexibility.

The vibe is beyond dirty. Don't get me wrong, I adore a true dive bar. But I'm skeptical this would get through a health inspection. And yeah, it's one of the more "mission-y" bathrooms I've been in.

Bartenders were nice, we got pretty consistent service so much as I noticed.

Wow, sounds like I really didn't like this place? I'm agreeing with Jennifer L. looks and smells like a dive - but isn't. Maybe I was just in a grumpy mood. I guess if this is the divey vibe I'm looking for, I'd rather be at 500 Club instead.
author: Sarah B.

description: Typical dive bar that knows how to poor a drink!  Bring in your own food. They don't serve food.
author: M R.

description:
Alright, I'll admit it, I was already shitfaced by the time I got here so my memory may be a little foggy.

My friends and I were bar hopping in the mission and I remember someone telling me about this place and having relatively good music so we went to check it out. It was pretty packed but there is a huge area in the back that had more seating which I guess also served as the dance floor. We wanted to play pool but the pool table was covered. They told us at the front that there was no pool that night but my friends didn't hear and were sad they couldn't play haha. 

They had $3 PBR and $2 cans of Tecate. So cheap! My friend knew every song they were playing. Something along the lines of Rolling Stone and the likes. 

Its really easy to get the bartenders attention despite how packed the bar was on a Friday night. They patted all my guy friends down outside the bar though so watch out for that and don't try to sneak anything in!
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Forced to come here since we were meeting up with friends.
4 Stars for $2 Tacates and $3 PBRs and Self Serve Water
1 Star for 1 Fucking Stall in the Girls Bathroom - Seriously, what the fuck? The guys have 1 stall and 3 urials, and 1 star for the shitty parking.
2 Stars for the crowd. People who outgrew hometown bars and moved to the city but have a 6 roomates and a shitty job but still blow coke like there's no tomorrow and drink too much because they forgot they left college 4 years ago.
3 stars for the fact that I thought that there was a line and we'd have to wait to get in, but it turned out there were just 20 people smoking outside
Does that equal 3 stars?
author: Kajal G.

description: Not the best place but yet again with these scummy dive bars charging a 5 dollar cover. Greed is all that money goes to. They won't fix the pool tables or the bathrooms they just take your money. On par with beauty bar minus the coked out Russian chick. The bar staff actually respect you here
author: Brandon C.

description:
I can't say I really remember Delirium being anything that great.

The bar is divey. The music is okay, but not great to dance to. The girl's bathroom is...abysmal. Like, I get that it's kind of "grunge trendy"... but COME ON. I don't want to feel like some STI is creeping up my bunghole if I squat 6 inches over the seat. 

It was pretty forgettable. And I wasn't that drunk when I came here, so... yeah. I dunno. I like that Mission grunge, but I think I need to draw the line somewhere.
author: Jade R.

description: I want TRAVIS back. Best bartender who remembers people, doesn't play country music and has fresh fruit everyday. This bar is weird without him during the day. No one should be allowed to play country music in here
author: Nicole C.

description: Used to be a great spot to dance in the back.  Now is overcrowded and the music changed. Crowd has gotten shady. Drinks are overpriced and bad.  Most people come here on Friday nights after they have already been drinking,  resulting in the adjacent street being full of puke. Bouncers are obnoxious,  was yelled at for sitting on the curb nearby when I was not even a patron of the bar.  RIP Delirium.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Well, in the magical two-hour time span I was here, I witnessed two bar brawls break out of nowhere AND an aggressive/drunk lady pool table hu$tla wrassle my friend. WORSE YET the DJ kept KILLIN MY VIBE in between songs cuz he could not mix tracks or beatz for shit, and I just had the biggest, hardest, veiniest dance boner to itch!!! But despite all this cray in tha bay, I HAD A DAMN GOOD TIME. And i wasn't even that crank since I don't drank.

LUV U DELIRIUM U REALLY LIVE UP 2 UR NAME
author: Jen T.

description:
Probably not for the faint of heart, but certainly an interesting experience.

I came here on a Saturday night after dinner, around 10 pm, and stayed for two hours. Most of the time we spent in the back room on the dance floor - they had an '80s night, which was unexpected and pretty good.

If there's a definition to be had for some of the more negative connotations of the term "dive bar", then this might be pretty close to it. I found the atmosphere a little tense, but I didn't think it was unsafe and everyone seemed to be having a good time. Our group certainly did!

I probably wouldn't come here regularly, but I can see the appeal and in my opinion if you're in the area it's worth checking it out at least once!
author: Seán O.

description:
The last time I came here, I was with a couple friends, and all hell broke loose. A helplessly drunk guy approached within 5 minutes and got way too friendly with my female friends at our table, and I could only get him to relent by saying that I was a mormon, and that my friends were my harem. He believed me on the first try, fortunately, and he merrily went his way in the arms of the bouncer at the front door. The bathroom was insanely spray painted, and the people around the pool table seemed to be looking for a brawl with the middle schoolers dancing in the back room to a DJ that seemed to da-nc-e to th-e be-a-t of-a differ-nt druh-mer.

This is not for everyone, I understand, but if your kind of bar is the type that sells two dollar Tecate every night of the week, has a jukebox that dates back to the early eighties, and you can play pool and drink whisky with a diverse and rowdy crew, this is your place. Punk bars like this need your love. Don't worry about looking like a hipster, just go for the good time, you won't miss it.
author: Gordon M.

description:
I was a child of the 80s, literally. I don't remember so much about it other than TMNT. But that doesn't stop me from appreciating 80s music and just about everything else it had to offer.

My friend and I came here earlier in the night on a Saturday and not too much was going on. She was surprised by how empty the back room was. Within an hour or so it completely filled up. The 80s blasted and we danced and drank our PBRs (draught, not tall boys: sadness).
author: Ericka A.

description:
Delirium is the cream of the crop when it comes to dive bars in San Francisco. I've been patronizing this little gem for several years, and it is all of the things a dive bar should be a more. Let me explain:

1. Dark, dirty, someone may have died here at some point. Classic dive. Graffiti all over the bathrooms. I used to make it a point of of getting drunk with my old roommate here and then writing inappropriate things about ourselves on the bathroom walls. I have gotta several random text messages from friends that say something like, "Do you know it says you give ball-cuzzis on the bathroom wall in Delirium!!!?" --- yes, yes I do know that.

2. GENEA! The greatest bartender ever. She's an angel from heaven, and as long as you don't act like a twat, she's a peach.

3. Cheap, cheap, cheap.... I get drunk for less than $30 here. That's a beautiful thing. I work at a bar where a shot of Jameson will run you $9, so the $5 over sized shots of J-MO I get here are certainly a blessing.

4. Entertainment everywhere. Walk in the back, the front, the bathroom, the alley (Albion) right outside. Solid gold Mission entertainment.

5. John Waters hangs out here. Seriously. Pink Flamingos John Waters. I met him here once.

6. Regardless of how many hundreds of times I've been here, one of the door guys, Mike, will never remember me. Ever.

If you don't like Delirium it is probably because you're a stuck up prat who doesn't like to party and hates life and kittens and cake.
author: Jessi M.

description: Cheap shots of Jameson! $6, pretty dive'y this is more of a quick tip than a review.  Bartenders were cool, I believe this place was cash only.
author: Spencer W.

description:
I had been playing Batman on PS3 for 11 hours straight when I was persuaded to head out. Could I make myself leave? I was just about to whoop up on Poison Ivy, should I really break my groove just to go drink?

Hmmm....

Dennis is convincing, I was sold on the premise of pool so off I went to the Mission. Kilowatt was an epic fail with about 20 people waiting around to play. What the hell is that? I stood there for a minute trying to think... there was a bar around here that had a pool table, what was it... oh yah, Delirium!

Delirium served it's purpose well, the PBR is cheap, the people friendly, and the pool table... um... pool table-ish. At any given time only 1 or 2 people waiting to play, not bad at all. I'd still be standing at Kilowat today 4 days later, waiting on my turn.

If you're some fancy schmancy pool player with your own cue and high expectations, hold up. The pool table is merely satisfactory, this is no pool hall. The walls are so close you have to angle the cue at 45 degrees to make half the shots. There are 8 solids and 6 stripes. There are 20 people milling about near the table, messing up your shot at any given time.

But if you're one like me who enjoys shooting some pool (regardless of quality) while hanging with pals, then this is the place. Next time Gestalt or Kilowatt are overflowing with people trying to flex their pool skills just say fuck it and roll to Delirium. I'd rather play on a so-so table than stand around not playing on good ones.
author: Justin N.

description:
I used to play laser storm a lot. The inside of the room was spray painted entirely black with neon blue and pink and green spray paint on the walls. And then they'd throw on a fog machine and some killer techno and all you'd hear is "pew pew pew" and when you got shot "KABOOM! Energize. *beep* Energize. *beep*"

I swear this place needs techno and some fog and it'd be exactly the same, and that after 3 $2 tecates that would make it the most awesome bar on the face of the earth. 

But they had adult swim on, and it happened to be Aqua Teen Hunger Force so that was pretty awesome by itself.
author: Emily D.

description:
I like Delirium mainly because it's pretty simple: cheap drinks, dive bar atmosphere filled with hipsters, and an awesome bathroom decor hahha. 

There is a dance floor but I wasn't too interested as the internal temperature of the bar was pretty hot. And this was in October. 

Overall I liked the vibe of this dive and would go back, just wouldn't stay for too long. Great spot for a Pre-Pre game.
author: Yelper H.

description: If you can't have fun at this bar, then you should probably relax.  This bar is a mission standard where 21 year olds go to cut their teeth on tecate, and where the locals go to drink a shot and eat some free BBQ.  The bartenders are as badass as you'd want them to be on 16th street. Plus the back room has a dj every night and, gasp, people are actually dancing! The bathrooms are legendary.
author: Leslie H.

description: Overall really fun place! My friend suggested for my birthday after an event - cheap drinks, good area to hang out and talk, then dance floor in the back was great too. The dj that night was pretty pretentious, wouldn't take a song request for my birthday (or any at all) I thought that was rude. Other than that a good time
author: Shivan M.

description: Cheap drinks. Awesome staff. Pool table. Back room with a dj and dance floor. Cool little dive bar tucked away in the mission, I really like this place.
author: Louis C.

description:
$2 tecate
80s music

i come here so many times with a lot of my friend

not really worth coming before 11pm tho
author: Brian W.

description:
Stumbled in here drunk last night and was pleasantly surprised. Drinks came fast despite the crowd. The dance floor in the back was bumpin and a girl even grabbed me for some grinding... in front of my wife. Hah. The place, like others in the Mission was literally covered in graffiti which I love. 

Last but not least, randomly, John Waters was there when we were leaving.

What an awesome, lively place I found on accident.
author: Pete F.

description:
I remember coming into Delirium countless times, but I never remember leaving. As far as I'm concerned, that's an excellent sign.

A girlfriend and I hit up this place regularly to pound $4.50 mixed drinks and be disasters - I'd like to take this moment to issue formal apologies to every innocent bystander sitting there when we roll in. Drinks are strong (yay!) and the pool table in the back is always fun, although it gets pretty crowded at like 10:30pm.

The last time I was there, I discovered the dance floor in the back. I don't know how I've been missing it, and yes, the walls tend to sweat, but for whatever reason they were just JAMMIN' the 80s music and it was a phenomenal evening. Is it just me, or does 80s music sound even better after one or two (or five or six) gin and tonics? 

Anyways - strong, cheap drinks, laid-back atmosphere, fun little dive bar.
author: Alec S.

description: $2 Tecate!
author: Misha T.

description:
Came here with a group of friends one random night.

They have an okay beer selection & the drinks are decent priced. Paid 9 for a tokyo tea and was able to grab a table. This place gets crowded fast because after we ordered our drinks, sat down & relaxed with my friends, we had to go past a huge glob of people to get to the exit. Not many people on the dance floor though.

The bathroom is scary & gross & just something I would not like to deal with. But hey, when you gotta go, you gotta go.
author: Erish M.

description:
Dive bar with not much going on, except you can be sure to find the crowd.  Some friends like to go here at the end of the night for a cheap can of beer.  I've been the only one holding a real glass of beer, because why would I drink piss water when there's perfectly good beer on tap? Small dance room in back is fun and dark, but no ventilation so it's always hot and stinky.  
They YELL at you to get out at 1:30am.  Not last call, and then finish up--no, no, it's get-the-hell-out 30 minutes early.  I give it 3 stars, because, hey, it's a dive bar...can't expect much.
author: SL B.

description:
This is my favorite bar in The Mission.  I love the name and the interior.  I don't know if you could call it Keroucian but it definitely strikes me in exactly that sense. It's always very dark, there's funny signs and shit on the walls, there's SF sports teams on the TVs, the drinks are strong and cheap, the bartenders are all great, and the regulars are all interesting characters.  What's not to love if you're like me and you're a people watcher?

So we are clear, if you don't love dive bars, and you aren't into semi-weird little holes in the wall this place might not be for you.  I could see that, I guess.

But for me I love this little bar.  There is a pool table that is used just infrequently enough that it doesn't seem like there's any line or anything.  Everyone I played was good, the pool table and cues are all in good shape.  Little details, I guess - they even have a mini cue stick because the table's close to a wall.  I actually guess this could be common but I actually hadn't seen one like it before, I thought it was cool.

They have a dance floor, although that isn't my thing unless I'm at a show.  But it's big enough, two levels, and it seems there's usually a few people in there.  There's a Pac Man and pinball machine for nerds like me.

To reiterate if you haven't got the message: $2 Tecate and if I remember correctly I think it may be $2 Tecate / $2 Tequila all day, I can't remember, which is a good sign for a bar.  Happy hour is $2 PBR and cheap shots as well.  Otherwise they can mix you up whatever else you want for standard prices they put out plenty of $8 martinis and margaritas and I've seen lots of different stuff made behind their bar so it's not just cheap drinks, if you want a quality cocktail or something custom, Delirium will treat you right.
author: Jon P.

description:
Great place to end the evening.

I couldn't stand being in Kilowatt for a minute more while my friends argued with some OG's about who's turn it was to play pool.  It was too crowded to play pool! I made a suggestion to go to Delirium , mainly because it is across the street . 

It was a good decision.
I'm very pleased to have encountered the dance floor.

Shake your little hipster heart out to some Ace of Base and Michael Jackson (WIN) or do as I did and slam beers while trying to beat your own high score on Mrs. Pac Man. Such cheese. I do, I like it. I like it alot.
author: Hannah A.

description:
I really hate that my friends insist on going here when there are at least a half dozen other reasonable bars within 2 blocks. 

Beer selection is OK, and they have some drink specials that draw me in, but the bartenders are *awful.*  Like.. they'll just sit there messing around behind the bar, ignoring patrons waiting for drinks, even when it's not that busy.   I've also never had a decent pour for liquor/mixed drinks here.  Effing weak, every time!
author: Heidi M.

description:
I stopped by here on a friday night after retreating from monk's kettle next door.

It was happening, but once you walked in it was still relatively easy to get a drink. The bartenders were on top of it besides the fact the bar was utterly packed full of patrons.

I felt like I was back in the late 80s (music wise) and amongst the 1990s crowd of my youth. People were dressed in casual to girls night out attire, and dancing like nobody cared.

It was refreshing to see my peers having fun, dressing however, and listening to ace of base and BBD.

I sipped a $2 12oz tecate can and then got out with a smile on my face.

Enjoyable yet divey as hell! Nice
author: Mikey O.

description: The bartenders were great and attentive. The dudes kicking everybody out at closing should probably take themselves a LITTLE less seriously.
author: Matt S.

description:
They play 80s/90s music in the back room.  Lots of space to dance but it kind of makes it awkward when you have too much space on the dance floor.  But seeing as how double dutch can get too crowded, this is a nice option.  

I forced my friend to pee in the men's bathroom b/c the women's line was too long and she said she caught an STD on her hand.
author: Christine B.

description:
Delirium is alright.  The people are strange and the place is kind of dingy and gross, specifically the women's bathroom.  The women's bathroom makes me want to bathe head to toe in Purell.  Cheap beer, but if that mean's I'll need to pee in that filthy bathroom every 5 minutes, I'm good.

I'll most likely come here only if I'm already drunk, and have pre-urinated somewhere else.
author: Nancy R.

description:
There's a huge neon sign above the bar that looks like "Delirium Cock" from certain angles (no, really: http://a5.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-snc6/hs279.snc6/180744_1631947513001_1066020027_1328061_4266440_n.jpg). We knew we had to check it out. 

Delirium is:
$2 tecates
Boys in plaid and girls in Toms
Pool table
Pinball machines
Dancing to MJ and Cindy Lauper

Unabashedly divey and incredibly fun. Admittedly not everyone's scene, but if you're looking for a chill place to knock back a few beers and/or groove to some serious 80's music, drop in. Grab a mission dog right outside and you've got yourself a perfect Friday night.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Great little dive bar in the Mission, I found myself frequenting often. They have a great happy hour, nice bartenders and stiff drinks. There's a pool table in the back and a back room where DJ's keep the music bumping with a nice lil dance floor.

More importantly, the main point of this review is to highlight an amazing find for this place on Sundays. Bloody Sundays. They have incredible bloody mary's for $5 on Sundays as well as a few other scrumptious specialty drinks. But, there's something about their Bloody's that keep me going back. Being a huge bloody mary fan I'm always seeking out the best of the best and these ones are right up there. They are a sweet and tangy bloody, lots of worcestershire and a little bit of juice poured out of the dill pickle jar. They are a must try!
author: Uriah B.

description:
Dear Straight Boys of Delirium: 

I am a patron of Delirium on the weekends. I would like for you to talk to me. When you see me chatting with my friends (who even if they are boys are not my boyfriend!), I am hoping you will ask me to dance / buy me a drink. Whenever I am at Delirium, I feel like I am in jr. high again except I am not in a brand new JC Penney's dress, I am wearing something far prettier. 

I have wanted to go up to you except you are standing with all of your guy friends, or you just started dancing with some other girl, or forgive me, I have spent the entire night trying to figure out whether you are gay or not. 

I dance to the eighties pop tunes, trying to appear uninhibited, to look as though I am radiating the pleasure of Saturday nights out. I buy drinks to give my hands something to do, to give me liquid courage in case I might work up the nerve to talk to your messy handsomeness, or your mild mannered gentle face or maybe your intimidating drop dead prettiness. 

I am having a good time with my friends. I enjoy hearing Wire, and Iggy Pop blaring in a bar on the weekends. The beer I drink goes to my head and makes me giggle. I am happy I am not at home. A few words from you would complete my evenings nicely. 

Love,
Netty
author: Netty L.

description:
Delirium is your neighborhood dive bar. Eff-to-the-yes! Straight out of SJ, I felt so out of place but I liked it......the first 15 minutes! Made me feel like a rockstar with funny looks by random strangers and a bartender who was a complete douche-bag d*** (I'll just say PRICK). I came in out of curiosity after hearing about the random rants of good music, cheap drinks, and happy hour. Let me tell you, NOT worth it at all!!!

The place is clean, great jukebox selection, easy to enjoy video games, tv screens, and a free pool table. I like these perks. Especially with a cheap drink in hand. The problem...bartender. Yeah, cheap thrills for nothing! I kindly asked for a Steam Anchor hoping to get the $2-3 happy hour deal. Nope. I didn't get it at all. I was ripped off from the get-go. With the sign "service for the sick", I was literally sick of this place the minute he gave attitude, threw my coaster and pounded my beer down the table. What is your problem?!

They have their so-called daily happy hour until 7pm for their $2 Tecate, PBR Pints and their other beer for $3 excludes Chimay. If you come in for their happy hour deal on their food, be aware it's only for their already placed paper plate of 5 BBQ wings, one small plate of wilted lettuce and carrots, and hot dogs split s*** in half and give you old-crummy hot dog buns with their $2 minimum charge of a drink.  Glamorous? HA!

The place was okay for the warm tasting beer but I never want to touch their BBQ chicken again! Who the hell made that crap?! The bartender? I bet it was him because he was nothing but rude!! I guess I wasn't trashy enough to be in the bar. Thanks for nothing a**hole! Oh....tip? Here's a tip....you're probably delirious but you better be nice to your customers before the bar goes into s***!! Worst service I've received in SF from a dive bar. I've been to better places but I'm never coming here again. No wonder this place has low star ratings.
author: Fraulein C.

description:
So this one time, I went to this bar on a Saturday afternoon and I went to use the restroom, and I didn't see the ladies room to the left (because it's not very well labeled, just some hard to read blue spray paint on a black door), and I walked straight into the one bathroom that was open.  It was open because some of the employees were doing construction in there.  They had to point me to the correct bathroom.  AWKWARD, but they were super nice about it and I wasn't TOO embarrassed.  

ANYWAY, pretty mellow place, they had the beers I wanted and the staff was nice.
author: Jackee K.

description:
I am so upset. When I lived here two years ago, Delerium was my go-to place for fun 80's dance music. I craved it and went all the time.

Tonight I went to Delerium to dance. I got my whole crew together and we were so ready to roll. We weren't the only ones. The back room was pretty packed with people who were waiting to jam out to Depeche Mode and other goodies. 

Instead, all we got was angry death metal. I asked the DJ what was up and I swear I thought he was going to eat me - he was so scary. When my female friend approached him he said, "I am a very depressed man. If I had a nickel for every time somebody told me I sucked, I would be rich." He then proceeded to proposition her. And even after that he played CRAPPY music. 

So many people peered in, confused, and he just wanted to screw us; for us to be as depressed as he was. And, he succeeded. Except not really. I have a good job and a good life. So, screw you DJ, and screw you, Delerium.
author: Andrew K.

description: While an unnamed friend of mine may refer to this place as a "coked out den of psychos" I find it a pleasant spot for a Sunday bloody Mary. They even cook food and offer it free to the daring
author: Martin R.

description:
Delirium is the bomb. It has the perfect amount of dive-y charm and personality, with not too much attitude.

This is the first bar where I've ever seen the bartender turn away a ridiculously intoxicated customer. Yes, it gets that wild here. And no, it wasn't me.

On the weeknights, you can easily pull up a stool, pick one of the several beers on tap to sip on and just chill. The bartender is polite and attentive. On the weekends, prepare for standing room only and lots of debauchery. I hear there's happy hour everyday, and they even BBQ!

Though from the handful of times I've been here, I have still never made it to the back room but I already think I've found my favorite bar in the Mission! Rock on, Delirium.

-1 star for repeatedly serving me a slice of LEMON with my Blue Moon.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Cheap, dirty and dancing. Always fun! Warning the bathroom is pretty nasty, but is that a surprise.
author: Sarah F.

description:
We randomly picked this bar and it was pretty chill. I didn't try to buy any cocktails, but I did order a Sierra Nevada and it was 5 bucks, so that wasn't too bad. I loved their neon sign, "SERVICE FOR THE SICK" and their bathroom is a graffiti wall for the girls. You can just take out a pen and write on it. Ghetto. 

Def a dive bar, so I liked it a lot. A few beardies with flannels swarmed the place. The bar looks like it would be hard to cram in a lot of people. There are tables parallel from the bar and the middle gets congested sometimes. 

The people seemed friendly, the bouncer photobombed all my pictures which was funny. Good place to check out.
author: Danneth C.

description:
I wanted to stop in cuz they have "service for the sick".  I was filling a little ill, and I parked on Albion, so I thought I'd stop in after I got some shopping done at a boutique around the corner.  Sigh, I missed Happy Hour by 10 minutes.  Okay, I guess I'll pay $5 for Anchor Steam?.
warm glasses = warm beer. 
at least there were hot dogs from their bbq a few hours ago.
the atm was out of money.
had to go to the market next door.
at least the juke was blastin' Run to the hills. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u5Snehl2bAk
Service was decent at best.
oh no!  I have to use the restroom!  at least it was only #1.  Nasteeee.
and then, both employees were outside hangin' out while the whole bar was full and needed service.  Ha! service for the sick.  Definitely a dive, but not worth another visit.
author: Joshua K.

description:
The Delirium Bar was a great venue to throw a party for my friends. The bartenders were great and very friendly.

Drink Prices were inexpensive and everyone had  a great time!

Thanks Angelo!
author: Dean C.

description: Me and my buddies love this haunt... the crowd are all pretty nice and the music is fantastic in the backroom... great if you just want to come and chat/play pool/ or dance... I love how drama free this bar is compared to most bars... There's almost no hip hop or the crowds that comes with it... definitely recommended for any casual occasions...
author: Nathan D.

description:
was looking for a bar with music to dance to. passed by the first time and didn't hear much, but turns out there's a dance floor in the backroom of the bar. so make sure to go to the back if you wanna dance!

very hipster bar. no cover, well drinks & beer were only $5. blue moon and stella on tap.

met some cool people there - 3 guys from Ireland. fun place to drink, chill and socialize with random people.
author: Christine C.

description:
Update: 10/20/2007

After having dinner at We Be Sushi, my roomie and I decided to head over to Delirium because it was closer than Zeitgeist.  It was crowded as always.  We ordered our cold pint of Stella Artois and walked towards the back only to find out that smoking was not allowed anymore.  Bummer.  NO SMOKING.  I guess it's better for all of us that smoking is not permitted inside the bar anymore.  

As we light up with other smokers outside the bar, we saw some pretty crazy people.  A woman on the phone in tears screaming at what it seems like a boyfriend, or girlfriend, then minutes later after hanging up, making out with a guy which obviously she just met.  Gross.  

Inside, more interesting individuals.  A woman at a bar by herself talking to a group of random guys.  She was nice.  I think her name was Nicole.  One of the guy she was talking to approached my roommate.  Got a little too close. 

Random Guy: "Want to smoke some weed."
Si-Eun: ignoring
Random Guy: "Wanna go home with me... no pressure."
Si-Eun: "What do you mean?"
Random Guy: "Is that a no."  Then he started mumbling to himself.
Si-Eun: continued to ignore
Random Guy: flips her off.  What an as*hole.  

We downed our beers and headed home, wishing we never left our perfect neighborhood, The North Beach.  As we walked towards BART, I kept saying in my head... "there's no place like home, there's no place like home," over and over and over until finally we made it home :-)!


---------*----------------*--------------*------------*
Thursday: 12/72006 
- 10:10p Arrival
- 11:30p Departure

I like this bar, but not when it's crowded because some people are just so rude and doesn't know how to say "excuse me."  There's a pool table and a separate smoking room.  The bartender was extra nice and attentive considering how crowded it was.  Pints of PBR just kept on comin' -- 4 each to be exact :-)!

I was digging the bathroom -- I liked all the graffiti on the wall given it smelled and was very dirty.  Tagging on a public bathroom wall was fun.  There was a pink Sharpie pen by the sink -- I picked up the pen, wrote my name on the wall, then took a picture of it to post on Yelp (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LIjMD-PXdrjEAykKVoAiLw?select=yO74nUMNO73rTD0xhZr2iQ).  

I think I've inhaled the most second hand smoke I have ever had last night at Delirium's smoking room.  It didn't help that my date smoked like a camel (a cigarette every 5 minutes) either.  

Would go back here again, but will totally try to avoid going into the smoking room even though it was awesome watching people bumping and grinding on the dance floor.
author: Celeste M.

description:
I wish I could write a review of this place, but my husband and his friend -- both foreign-born -- were not allowed inside.  We were told that because they didn't have US driver's licenses or passports, we would not be allowed inside because of a recent crackdown/fine.

I understand that Delirium doesn't make these rules, but it's cowardly to enforce them.  You operate in an immigrant neighborhood and this rule overwhelmingly discriminates against immigrants (many of whom can't get driver's licenses and either don't have or can't risk taking national passports out at night).  Either get some cojones and stick up for your patrons, or get out of the Mission.
author: Maria F.

description: Oh man, this place is dark and crowded and fun and a bit wild. The back room was secluded while the front was a big crazy party! Definitely a great Mission bar! I did buy a drink here and it was cheap, I love it!
author: Lizzy M.

description:
My friends and I were on Potrero and planning on going to Thee Parkside. One problem - place was closed. So what does a group of thirsty drunks do? Walk our asses to the Mission, of course. We had some healthy (contentious) debate about where to go, but eventually ended up at Delirium.

Perfect lighting, not too crowded, very friendly bartender. Shitty pour, but I've found that to be the norm and I probably should've been having beer anyway. This was a great place to ease our raging alcoholism before scooting on for more adventures. Two jaundiced thumbs up!
author: Corinna K.

description:
This place creeeeeeped me out and I was just walking by!!! If the vibe the bouncers give to mere passers-by was this bad, I can't even IMAGINE how horrible this place is inside. A bouncer supposedly name "tommy" was so tweaked out of his mind I wanted to call the police...I was just passing by looking for directions and his aggressive approach to clearing the sidewalk made me feel like we were in the middle of a drug deal! I have never been so insulted, belittled and verbally abused in my life. STAY AWAY!!' when I tried asking the man at the front door his name and he just blew me off. Hey, I'm not expecting the Bellagio here, I know it's a "dive bar" in a "seedy area" but when you can't even stand on public property and look for directions without being harassed, STAY AWAY!!!

P.S. if a manager or owner wants to contact me, I'd be MORE than happy to talk! Thanks!
author: Rio W.

description:
Do you love getting awkwardly scoped out? Go here! The bouncer is very skeptical of anyone who looks under the age of 40... he will look you up & down with his judge face for daaaays. 

Do you love getting your shoes resoled? Go here! The floors are covered in booze, glass, & other unknown substances that are sure to eff up your kicks.

Do you love feeling other people's sweat on your body? Go here! You won't even have to ask permission to rub up on anyone in particular, hip guys in tank tops will just come up behind you & slide all over you... so refreshing!

Do you love waiting 20 minutes to get a drink? Go here! They only staff two bartenders on Saturday nights &, if you're lucky, you won't even be able to get their attention.

Do you love feeling like you can't breath? Go here! There is absolutely no ventilation, especially in the sauna... I mean... dance room... in the back.

Do you love excessive PDA? Go here!  Everywhere you turn there will be people sticking their tongues down each other's throats. Sometimes they even do it laying down on the pool table... score!

Do you love the aromatic scent of body odor, stale beer, & dirty, ironic, hipster mustaches? Go here! It smells better than freshly baked cookies.

Maybe it's a little presumptuous of me to say this because I've only been to Delirium once BUT, I hate this damn bar.
author: Lizzy L.

description: I came here last weekend for the second time. True, there are some douche-y figures here. The bathroom is not the best. But the music is really good and the drinks strong enough. It is definitely a dive atmosphere with plenty of people trying to pick up. It's not first on my list to go to, but still pretty fun.
author: Cristina O.

description:
Purse lifters galore. WARNING: The security seem to me to be pretty typical lazy hire-my-buddy to be bouncer kinda deal. Shit gets stolen and the staff doesn't seem to care. A lady who was upset cause she was robbed was told "welcome to the mission" by the bouncer dude - who doesn't even look like he's been in SF very long at all. However, he did grow a scruffy beard to fit in. 

Plusses: There is a lady bartendress who makes good generous cocktails. She was cool. And the music is pretty much lazy where they just spin top 40 80's music that weekend out of towners love to get drunk over. If you're into that you might love this place. I enjoyed dancing here. It's hard to resist catchy top 40's. But then you feel stupid afterwards.

Overall, I liked it better when it was Albion. Not that they would have scored higher points. But at least it felt more like a neighborhood bar. And security didn't get off on yelling at customers to get out at closing time. Rude.
author: Esso E.

description:
Went here twice yesterday - once for a pirate treasure hunt, the other to finish off the night dancing. 

All in all I dug this place. I didn't spend much time in the bar section, but definitely hung out on the dancefloor. I liked the vibe of the people there and loved that there was room to dance even though the room felt full. Plus, it's hard to beat Tecate for $2-3. WIN!

My only complaint was that I requested a song and the DJ said 'maybe later' because he was stuck on an 80's kick.
author: Maggie F.

description:
I come here usually with friends to hang out or birthday celebrations.  Cheap beers for $2 is worth paying like Tacate or PBR when you try to save money. The dance floor can get hot with people's perspiration. The music the DJ play is mainly rock, alternative, 70s disco or 80's pop/rock. If you're hungry, there many restaurants or bacon-wrap hot dog stands outside the bar. 

There was this one night when I went to the restroom to take a leak, some random dude was having sex with a chick in the toliet stall of the men restroom. Like c'om get a god damn room because there other people who really need to use the restroom.
author: Richard C.

description:
I used to come to this place before the mission got incredibly invaded by hipsters. I hang def hang with that crowd, since it has become such a scene in the Mission, but it gets overwhelming at times. It's a small and narrow bar, and on most weekends, it can be very difficult to maneuver, find a seat, or get a tamale from the tamale lady. 

I like coming here on weeknights since there are always people, and you can actually breathe a little. 

I do like, however, that they have a small back room for dj's and dance parties. I think it's essential for any bar. Also, not that this makes it or breaks it, but they sell the cutest baby sized MGDs. It's probably only a few sips, but I love the novelty. And, drinks are cheap. 

All in all, one of my more recommended choices for dive bars in the Mission. If you don't like crowds or hipsters, this isn't the place for you. But nonetheless, I'd check it out on weeknights. See you there.
author: Nicole K.

description: the bartenders are always hospitable, but the door man is an ass hole. I am old enough to drink by many years and am happy enough to show some proof of such. He needs to extend some sort of mild personality and welcome-ness or else you will continue to me be dead thru out the week. 3/5/13 I wanna love this bar...
author: Ashley R.

description: I really like this bar, I go there during the week mostly, I leave the weekends for those that want a crazy, semi-annoying night. The place is divey, which I love. The drinks are cheap and the bartenders are awesome. My favorite bartender is Kelly Anne, very friendly. This place is great to hang out and relax with some cheap drinks.
author: Michi R.

description:
{Pros:}
Cheap beer
Dance room

{Cons:}
Crowded bottlenecks
Slow bartenders
Plastic shot glasses
The same dj mix every single weekend
It gets way too hot in there
Useless pool table with no room to play
Below average arcade games
Disgusting bathroom

Summary: best to go there drunk from 11:35 thru 11:45
author: Captain B.

description: One of the worst bars I've been to in the city. Came to the bar at 1:30 with a girl. I was on a date and I had no cash left. I paid with the last notes I had left. The bar tender was pissed because he had no tip (he was very impolite and rude and didn't deserve a single cent of tip) took our drinks 3 min after ordering them and threw them over in the tap without asking us and at 1:30, 30 min  before the legal hour to stop serving customers. Then the bartender came out of the bat and kicked us out of the bar saying :"this is America you don't tip you leave the place". The staff here was rude and racist. I would have tipped as usual if I had cash but instead I was welcomed with very rude comments. I think this place deserves to be deserted by any person who has a sense of open-mindedness. Kicking out a customer because of not tipping and your ATM not working is a joke. I hope future clients will avoid this place.
author: Ali B.

description: Pretty sure the bouncers are the ones stealing.  My purse was stolen with my iphone in it of course-- right after I told the bouncer I left it right inside. He said it was fine and he would be there so he wouldn't check it again.  All of the sudden he was gone and so was my purse.  New bouncers at the door acted like it was no big deal and let me back in.   Guess I learned my lesson.  Should have read reviews on here before.
author: Michelle J.

description: Came here with a large group of friends who wanted to dance. As far as music selection goes, there was a great mix of 90's Hip Hop, 00's Rap and Dance music and some rock like The Strokes. The vibe is interesting; the dance floor is set in the back and is dark and not too big. The bar area itself is a little small. Not a bad place to go, but nothing standout or spectacular about it either.
author: Eric L.

description:
Within the first 10 minutes we ran through some Ace of Bass, Billy Jean, and some Dr. Dre from the late 90's.

Sometimes these bars with dance floors can out hipster themselves on music selection, but this DJ was spot on.  

Super reasonable drinks.  With the right crowd  Delirium can be a really good time.
author: Bruce P.

description: Fun dive with a young crowd. I was swarmed by a Halloween bar crawl but still got a drink in under 5 min.
author: Michael M.

description: bouncer said my ID wasn't valid and threatened to call the police unless I paid him $50
author: Alyssa U.

description:
I discovered the term "Hipsters" when I moved to SF. Now I know what to call: scrawny-tight-sweater-skinny-jeans-trucker-cap-ironic-mustache-looking dudes. 

PBR, MGMT, and HIPSTERS sum up my NYE of 2009. 

I would have given this place an additional star if it wasn't for the creepy drunk hipster who kept talking about my female energy and helped himself to stick his tongue* in my ear. 

*Your tongue was NOT welcomed in my ear!
author: Enji L.

description:
This is one of my favorite dive bars in the mission. I mostly like that they have a dance floor in the back room and cheap drinks. However, this place gets super crowded on the weekends so it becomes difficult to to walk around or get to the bar. I recommend getting as many drinks from the bar as possible at one time to avoid being pushed around at the bar. 

The decor is very dive-y, with graffiti all over the walls. The bathrooms have no mirrors and are basically covered in writing. Overall, I would say that this is a good bar for those looking specifically for a dive bar.
author: Kate G.

description: This is not a critic on the entire bar but the service of a bartender there named Travis. I came to the bar with a group of women. We patiently waited for a drink for what we all thought was a excessively long time. When my wife ordered a drink I ordered a beer. She ordered a Vodka Gimlet I told her that she should use Russian standard because it is a really good vodka. Travis brings us a Gimlet, a beer, and a drink special that they run at the bar called a Russian standard splash, I think something like that. I tell Travis that I was not ordering a mixed drink I was talking to my wife. I told him I don't want it I didn't order it. He looked at me with disdain and said  "it's loud sounded like you ordered it to me and you need to pay for your drinks." I was not even speaking to him to order a mixed drink he heard me speak to my wife which negates it being to hard to hear. Standing there expecting me to pay for a drink that I did not order was so offensive I wanted to pour it over his head. Instead of causing a large scene I paid for the drinks and gave the extra drink away. I told him twice I did not order it and I do not want it. I should have just left. I had quite a few friends so that is why I did not just bounce nor make a scene. I never worked with nor seen someone make a mistake and make the customer pay for it.  even though it was busy I have been in and around food service and bartending for about two decades. I worked in Bars like Zeitgeist and Midtown that is now called Moltovs in Lower Haight and Upper Haight at bars like the full moon saloon that are no longer around.t. I never ever had a bartender pour me a drink that I did not order and then give me a truly vile attitude to pay for it. I walked into t crowded bar and realized it might take time to get a drink. I understanding having patience on a busy night. I and the people around me felt ignored repeatedly by this guy Travis walking buy entire swaths of people that had been waiting for his service over and over and after I heard three different groups speak on his attitude I realized it was not just me. I never before wrote a bad review on a single person and I hope never to have such a awkward and unprofessional situation happen to me ever.
author: Adam B.

description:
Your perfect dive-bar.  It's dive-enough to be worth visiting, but you don't need to be a super-hipster to fit-in.

Beer, a pool table (no one actually uses), and a few arcade video games near the back.
author: Michael B.

description:
My roommate and I have lived here for 10 months now and have yet to find a great dance spot until we stumbled upon Delirium one random Saturday night. 

The front area is just like a regular dive bar.. nothing too special. Although they do have pear cider, which I appreciate... but they only take cash, so keep that in mind. 

But go past the pool tables and you get to the dance room. The room isn't huge, but it also wasn't as crowded as most dance places are. The room also has seating around it, which is nice. I don't know if it was 80's night or they just decided to play 80's music, but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves! No creepers, just down to earth people dancing unpretentiously... I will be back!
author: Rona Y.

description:
What I first liked about this place is that my friends and I were greeted by the most chill bouncer I have ever encountered at a bar. He even told us how to get free drinks from the bartender in Delirium, as well as at other bars.

This is a really good bar to go to in the Mission if you are out with friends, and they all take a liking to dancing. It doesn't matter to what type of music, as long as they are drunk enough and want to dance. The room where the dancing takes place is the best, because it is A LOT less crowded than in the actual bar, and there is also seating for everyone. The bar does have some TVs, but they were playing movies off of TBS, which I thought was an interesting choice... ?

The only thing to look out for is that the bathrooms are not that well labeled, so be sure to double-check before you enter.

Overall, it was an okay bar. It didn't completely blow me away with awesomeness, but it wasn't a terrible place for a weekend night either.
author: Megan D.

description: Bathrooms- horrible, disgusting. Been in the same condition going back to when this place was called Albion.  Happy Hour- very good, including Guiness...
author: Jim B.
