description: Ok so i used to love this place. Whats not to love, cheep drinks, dance floor with awesome music and nice bartenders. But recently every time i go here something bad happens 1. The dance floor gets to crowed and filled with broken glass, it easy to get injured. 2. My friend got her iphone stolen or accidentally taken out of her jacket, then the girl who took it left it in the street. 3. my friend and i got roofied. We only had shared 2 drinks together and luckily i had a bunch of friends to take care of me, so i got home safely. but still very scary. My friend thinks this skeezy guys trying to get with girls who were sitting at our table while were dancing maybe did it.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description: My Wednesday night date bar. Mildly divey; completely entertaining bathroom graffiti; decent beer selection.
author: karin b.

description: I have to come here whenever I visit SF. I typically make my friends who haven't been there check out the bathroom upon arrival. I've only encountered one other john in the country that is more disgusting. Amazing. The vibe here is always chill. Bartenders are attentive. There's always this female bartender who is super cool. Great dive that's always on my bar tour of The Mission.
author: Dan L.

description:
Every time I come to this bar with my friends, I have a blast!!! 

As my job is hectic and stressful, I need my ME TIME!!! Friday or Saturday nights, I like to round up my friends and hit the bar!!! 

I love coming here with my twin Jo!!! She knows how to bring my night from dull to maxxximizing my night! 

The drinks there are cheap, but the music and the vibe combined are what I need to unwind and have a blast!  
They have a wide variety of music. 80s 90s and today's hit songs.

All the employees are upbeat and are very fast in making your drink. Everytime I go there, I have to have my Tokyo tea! 

Its hard to find a place to sit or even set your stuff down to dance. It gets pretty crowded by ten. My suggestion arrive by nine thirty so you have a chance to get a seat or a place to put you stuff in. Everyone, whether its the bartender or even people who frequently attend this bar, is so friendly that create a energetic vibe that fills up the room, that makes you want to shake, shake, shake,.....shake your booty, LOL!!!! Hahahaha!!!!
author: Liz L.

description: Oh, man.  I thought I had a relatively high tolerance for hipster bars.  This place really pushes the needle.  The afternoon drink specials are nice, though, and the crowd is generally friendly.  I just hope you like ironic mustaches.
author: Bill H.

description:
Confession: I don't think I've ever ordered a drink here. Or occupied the non-dance area for more than, like 15 minutes. But, then again, I don't come to Delirium for the ambiance or the drinks. I'm sure both of those things are fine, but they pale in comparison to the DANCE PARTY ACTION in the back of the establishment. 

When it's on (usually between 12-2), it's totally on here. The back room is like a sauna, which sucks, but it's a sauna filled with awesome. The DJs here always seem to spin exactly the tunes I want to hear, from 90s rap to 70s rock to 80s pop to Top 40. It's an eclectic mix of music that you can actually dance to, as opposed to a barrage of the same 5 hip-hop songs. And every person in that back room--mostly hipsters, yes, but incredibly nice ones--is having just as good a time as you are.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
I was trying to get with a hipster when I was in college and she took me here. It was my first dive bar and it was awesome. Lots of hipsters but most of them were very cool. Had some very interesting conversations here over $2 Tecate. Example: I met some girl here wearing a SF Giants jacket. I asked her if she was just at the game like I was. I am ignored. But for some reason, we hit it off later that night. She was pursuing a career as dentist but drop out of dentistry school and spent most of her time training for marathons by swimming in the bay. She kept on trying to convince me to train with her even though I stressed that I would die in the bay water, if not quickly from hypothermia, then from the pollutants. 

People are generally cool here but I have a disclaimer: Don't come dressed in a nice coat. If it looks like you're from the corporate sector, people here will judge. Gasp!!
author: James L.

description:
Interesting crowd that doesn't really seem to vary night to night. Kind of a typical Mission Dive bar with cheap beer, pool table and overly crowded weekends. Nothing extremely special except for the awesome dance room in the back. I've been to that back room almost every night of the week except for Tuesdays and I'm soooo down with it. 

If you want a secluded dance area to get down with your drunk pals I'd prolly recommend Monday or Wed night (Sergio is super ballin...def bought me a drink before...always a bonus). However Saturday is 80's (some early 90's like Nirvana) night which is probably my favorite night there. Yes they do tend to spin the same tracks each time (Don't Stop Believin, Hey Mickey, Under Pressure, Sweet Dreams) but you're usually so drunk off the two dollar tecates and delirious from the fumes of about 100 sweaty people dancing around you that all you can think about is how much fun it is to sing Journey with an entire bar. 

Extra half star for the bacon hot dog cart outside the bar...definitely my future husbands.
author: Tam G.

description:
Whenever I read "unpretentious" applied to a bar in the Mission, I have shudders.  I mean, thank god there's an unpretentious bar to counter all those pretentious mission digs - right?!  

I liked that Delirium had a back room for dancing - to bad the DJ couldn't figure out what a good "dance" song was.  He also couldn't figure out how to mix songs which made him more of a glorified MP3 player than a DJ. Cmon, it's midnight on a Saturday and I can karaoke better than this crap.

I just couldn't get a hold of the vibe here.  Was it a dive bar with energy? A dance bar with no cover and cheap drinks? A hangout place with 80's pop metal?  A place where I needed to be bombed out of my mind to enjoy?  

Maybe that's the problem - Maybe Delirium didn't click with me because it's not fun unless you're 6 car-bombs deep into a round of Hornitos shots.

Sort of makes sense when you consider the name.
author: Nathan M.

description:
Delirium, you're cool to hang out in when I'm in the Inner Mission during the weekend amateur hour(s). Saturday nights in particular are fun, although the "dancing area" features a DJ that plays the same damn hits from the 80s and 90s. Oh well, they can't all be "A" students.

Cheap drinks and friendly bartenders. I once had an argument (drunkenly) with one about the contents of a Sidecar. She was right but still bought me a shot of Fernet. A good sport indeed.
author: Rodney P.

description:
I don't feel like this place is a hipster hang out.  

The music and the crowd are really diverse.

Plus, they have a dance room and that's all that really matters.

CASH ONLY.
author: Josie A.

description: Delirium is a Dive Bar with 30ish crowd.  It seems like a holdover from the old mission (i've been driving past this place ever since I was a little kid.) One of those places where your better off bringing your dog than your date, unless of course she's into that sort of thing.
author: Samuel P.

description:
I used to frequent this bar a lot...but I guess I grew into more of a martini phase...and believe me, you do not want to order a martini in here.

Location: It's located in the beautiful 16th and Valencia area. Easy access to anyone from anywhere. Tons to do around, bars, food, shopping, reading, art...everything.

Space: The space is really, really grungy and that's its appeal. It's basically decorated like a hardcore bar with more punk rock accents. It's dirty, sticky, there's tons of black everywhere and it's super dark in the back room. Oh yeah, there's a back room where you used to be able to smoke, but now you can only dance back there. If you're a girl (and I'm excluding punk/hardcore girls), you will not like the bathroom.

Ambiance: Um, it's not really hipster-ishy in here as some reviewers might suggest. It's more of a hardcore crowd mixed with the indie folk, mixed with your rare punk and heavy metal folk, and yes, some hipsters. What they all have in common is their love for cocaine off of bathroom urinals. The dance scene in the back room is pretty sweet. I also really like that it's pretty diverse here, a lot of women, lgbt people, and people of color.

Service: Nice bartenders, not rude.

Food/Drink: Don't order anything pretentious. Just get a shot or a beer or hard liquor on ice. 

Overall: Nice place to hang out and maybe a chill dance. My friends and I really like it here and frequent this place often.
author: SF N.

description:
I gotta stop coming here, I'm clearly not their demographic.  Who wants to have shitty drinks in plastic tumblers, poured by attitudinal bartenders, and the final insult--spill most of the drink as stumbling drunk scenesters veer recklessly front and back, side to side?

I like my hipster-y scene bars with bad 80s music, retarded beers for cheap, and inebriation to excess--I love Radio and the Ruby Room, but the scene in Delerium is strictly amateur hour... all night long.
author: Martin W.

description:
Thank you for playing a bunch of 80's punk songs and others like Nena's 99 Luftballons or Journey's "Don't Stop Believing" that you always find yourself singing at the top of your lungs either in your car or walking down the street with the tunes turned way up on your Ipod. Don't deny it....we all do it.

I came here after a dinner across the street at Andalu and was with a group looking for the next stop for the night. Me not being a really big drinker stuck to the DD position and had 1 drink and called it good which was okay by me. The drink was stiff, more booze less soda. My group had a few drinks and before long the bar was packed, the pool tables being used and the back room filled up with a full on dancing crowd.

We left at last call, overall an okay dive bar in the Mission. 

PS. Please Morgan, remember to hit the ATM before you go out at night and carry cash because more and more places are saying that your debit card is pretty but pretty useless.
author: Morgan M.

description:
I came in here for a quick shot and a bathroom break. I accidentally walked into the Men's bathroom and came out while a guy was peeing in the urinal. I said sorry and told him I thought this was the women's bathroom. While still peeing, he nonchalantly turned around, and said, "we don't care about that shit here". Love the bathroom attitude, but Delirium has the worst bathrooms ever. 

BUT, they poured me a very generous drink. my single shot of goose was practically spilling out of my shot glass and it was only 6 Dollars! 3 shots for the price of one. What a steal!

I was happyily buzzed walking around 16th street during the Dyke March.
author: Robin K.

description:
I don't care if it's so crowded you can't move. I don't care if the back room gets hella sweaty. Delirium is the best bar for 3 reasons:

1. no cover on a saturday night
2. $2 tecates ALWAYS
3. dance floor in the back of the bar

How can you go wrong?! Plus saturdays is 80s night and the crowd is usually pretty nice and fun to talk to. 
The only bad thing is for the ladies, ONE STALL.
but that's it. expect crowds. expect the heat and you'll be fine!

Favorite dive in SF. hands down!
author: Susanna B.

description:
BEST DIVE BAR IN THE MISSION! 
Why? 
*$2.00 Tecates 
*Chimay on tap and of course in Chimay gold rimmed glass-Classy! 
*Hottest Punk/Rock guys ever! 
*Best music -80's punk like Cure, Depeche, and so much more 
*really wierd crazy dude who dances/makes love to the wall. 
and of course, bacon wrapped hot dog cart guy is always really close by. 

I have met some really awesome people here and also gotten into some trouble, I wont go in details as my case is still pending. 

Cheers!!
author: CarlaFornia W.

description: One of the better dive bars, Chimay on tap, but... the beer's a tad too warm here.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I  LOOOOOOVE this place during the day (3pm to 8pm ). 5 stars for the friendly bartenders, strong pours,  and the free bbq. Yum!

I HATE this place during the night. (8pm-2am). 3 stars for the drinks but minus two stars for the b$%tchy female bartender who gives everybody attitude. If you walk in and see her, go to another bar, you can get a better drink/atmosphere somewhere else.

Update 01/13/2011: The female bartender is no longer a beeyotch. She must've read this review...of taken some "feel good" medicine.
author: Bitty B.

description:
Went here with a friend last night. As far as I'm concerned, I was celebrating 4 years since the day I first arrived in San Francisco.

$2 Tecates, a dude in fishnets dancing on the stage, pinball machines, a cute chick that liked Helen Keller jokes, and 80s music were the highlights of this place.

Could have had a higher ratio of females; it seemed like all the cute girls that were there bailed out, and it was mostly a crowded, noisy sausage fest for the most part.

After the bar closed a wild night ensued; I slapped a cougar in the face, drank whiskey from the bottle on the streets, and shared some extremely emotional moments with the crackheads down on 16th and Mission until 6 AM.

Aforementioned friend was puking and trying to make sense of it all.

Grabbed a cab home and the cabby told me I was lucky to get out of that neighborhood alive and how he used to be a crackhead himself. Told me it's the best thing ever but I should never try it.

Woke up around 2 PM with a killer headache... Still haven't eaten, still have said headache, and I found a cigarette butt in my wallet. Weird.
author: P A U L.

description:
Okay Mr. Bartender guy who knows my date.  You gotta stop putting vodka and crans in front of me as soon as I've finished the previous one.  You are WAY too on top of getting me inebriated.  If you're thinking it's going to help your friend get lucky, well, that was pretty much a foregone conclusion before the 17th vodka and cran you gave me.

Like: it was a foregone conclusion before we even got to Delirium.

I understand that you're trying to help a brother out; but, your enabling my drunk asshattery is not doing any of us any good.

Thankfully I had a solid dinner before going out that particular evening so even eighty gagillion vodka and crans couldn't have made me totally knee walking drunk.

Well a little woobly, perhaps.  But, all the more excuse to drape myself over my companion's arm and say "let's get a cab back to my place."

*The only other time I've been to this bar was - I believe - the night that Nancypants R. had to almost cut a bitch.  And, Starla gave me a shot of Frenet that I spit out into a napkin... ew Frenet.
author: Kate R.

description:
It's fine.  The grillin' es muoy funky.

I dunno.  I guess it's cheap for gentrification?

I just wrote a 50 page review for Monk's Kettle... you don't need my help here.  

Hipster bar that attempts to be divey without needing to meet real dive bar prices.  Maybe the PBR at Monk's was cheaper than here.  I shouldn't have been so hard on the little guy.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
The crowd at delirium usually has their noses so far up in their hipster haze that they won't show common courtesy to anyone who isn't "original like them".  Delirium play good music sometimes except for 80's and 50's night. Sorry I don't want to dance like my parents did to music they listened to when they were my age. That led to my birth and I'm not ready to have a little me running around quite yet.  

The drinks are pretty fair priced.  2$ tecate $3 PBR pretty decent. Mixed drinks are expensive as usual.  The best part about this place is on nights this one guy Kaheem is working the door. Very nice, very easy to talk to, but I've seen him break up a fight between three people in 5 seconds.

The bathroom used to be tagged to hell, which is cool in a punk-ish type bar like that because the last hing I'm gonna be worried about when I'm drunk and taking a leak is how nice the bathroom looks. Besides, I like tags.
So over-all this place isn't bad. If you go there with your buddies and can ignore the asshole male bartenders and the hipsters trying to look like carbon copies of bob dylan, blondie, and karen O, then you will have a good time.
author: Tom C.

description:
I used to kick it here when a friend of mine was the door man.  the drinks are affordable and its a super dive.  The vibe is laid back but it gets crowded during the weekend.  
Music can be hit and miss esp since every chick likes to play some bubble gum 80's pop and dance around while screaming "oh my god it's my song!" 

still i avoided this by being here during the week.
author: Crista Y.

description:
Delirium was one of the stops when my friends and I were bar-hopping. My whole visit to Delirium is a little on the hazy side, but I'm going to try my best to remember everything. 

I was surprised with the space once I got inside. It was super crowded and seemed on the smaller side until I ventured toward the back and realized that there were more than one room. I also noticed that there were A LOT more guys than girls? Whats up with that? I mean not that I'm complaining, but just somethin I noticed. I didn't feel that snobby, pretentious vibe that some reviewers experienced, most likely because I was drunk haha, but then again I get a long with everyone. However, I can see why some would feel that here.

Eventually, I stayed at the dance floor with my friends, took some shots and had  a really good time. I just remembered right now that we had a Michael Jackson dance-off with the group next to us, haha...oh boy.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I get the feeling that this bar wants to be so much more bad-ass then it is.  With the devil motif and motto "Service for the Sick, you'd think this would be more of a goth/dark hipsterish hangout, but it's pretty much a normal bar.  

Stopped here on a sunny Wednesday afternoon, snagged one of the high tables near the front, ordered a couple of shots of Jack and two $2 PBR drafts.  Gotta love the price and service was quick and efficient.

Added bonus of our table being located between an advert for Harley Davidson and an old Johnny Cash poster.   Women's restroom was airy and oddly pine scented, but seemed clean enough despite every single surface being spraypainted gloss black.  Hand soap and paper towels were plentiful, which is lovely and unusual for a dive bar.

We had a couple of rounds and then headed back out - overall a solid, cheap place to put a few back.
author: Jaimie M.

description: I am not much of a dive master but this dive should be on everybody's top ten dives to see before you die for those nostalgic for 80s music then you are in for a special treat.
author: Muerto D.

description:
At the eighth bar of Christmas I bought myself for me:
One PBR
One Fernet
One PBR
One PBR
One Jack and Coke
One PBR
One vodka Red Bull
One pint of PBR
Best bar for mixing it up and having fun with the opposite sex (or whichever sex you find sexy).
The back dance room is dirty and grimy, smoky and sweaty.... YUM!
Good professional bartenders typically get you served in the order you belly up with relatively stiff drinks.
The music is outstanding.
Everyone knows that this place can get extremely crowded, so it should be no surprise nor disappointment when it is.
For as often as I've been here - for as drunk as I've been here - for as awfully as I dance here - for as often as my testosterone rose to Canseco like levels here - for as many girls as I've said inappropriate things to here - I've NEVER been in a fight here.
That's saying something.
And it's something good.
author: Theo R.

description:
Meh.

Generic dive bar. Crowded as hell.
author: Silvia K.

description:
I almost had to cut a bitch tonight. 

She gave me a "WHATEVER" when I asked where the line was for the bathroom. Girlfriend, I had a paper route when you were born so don't roll your eyes at me and adjust your skinny jeans. Because I saw Morrissey when he was STILL with the Smiths. Don't hate.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Hipster haven to the max. Maybe heaven for some. Only been here on weekdays so haven't really gotten to the dancing that everyone else talks about.

It's a super chill spot, cheap ass beers ($2 Tecates? PBR on tap?), close to a bunch of other shit if you feel like hoppin, tons of what seems to be regulars that are all alcoholics (no judgment intended) and have a good time. I'm still getting to know you Delirium, but I see potential. Yes. Potential.
author: Chieh T.

description:
Big mix of people - I'm talking hipsters/scenesters, 45 year old balding business men, hot grandma's (no fucking joke), and hype-beast youngin's just to name a few. They don't even try to pretend that this isn't a dive bar coz you just can't, and some of the patrons are shameless with  their cat calls and won't hide the fact that they're staring at your tits. Some of the things I heard included: 

-"Damn girl, let me stick it in your *ss"
-"Whoa now li'l mama, turn around a sec?"
-"Oh you're into toe-sucking?"

Gee, thanks for making me feel like a $0.50 ho from Vegas! But then again it is SF, people here aren't shy (it has its good and bad sides). This isn't going to be some place I'll frequent unless I am being dragged by friends and desperate for some cheap alcohol.

Otherwise, they have excellent selection of music, and late night hot dog stand out in the front.

P.S. "People HATE us on Yelp" sticker on the wall where the bouncer is.
author: Jaye C.

description:
You know you're in a *real* dive bar when:

* you can get wasted for $20.

* you'd be better off peeing on the the sidewalk out front than waiting 15 minutes to use the herpes toilet.

* you can get away with a WWI-trench-warfare reenactment hucking pennies at your friends across the bar.

* you get offered drugs while waiting to use the pool table.

* you find your drunk friend slumped on the "dance floor" with a couple of waify types hiding behind their Joey Ramone haircuts.
`
* the same toothless-wacko who offered you drugs later squeezes your butt and blows you a kiss.

Great for a wild night out with the boys, not great for meeting future boyfriends.
author: Tessa M.

description:
I want to hate this place so bad.  I really do.

It is gross., filthy, and about 110 degrees inside. The back room must get to about 120.  Last Friday I was in this place and there were 5 people in one stall doing coke.  It was gross.  Not that I have any moral problem with it.  It is just so obvious, you are better off doing that stuff in the back room it is so dark.

I recomend coming in at about 10pm with 10 people and getting a small zone in the back room.  Then you can have a place to set your drink down and meet up with your people.

It smells like smoke and you will smell aweful when you leave.  The music is loud and the crowd is fairly obnoxious.  The only way to fight this placce is to get down to its level.

Get drunk.  Get high. Get your ass moving. Get into someones way.  Spill drinks. Spill blood.  Whatever.  This is where good men come to die.

Like I said.  I really want to hate this place.

I'll see you on Friday.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Meet up at Delirium?
Oh, you mean The Albion! *age showing*
Divey? Nah, just darker. They unplugged some of the lights. Besides, there are too many happy 'Yelpsters' here to be a dive.

+1 The pints still cost the same as 12 years ago.
-2  The smoke smells the same as 12 years ago.

I hate this shithole, but the beer still works.
author: Andy R.

description:
I've walked by Delirium plenty of times getting off of BART, but never felt tempted to go in, mainly because it looks tiny and it seems to always be filled with huge bikers in the day time, but it was my friend's birthday celebration this weekend and birthday boy wanted to hit up Delirium, so to Delirium we went!

When we got there, a few guys were being tossed out, an angry, drunk chick was trying to fight them through the bouncers, it was dark and dingy, yet incredibly crowded and it turns out that there's an additional room in the back where people can dance and there was a beer-gutted drag queen dancing his/her heart out on stage all by his/her lonesome in a skirt so mini that even little hot biological female me wouldn't be caught dead in it.

We may have gone to five bars that night (and none of the others were very memorable), but I'm 100% sure that Delirium was at least 95% responsible for me showing strangers my underwear and for all the other debauchery that occurred that evening.

Oh man.... 

Darn you, Delirium, and your entertaining bar fights, dancing drag queens and your cheap, incredibly stiff drinks!

Joe Francis would've been so proud of us.
author: Debbie L.

description:
There are two reasons why this place is generally packed:

1) It's packed*
2) It's cheap: $4 well drinks, $6 for my knob creek

Aside from that, we're looking at your basic dive here, with a slightly unusual and alluring name.

Personally, I liked this bar around 9pm when there were barstools to be had, when you could hear the (albeit wierd) music above the din of sweaty loud talkers, when the bartender's ADD seemed more a hindrance than a help.  And the fixie driving asymmetrical bangs brigade was yet to invade.

*there is likely a mathematical formula for this...people go to where people are; popularity fuels itself after awhile**
**until, of course, the backlash of popularity, but that's another story entirely.  Delerium appears to be pre-backlash.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Another one bites the dust.

Let's all raise our glass to the dive bar beauty that was the Albion. She didn't shave. She didn't use deodorant. She was foul-mouthed, loud and bitchy. I loved her. 

And then she had a make-over and became Delirium. The Avril Lavigne of dive bars. A poser. A bridge and tunnel dive for those who don't know better. Trying to pretend that in spite of the face lift, the boobs and the new wardrobe she was still her old self.

I'm not fooled.

RIP, Albion....
author: Tatjana G.

description:
This is part of what I'm going to refer to as my "Old Haunts Revisited" series. . .places I used to hang when I first moved to SF but haven't been to in years (has to be 5+ years to qualify).  

I used to go to the Albion. Life was a lot different back then well, for me anyway.  Not much has changed for this dive other than the name.

Still nice and "divey".  Still cool mission kids (now called hipsters).  Still cool well-mixed drinks.  Still random scary looking people (notsomuch their clothes or overall appearance but more a crazy eye look type of scary).  Still dark and dingy just like a good dive bar should be.  

Went on a Monday night and had the best vodka gimlet ever. 

Main thing that has changed is I felt old-er but that's okay.  Not sure I could do a Friday or Saturday night here but Monday night was perfect. . .not too crowded but just enough people to make me feel like I was supported in my Monday night cocktail.  

Rah Delirium!
author: James M.

description:
I like Delirium a lot and when I was boyfriend-less, often would go on dates here because it's just divey enough & the drinks are strong and reasonably priced (& thus, I would feel better about boys buying drinks for me). During the week & during the day, this is a fun, un-pretentious drinker's bar. So, for that, it gets a nice 3 stars. 

A word about the bathrooms for all of you germophobes: I hope you realize that your nether regions are about 1,000 times cleaner than your hands or your face, so please stop whining about the bathrooms. This is a BAR, not your momma's house.
author: Maria D.

description:
Yes, the bathroom that I used (I believe it was the guys restroom - after drinking all day does it really matter?) was definitely south of "nasty truck stop bathroom" by several notches but the cheap booze and interesting people make this a great place to go after being cut off at Kilowatt...

Yes, it was one of those kind of Saturdays.
author: Todd E.

description:
Delirium is my dive bar.  We all have one, and this is mine.  Remember when it was called The Albion and there was porn the TVs instead of sports?  Ahhh... the good old days.

This bar has stood the test of time though...  the core crowd is still rough and tumble and the drinks are cheap and strong.  I still get too wasted, and I still end up dancing on tables and booths.

My favorite night is Saturday, when the back room turns into a haven for children of the 80s.  Where else can you chain smoke and dance to Prince, New Order and Fugazi all in one place?

Will I ever get sick of it?  After 8 years of fun, doubtful.
author: Nicole G.

description: Totally laid back, hipster joint, pool table, smoking in the front, decently clean bathrooms. Bar tender was cool, then he took a 15 minute break for a smoke and lots of people were waiting around for him. Not too social of a crowd, people in groups, young'ns trying hard to be cool. Background music was decent. Cash only, with ATM near front.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Delirium: 1.A temporary disorder of mental faculties like for instance intoxication

2. A state of violent excitement or emotion

Delirium is one place where both the meaning of the word Delirium comes true. You have the Bar, where you already enter drunk from Bar hopping and land up drinking so much cheap and strong alcohol that you develop a temporary disorder of mental faculties. Then you stumble to the smaller room at the back and join the other hipsters dancing in a state of violent excitement to the blaring music of the punk rock dj.

Last evening, DYL at Casanova was getting tame around 10 pm. I realized as a regular DYLer, I must do my bit and raise the energy of the crew esp. since this is a very important weekend as we are celebrating the birthdays of Autumn K and Drew C. So I motivated the troops to get around the block a bit and come to Delirium.

Slowly, we liquor up and start enjoying the smoking at the backroom. People start trickling in and suddenly, at 11 pm, there is a Cinderella moment and everyone gets crazy on the dance floor. Yelpers and others start shaking their nasties, making out, grinding one another, snorting coke, the list goes on.

Sometimes in life we need a release from rules and give full expression to our inner frustrations , that is why there is a strong need for a place like Delirium in the eco-system of San Francisco.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
Came here with my ballet coworkers last night and actually had a good time!  I've been here a few times but it's usually at the end of the night and I'm too wasted to notice the scenery much...

The night started with a request from my coworker who just broke up with her hipster boyfriend and needed a replacement.  And where do nice girls go when they need to find a hipster slampiece?  THE MISSION, duh.

First we went to Kilowatt but ew.  The lack of attractive young people was a concern.  Actually the lack of attractive people period was a concern.  

I'm with two hot chicks and a hot gay boy and we're all talking about how much we love anal.  Loudly.  Pretty soon we have a line of bearded men vying for our attention!  Many, many shots of jameson later two of my friends left to get papusas and two gentleman callers approached me and my boss and said they needed "beautiful women to play pool with".  

My suitor said he was in cirque du soleil but after much prodding and a failed backflip found out he was a software engineer.  Heh.  Why must men always lie.

Then my roommate showed up and totally KILLED OUR GAME.  We were outside and this guy starts yelling "OMG IT'S THE MAYOR!" He does bear an uncanny resemblance to Gavin but mostly it was the brooks brothers getup and apparent narc/grown up vibe.

The guys that were once paying attention to us cleared out we left shortly afterward. 

Oh delirium I will return but without my squarebear counterpart.
author: dr S.

description:
Guess who's an asshole!!!!

The bartender at delirium.  No joke.  

He was trashed on something and threw coasters at the customers and was a dick.  

I don't normally give a rat's ass about bitchy bartenders.  I sometimes give props to a tender that regulates jerks.  There was no justification for this activity...this guy was a bonafide asshole. 

Not EVER going back.  

EVER.
author: Jay H.

description:
It has been hit or miss here with me. I have had really good experiences on Saturday nights at this place. There seems to be a lot of cool people out to have fun and dance to the 80s tunes. 

On the other hand, the place has been pretty dead and dull before. Consider that when I go, I want to release some energy for cheap. Delirium is always good for hanging out.

It's cheap, has dancing, and not overly crowded. Definitely one of the places I spend the most time in when in the Mission.
author: Ryan V.

description:
I haven't frequented here as much as other bars in the mission.  I thought the reason for that was the weird cokey vibe I always got when I walked in, but I think it's just everything.  

I mean the bartenders and doorman are nice, it's just too dark/emo in here for me.  I mean the pool table felt is even black.  If that doesn't make you depressed, maybe you should spend a little time in the girls bathroom reading the graffiti (which by the way is the reason this bar earns 2 stars, it reminds me of Berlin a little).  

I leave you with my favorite quote from the ladies: "My [highly censored word, i AM a lady] is so sweet you could use it as honey for your pot."
author: Kelly H.

description:
*~~Drunk meter: Zero~~*

Shot of Jamesons
Captain and Coke
*guzzle*

*~~Drunk meter: Five~~*

Shot of Jamesons
Captain and Coke
*guzzle*

*~~Drunk meter: Seven~~*

Shot of Jamesons

*~~Drunk meter: Nine~~*

Shot of Jamesons

*~~Drunk meter: Eleven~~*

*Warning Warning, Drunk meter overload!!*

Huge Super Burrito
*Scarf*

*~~Drunk meter: Nine~~*

Delirium is a pretty divey bar. But the music is actually good. They play some 80's there. Too bad the music isn't too loud though.  It's more in the background so at least it doesn't interfer with your conversations.

Came here on a Saturday and the bar filled up around 11pm. The crowd was decent with a good mix of people. 

I heard they have a mini hot dog truck outside! So, I went with a friend to grab some dogs. The truck was chilling right in front of the bar and we both missed it. So, we got burritos instead.

Note to self: Don't send a drunk to buy hot dogs.
Note to self: Don't send two drunks to buy hot dogs.
Note to self: Super burritos and water kill hangovers.
author: Sam T.

description:
You know you've been out of the scene for too long when you can't remember the last time you were at Delirium... you can't remember the last time you danced your face off... or the last time you shattered a glass half full of whiskey just "for effect"... or the last time you were laying in a puddle of 15 different women's piss laughing your ass off because it smelled like someone threw up in your bra... or the last time you poured beer on your own head while shouting the lyrics to "Don't Stop Believing"...

Well Chappy, has it been too long? Is it time to rejuvenate the party blood that courses through your veins? Do you miss your old carefree self? Then GO!! - and start your Tour De Party Pants at Delirium.

P.S. Tell Steph at the bar I say hi and I'm sorry about all the broken glasses.
author: Katelin H.

description:
Here are some things I like about delerium.

1. They sold me a pint of Trumer for 3.50. I'm pretty sure they offer this pricing to everyone and if there was a happy hour is was long over at that point. Sure, after a while all the drinks started coming in plastic cups, but that's ok because the place kind of feels like a high school party if you went to a school for hip grimy kids.

2. They security cameras are connected to a monitor right behind the bar, so you can sit and keep an eye on everything that's going on inside and out from the comfort of your bar stool. I'm kind of surprised at how much I loved this idea; you'll learn things about yourself at Delerium.

3. They'll play Teen Age Riot in the smoking lounge in the back. Well, they did once and they probably will again at some point.

I'm sure there are other reasons to go there if you love loud divey bars, but these were the real standouts for me.
author: matthew r.

description:
You know what's funny to me. Seeing "celebs" in SF. I just moved here from LA and was quite excited over the notion of not seeing celebs or reality stars or what not at just about every place I frequent, but shooooo 'nuff, the other night, I saw a pseudo-celeb. Oh well, guess you can't blame a musician/actor for having cool taste in dive bars.

Anyhoo, it was Shane West (http://images.art.com/images/products/large/10102000/10102558.jpg), of the guy who loses his legs on ER fame and more notably the punk ass bad boy (yeah right) who turns his life around after falling for the goodie goodie two shoes, Mandy Moore, after realizing that she's dying in A Walk To Remember. I tell ya, movies like that are what hungover, brain dead Sunday afternoons are made for!

With that out of the way, I liked this place on a school night. I note that, because I can only imagine how packed and clusterf&cky this place must get on the weekends. As for pluses, it has a pool table, a friendly bartender who knows how to make a good Snake Bite and noted the difference between the new school one and the old school version. Points!

I also loved the graffitified banos here. Wow, that took some work to get to that point and I loved it. Nothing like doing the toilet seat hover and learning valuable things like, "Girls, you should swallow. It's an excellent source of calcium and potassium"

Thanks for that, I had no idea. :)
author: Stephy S.

description:
I've been to Delirium for drinks and I've been here for dancing and I've got to say that this place is much better for the latter.  The bar area is too narrow and it gets crowded really easily.  

I recommend drinking a lot of alcohol elsewhere and then when you are sufficiently sloshed, heading over to Delirium and dancing like there's no tomorrow.  The back room, where the dancing is located, is small and it gets really hot, so be prepared to get very sweaty...it'll be worth it though, just try and dance in front of one of the fans.

The music is good and the people are fun...I especially love the hot mess of a drag queen that was getting down all by her lonesome on stage.  You go girl!
author: Katherine C.

description:
Delirium is disgustingly filthy.  It reminds me of the inside a dumpster.

Sometimes I like that.

Sometimes I don't.

It has its place.
author: Erin L.

description:
After you and your friends take a few shots at home, walk on over to Delirium. As soon as you walk in you see a myriad of people all the way down the bar and at the booths and tables on the other side. You then start to hear music blaring from the back and when you finally are able to squeeze yourself through all the people you realize that there's a dance party in the back!! And only to the best hippest music.

I die. I love this place. I've had so many good times here... even a bar fight! But hey, a night isn't a good night at Delirium without getting PBR spilled on you and then getting in a cat fight in the middle of the dance floor with a drunken girl.

Please go here!
author: Debbie P.

description:
Hipsters like to: 

a) drink at dolores park
b) drink at delirium
c) drink all the time to drown out the misery of being a hipster
d) all of the above
author: Kelly Kate W.

description: Although this place is super fun for dancing (80s nite on friday) I'll never go back because some knucklehead stole my purse and pickpocketted my friend's phone. Really ruined a super fun evening. Beware of this place. Serious thieves are at work there.
author: seb j.

description:
OK so I love dive bars. Let me rephrase that, I love cheap drinks, good music, and not having to worry about spilling on some chick who will freak out about her "expensive shoes!". But what happens when you can't get a drink to save your life and it's so crowded you can't hear the music? what kind of bar is that? 

My problem with Delirium is partly my own doing. I should have listened to my Yelp buddies when you warned me about the crowds on Saturday nights. After waiting over 10 mins. to get a drink, I managed to work my way to the back of delirium at which point it earns it's two stars. Pathetic me, I can't totally hate a place that blares The Cures "Love Cat". Don't think I'll ever go back on a weekend, but if I'm hurtin for an 80's fix who knows....
author: rachel c.

description: Our phones are safe tonight people! There's a ginger who works in front who should own this place. What an awesome person! And an awesome bar!
author: B M.

description:
Back in the days when I used to hang with the hipster crowd (please don't tell anyone) this place was pretty much always on the weekend radar. Bar-wise it's average, drinks are cheap, there's a pool table but not nearly enough room to play pool, and filthy bathrooms that still hold a place in my heart because friends that have moved away have tagged the shit out of them. I have always been able to get sufficiently liquored up here...and when I say sufficiently liquored up I mean I made into the back room. If you love dancing around with a bunch of hipsters who are equally as excited to dance to Morrissey as they are to dance to Justin Timberlake, if you love the sweaty musty smell of boys in wool sweaters, if you like getting burned by cigarettes while trying to dance in your 6" square then there is no other bar in SF than Delirium.

And really, who doesn't like a boy in skinny pants every once in a while?
author: Laura D.

description:
Hipster alert!  I'm going to try my best to keep this short and simple, otherwise it'll probably just unravel into a ranting tirade on all the overly cliche nuances of the patrons who frequent this dungeonous hell-hole.

There's nothing quite like the palpable feel of perspiration in the air combined with stale weed smoke, topped with a dollop of rampant drug use. Not that I don't enjoy the puff-puff, but it stings the eyes and nostrils when it marinates in the air.  It's called ventilation, and it's a good thing.  

What's the difference between a hipster tranny, and a tranny hipster?  I'm still trying to figure that one out.  Not much I guess.  Then how come I've come to distinguish between the two of them?  Delirium has both, if that's your thing, not that there's anything wrong with that, umm, on second thought...

So, that's all I have to say about Delirium.  Oh, they serve beer and alcohol, but good luck trying to get to the bar without getting lecherously stared at, groped, or stabbed.
author: Michael P.

description:
Grr. I do not like this place.

This bar should not allow smoking. Dive bars should allow smoking. Where crusty people scoot themselves up to the bar and ramble on all night long and everyone knows the bartender. Smoke away! It's part of the ambience.

For some reason, the smoking at Delirium really pisses me off. And it's not just because some drunk dude once held a cigarette to my leg when it was really crowded in there (which it ALWAYS is) and burned a hole through my dress. 

Though if I ever find you, dude, I'm gonna get you back for that one. It won't be pretty...

I just can't stand all the hipsters standing around, elbows-tucked-in-but-one-arm-up in Warhol-esque poses, waving their cigarettes in the air, all skinny and serious and way too cool for you. This bar is just a haven for hipsters.

And it's not even HIP. I mean, it's just kind of a shithole. Plain and simple. And, shitholes are only cool if they're dive bars. The kind where crusty people scoot themselves up to the bar and... and... you get the point.

Delirium is just trying to be somewhere in between. In between a lot of things. And the end result is it's icky.
author: Lisa T.

description:
SHOTS UNTIL 2AM

Unlike most bars who stop serving drinks at 1:45am (2am in "bar time"), Delirium will serve you shots right up until 2am--as long as you promise to down them right away. Who sips a shot anyway??

If my friends and I aren't already here dancing our asses off in the back room, this is where we make sure to go after all the other Mission bars stop serving us drinks. It gets crowded on weekends but thanks to the cheap strong drinks, you won't be noticing in no time.
author: Cindy P.

description: Now this is what dive bars should model themselves after. Cheap drinks, heavy pours, funny bartenders and rock and roll. I remember one time after band camp I came here for tequila and beer... after a few rounds the DJ played Billy Jean, and then I found the dance moves I knew I had in me. Such talent was gone the next day and hasn't been found since.
author: Lester L.

description:
To a certain extent, delerium is yet another of the generic scenster bars in the mission.  Crowded, inexpensive, and full of not so attractive people, its a great place to "ass out" when you don't want to look pretty.

i came here several times before i notices the smoking room in the back.  busts this place up to four stars fo sho
author: Steve S.

description:
Joie de vivre. 

If you're more than tipsy but less than totally inebriated while visiting a nightspot should you Yelp about it? But of course, this is our collective raison d'tre. In fact, that is one of the best times to Yelp. You were relaxed, having fun, and remained open to the experiences that lurk in the dark, dingy, recesses of the nightlife that the Mission has to offer. 

The last time I was at Delirium it was the fourth stop on a tour of every watering hole in sight. What an evening! I ran into someone that I had heard was dead. I discussed Barack Obama's chances for Presidency while I sipped an ice cold one. Then I even shook what my momma gave me. Cheap drinks, cheaper ambiance, but who cares. Bon Vivants Unite!
author: Jessica D.

description:
Hot girls. Hot music. Hot bar, literally... they should get better ventilation. 

When it gets too crowded be fearful for:

1. Getting burned in the hand by dunk indoor smokers.
2. Getting smashed in the nuts with the end of a pool cue.
3. Becoming invisible to the bartender.
4. Phantom elevator farts
5. Where did my jacket go?
author: F B.

description:
Delirium is one of my all time favorite places when it comes to going out in the Mish. The dark room in the back is great for dancing like a wild banshee with reckless abandon. 

The music is good, the drinks are cheap and the bathrooms are nasty. 

Come thirsty and ready to dance, but pee before you leave the house.
author: Casey C.

description:
I love Delirium. I always end up there on random weeknights after having a drink that turned into 12 in some other part of the city. 

They always play such awesome music. And the clandestine smoking in the back makes me feel like I'm in the basement of the cool kids house in 7th grade. 

I always run into my nearest and dearest there! Everybody knows that it's a guaranteed good time! 

I just wish that the bartenders there knew that "2 more vodka red bulls and 2 Jameson's" is Roseanne-speak for "Please go find Jeni and make her take me home"

Update, 6/17/07
Ok, so I went to Delirium last night, and it was an alternate universe. I guess I always go here on weeknights, when you a pretty hardcore clientle. They play New Order and Blondie. On a Saturday, though, you get the full B&T experience. It was packed, felt like a frat party, and extremely sweaty. The music was horrible. I mean, it was a frat party, they were playing Nelly. Basically, I guess everything near 16th and Mission sucks on a Saturday night when Walnut Creek vomits all over it. Sorry to be such a B&T hater, but come on, Nelly?
author: Roseanne W.

description:
No matter how many times I find myself at this establishment I can never grasp the fascination people have with it. Its just a bar, with average service, average drink prices, an average juke box, average people and average ambiance. Yet, I keep getting dragged back here by people wo "just love it".  I felt no differently when it was Albion...just don't get it.

I'm not saying its a bad place, I wouldnt give up a night out with good friends just because this is where they want to go,  but with Kilowatt right across the street, why do they bother with Delirium?
author: Drue C.

description:
I was getting tired of all my old haunts, so I decided to try this place and was pleasantly surprised. Drinks were cheap and the music failed to suck, which puts this joint head and shoulders above most of the other watering holes in the area. 

There were also lots of hot girls. Lots and lots. Hooray!

I was in a bad mood when I walked in and a good mood when I walked out. 'Nuff said.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
I have to admit I was already experiencing delirium when I set foot inside this place. In fact, Delirium wasn't even my destination, I was trying to make it to 16th St. to find a cab after a long and alcohol saturated evening at my friend Kim's holiday party. She lives on Albion, and as fate would have it, Delirium lay between me and the cab I eventually made it into much, much later than planned. Word to the wise: when you are 33 years old, have some lifestyle standards and have been drinking champagne all night long, it is better to just walk on by the cute hipster boys smoking pot outside a bar in the Mission at 2 a.m. Far more advisable than, say, joining them for a drink at Delirium.

That said I do remember the following things about Delirium:

-Lots of cute hipster boys, all of whom probably just turned legal. In fact it is a veritable hipster boy sword fight in there. 

- Good strong vodka tonics. Always a plus in my book.

Yeah, that's about it. So I am giving this place three stars. It may have been better, it may have been worse, but as far as my memory goes, that's all she wrote.
author: Angie R.

description:
This place is pretty fucking gross.  It smells, is really dark and usually stinks like smoke.  It does have a couple of cheap pinball machines, and a pool table, but I simply don't want to spend any time in here.  

It's a good place to wait for your dealer to show up with a ball, and for you to come the the realization that this was not the life you were supposed to live.  Next stop, rehab, baby.
author: Tony A.

description: When I think of Delirium, I think of fat blondes and thirty-something 'hipsters'. Whatever. Cheap drinks, nice tunes, and unpretentious atmosphere. I try to leave in less than 20 minutes after a lucky Tecate or two.
author: Joanna M.

description:
I've been to delerium a number of times, and since I can't decide whether to give it a good or a bad, I figured I'd do the pros and cons thing.

Pros:
1. They play a fine selection of 80s (and +/- 10 years) music, which is great because everyone there always knows where they were when that particular song came out. So lots of energy, lots of dancing.
2. Pretty much a hook-up dive bar. Everyone is macking on everyone else, and there's all kinds of options available.
3. Dogs are allowed, and you'll see canines imbibing freely with the patrons. I sincerely hope they autoclave the glasses nightly.
4. The location is pretty good, crowds tend to spill out to the street after everyone gets kicked out at the end of the night, so theres an option for last minute phone numbers.

Cons:
1. They only take cash - no plastic. Ridiculous for an establishment that serves booze. You want patrons to keep buying rounds, instead of having to leave to look for ATMs.
2. The back room is permanently hazy with smoke - which is fine if you're on your third lung. Not so great if you prefer breathing and visibility.
3. The floor and the bar get real sticky, real quick. And because of the layout of the place, having a conversation that isn't intended to get you laid (like with a friend, perhaps?) is near impossible. Also, you'll get jostled by an endless parade of drunks and mobility impaired.
4. The drinks are *way* too small. C'mon guys, you're a bar with a 400% markup on alcohol. Don't be stingy with the booze! 

My friend ordered a white russian and was told "The coffee machine is broken" by the bartender. Ummm... when I mentioned that half-and-half was what the recipie called for, I was told "none of that either". Ten minutes later, he ordered a Baileys with cream, and that came along without any problem. Methinks the bartenders need the digital equivalent, or at least be willing to ask each other what might be in a mixed drink.

I'll go back because of the location (and because my friends dig the place), but it isn't all that.
author: Maxx L.

description:
I don't write reviews for places.  And I probably never will again.  But thanks to Delirium I had just about the worst night of my life.

Is it bad to think, when ordering a drink, that I am going to want something other than a beer or a shot?  I didn't think so.  Apparently my bartender did (the big fluffy muscle one who was wearing a black wife-beater).  I ordered a gin and tonic, and without looking at me he decided to complain to everyone sitting at the bar saying things like "Look at this place...its packed!  the only drinks I should be serving are beers and shots!"  I felt terrible, I had no idea it was going to be that hard to make a gin and tonic.  And I decided to give him a fat tip for all the hard work he had done.  

[I'm not a mean person, I'm not a stereotypical person who has obvious enemies.  No, I'm a tiny, white, 23 year old who does not give attitude.  Maybe I just had written on my forehead, "please bartender ruin my evening."]  

The bartender, still raising hell about how rude it was for me to order a gin and tonic, finally referred his complaints in my direction.  Thanks, I prefer to be bitched about to my face.  His rant continued on and left me battered, and hot headed.  I swallowed my anger and kindly said, "Do you want me to give you a tip?" He said "I don't care! do you see how crowded it is in here?"  So I stopped listening to my sensible side, threw the money at him and turned away as he still continued to complain.   

Maybe I shouldn't be upset.  It was just a silly drink.  Maybe I was overreacting.  Or maybe...he was? Yes it was New Years Eve and it was crowded, but it was only 9:30.
author: Jane H.

description:
When provoked, I drink. 

When drunk, I dance. 

When it's Sunday night, I tend to do both here for hip hop night because I am that phresh. 

Otherwise, eh.
author: haley d.

description: I get really embarrassed whenever I come here that somebody might see me.  You don't want to be associated with the people that hang out here without shame, as though its actually a reasonable or even cool place to be.  I figure its mostly 19 year olds who don't know any better yet.  Which leads me to the only reason why I ever end up here: 19 year old babes who don't know any better yet.  Also the beer is kinda cheap and you can smoke in the back room and its close to my house.
author: Skeptical Spee ..

description:
Dude. I totally get this place. Its pretty much a combination of everything dive bar wrapped up in one tight little package. I mean seriously, what else could you want for a dive bar:

1) Overly graffiti-ed bathrooms
2) Some cartoon network on one TV, some football on the other
3) A pool table with no room to walk around it, so you poke people in the ass constantly
4) 80s music on a Saturday night
5) A dance floor...but only if you want it (plenty of room to just drink a lot too)
6) Beer of choice for the bar? Clearly it's Tecate. (myopenbar tells me these are $2 a pop all the time...maybe that's why...however, at only $4 for a decent beer, why wouldn't you just get that?)
7) Nifty crowd...sort of a cross section of SF (like all of San Francisco)

On a side note, our table got a "heeellllooooo gentlemen" from a chick about 3x my size. Later in the evening, we got a second hello from the same group, and I got a slow hand down my back....mmmmm hmmmm. Although I was considering going for a motorboat ride that evening, I turned it down in the end because I had just seen that Futurama where a whole bunch of guys died of broken crotches. Scary!

Packed to the wazoo come 1AM...thats perhaps the only downer. I may not have liked this place nearly as much if I wasn't at a table with some semblance of personal bubble.
author: Sean C.

description:
This place has all the essentials for being a fun spot:

1) cheap drinks
2) fun and friendly bartenders
3) free popcorn and BBQ!
4) great music selection
5) attracts all kinds of crowds. I guess this isn't ALWAYS a good thing but there was plenty of eye candy in there for me!

If you are lucky, you will get to meet the whistling ESL, transient, flashdance wanna be street patroler!
author: Christina H.

description: I understand they are a dive, but it's kind of gross in there.  The bathroom is very dirty and the entire bar needs to be updated.  I get it, it's supposed to have that "dive" appeal, but it is possible to provide a clean bar and keep the character.  The bartender was also unfriendly, given that we were the only ones in there he should of distracted us from the run down decor so we wouldn't of noticed it.  I am not sure how the prices are for their cocktails, but hopefully they are cheap. I am giving them two stars because they served $2 Tecate canned beer at happy hour.  I get the feeling this is the kind of place you come late at night already drunk and don't care about ambiance.
author: Sophie G.

description:
Just another PFR dive bar in the hood.  If you're in the mission and in the mood for somewhere sparsely decorated and kinda dirty with an indie crowd, this might be your place.  Then again, so might the other 40 bars just like it.  

On the plus, the drink prices are cheap and I always see attractive people there.
author: Sid D.

description:
Why is everyone so jaded? I remember the Mission before the scenesters arrived, and while this place has gone through a couple of iterations, it's still my favorite bar in the area.

Ok, maybe I was about 6 when the first generation of hipsters started pouring in, but I come from a good Bernal Heights background and still love a place that lets you get sloppy and make out with foreigners at the tables, spend hours playing war with oversized playing cards while swilling beer, and dance like Biz Markie on speed in the back room. 

Yeah, you'll come home reeking of cigarettes, sticky with $2 Tecate, and might contract a VD from the bathroom, but you'll love every minute of it.
author: Carla C.

description:
I just can't roll with how crowded this place is. I also can't roll with the bastards that are always throwing up and/or pissing outside. Also the bartenders are total dicks at closing time and try to get hundreds of people out in 2 minutes. Not going to happen, clearly.

Apparently, another downer if you're not into hard drugs man, yeah! is that people are always tweaking hard here. Aside from these hold-backs, they have a good music selection and good dancing.
author: C P.

description: Good times at Delirium~  I swung in this joint because they had football on and once again the "sports bars" in the Mish were packed to the gills.  Janelle made some rocking drinks and the crowd was really nice and low key.  The bar dog, MiMi was a sweetie and I thoroughly enjoyed myself.  I hit a movie at the roxie then decided to go back to delirium for some more fun.  The juke box has a great mix and its an inexpensive place to hang out.  The womens bathroom was pretty bad but otherwise I think the place is an awesome Dive... I will be back.
author: Nicole W.

description: Fun, hole-in-the-wall neighborhood bar. Pool table in back, sweet jukebox and PBR on tap. Ahhh, hipster heaven.
author: Shira O.

description:
When you walk into Delerium you just might get a whiff of the dirty hipstairs and turn right back out but it's not the hipsters that you come for. No, no, it's the cheap beers, the same 80's hits you've heard a million times, and the fact that there is smoking in the backroom. 

Don't be suprised if you see people doing coke in the bathroom and there is "tagging" and hilarious quotes written all over the walls in there for your reading pleasure. I've spent many a night chatting up cute girls in there but the smell of the air freshener can get to you after and hour or so. 

It's mostly a whiskey and beer drinking place. Not that they don't serve mixed drinks but nobody who goes there orders that foo-foo shit. The PBR's are cheap and the women are even cheaper. 

You might be asking yourself why anyone would want to go to this place. And well, you're right, most people don't. It's takes a special kind of dirty self-hating hipstair to handle this sorta place. Guess I'm just one sick puppy. Which works out well after all their motto is clearly stated right above the bar: "Service for the Sick".


-R
author: Robin B.

description:
So I was feeling kinda glum, so my friend and I dressed up like hookers and went to Delirium. I mean, how can you not be into getting tanked on a wednesday night (soul night!) and dancing with Philly the trannie? 
My bathroom conversation went something like this: 

Some girl "My coke got all wet and chunky! Gross!"

Me: "Do you know that girl puking in the bucket right there?"

Some girl: "Do you think that if I put a lighter to it, it would, like, dry out?"

Me: "Uh, I think that sort of turns it into crack, maybe."

Some dude: "Babe, if you're gonna do lines at least use a five! The ones here are dirty!"

Me: "Maybe you should just use some paper."

Girl in the stall: "If you bought that coke in the mission, don't do it!"

I'm still not sure if this whole exchange made me love or hate this place. But I did get so drunk I missed my yoga class in the morning, AND I came home with four more dollars than I left with. 

MAGICAL!
author: Cordula R.

description:
Delirium is located right off Mission Street. This is probably one of the diviest bars I've been to in a while but I love it. The reason I love it is because the drinks are cheap and I feel like the clientele is a cross section of the San Francisco population. Just a bunch of different people getting together and not giving a fudge.

My friends and I went on a Saturday night but it wasn't that packed. The place is small but we found a table to sit at and talk. There is a pool table in back if you are interested in that but I imagine there could be a long wait for it at times.
author: Jamie Q.

description:
So, after a very stressful day not long ago I was taking the trains home (an awful process to begin with) and somewhere between Millbrae and 6th Street it dawned on me that instead of taking the N-Judah all the way back down to my flat, I should get off at Embarcadero and get on yet ANOTHER train (fourth one on this trip), the Millbrae BART.

Why, do you ask? Why pay another $1.40 plus mandatory 50-cent-hassled-by-a-bum-at-the-ticket machine fee to transfer to BART, which was going to make the same next three stops as the train I was already on?

That's easy. Station number four on the BART line is 16th and Mission.

Hello Delirium.

Delirium is where you take yourself when you just don't care anymore. The bartenders don't care if you're there, the patrons sure as hell don't, and you must not be caring too much about your surroundings if you're stepping into this place.

The bathrooms are disgusting, the dance floor is disgusting, the bar stools are disgusting, the beer (a couple times) has been warm, and since it's on 16th and Valencia, it's not even cheep. Plus, this place does turn into rampant douchebaggery just like every other Mission bar on the weekends.

However, they do serve alcohol, and as long as you're behaving yourself they'll gladly get you ridiculously drunk. This may or may not be a plus.

Do yourself a favor, cross the street and go to Kilowatt.
author: Aiden B.

description:
One of my first trips to SF I wandered out of the rain and into this place with a group of friends. We were just about the only people in there and had a great time thanks in large part to the drink selection, jukebox (Built to Spill on the box is a game changer!) and free pool. I can understand the afformentioned hipster warnings based on the ambiance of the place but saw no sign of such patrons while I was there.
It's also incredibly cool that at 10pm the jukebox went off and the people in charge spun obscure Dead  and Santana cuts and other psychedelic 60s SF music. Is this a regular occurence or did I just hit the jackpot?
author: Colby P.

description:
Wah wah wah. Hipster this hipster that.  Whatever.

They have:
-- 2$ Tecates w/ Lime served in a friendly and efficient manner 
-- Pinball
-- Smoking ( I don't but it adds to the general seedy awesomeness)
-- Non stop selection of music that rides that edge of badness/goodness
-- A bunch of drunk people acting delirious

What else could you want?  I mean seriously.
author: adam b.

description:
This is by far the worst bar i have ever been to in this city.You can always judge a bar by a few obvious characteristics.Good crowd?Easily accessible bathroom?Can you get a drink quickly?This bar fails miserably on all of those levels.

There is usually some guy in one of the stalls doing coke so good luck trying to piss.The bar is PACKED and while the bartenders there really bust their ass, its just impossible to get a drink.The crowd sucks as well.Just a clickish group of scenesters that for all of their so called "uniqueness" they all look exactly the same.I hope i dont sound bitter.I mean honestly this has the opportunity to be a decent bar, but the large unfriendly crowd just ruins it.Its like a meat market for hipsters.
author: Joshua T.

description:
Woah...

Woah...

Woah. This place sucks. 

Small, expensive, and the crowd was the weirdest mix of bad-vibes I've experienced in the city to date. If I wanted to feel this awkward, I'd go hang out in North Beach.
author: Nikki H.

description:
Saturday (10Jan09) happy hour was a dream date.
Slayer on the jukebox.
Free Pool.
Adamms Family Pinball.
Video Games. 

The place was full of regulars who jostled each other with jokes and skeletons in the closet stories. They were friendly to newbies and laughed when they played pool. In their AC/DC T-Shirts. 

The bartender was a little deaf and that made us feel outside the cool kids party. Not a great technique for boosting the tip jar. 

Other than that, I would seriously go again and now know why there are big groups outside this place every weekend. 

It's dirty, it's fun.
author: Miel H.

description:
Oh yes you, so many haters but I love this place. I have been many times but I think it's finally appropriate to give this place a review on my b'day!!! Plus it will be my 200th review!! This part is by accident, of course. 

I went last night with friends to celebrate and what's not to like? $2 Tecate? Oh yes please. Cute boys? Hell yes! Dancing to 80's songs with a random "shake it like a polaroid picture" song got mixed in the middle? Count me in!! 

Ok...ok...one thing that almost ruined the night, this guy who puked across the dancing floor. GROSS!!! I immediately left the premises. Dude, it was 11:30 and you're puking already? Jeez! Even your Mom would shame you for it.
author: Perry S.

description:
My momma raised me with an iron fist and said "Delta, if you cain't say nothin' naice then don't say nothin' at uhll." 

So what can I say about Delirium....

The bacon wrapped hot dog cart outside is reaaal good!
author: Delta C.

description:
This place is hot. No, no, wait - it is hot(t). Because it's dark, dingy, and smoky as all hell. If this bar was a woman, and you were a male-so-inclined, she would intimidate you completely at first, but then her friendly flirtations would reveal an underlying modesty, resulting in the greatest make-out of your life.

Any complaints directed at this bar ignore the reality of what "dive bar" means. This place is filthy, but that is the price one pays for dirt-cheap cocktails, the right to smoke inside (hello?) and amazing, incredible dance music.

Yes, dance music. The back room constantly astounds me; in San Francisco, I have never found a space (a true space!) that invites the sort of heedless hedonism that Delerium does. I can absolutely recommend arriving at 10PM on a Wednesday, securing yourself the corner booth by the DJ, and settling in for hours and hours of classic rock and fucking roll that manages to be both danceable and listenable to whilst sitting and drinking $2 Tecate and $4 shots of whiskey. Unparalleled drunken revelry, my friends.

The back room aside, there is free pool on Mondays, but if the place gets crowded (i.e. after 11PM), forget about playing a decent game. And the jukebox is commendable, if slightly biased towards a few esoteric, cacophonous strains of punk music. And the clientele veers towards "hipsters" if you still believe in the validity of that term. But forget about Fridays and Saturdays - this place gets tragically crowded to the point of impossibility.

So really, and also truly, if you are seeking a mid-week destination that sincerely evokes the holiest trinity of sex, drugs, and rock and roll, then you can do no better than Delerium. And if you can, please reply to this review and let me know where the hell I should be spending my money instead.
author: Max H.

description:
This is probably my least favorite bar I've ever been to. Ever. In life. I never go here anymore. Almost everyone I know hates this bar because of the bouncers. There is a sign in my 50 person office that reads "HAPPY FRIDAY! DON'T GO TO DELIRIUM". The bouncers are absolute douche bags. They are beyond sketchy, definitely thieving from customers and beyond that, they are downright rude and self-entitled. One them called us "bitches" for asking if there was an ATM inside and told us to "get the hell out of there". The next time we went the bouncer told my friend that she needs to put her phone away, because it's rude.  Excuse me? Last time I checked bouncers at sketchy dive bars weren't the authority on appropriate social etiquette. They waaay overstep their boundaries as bouncers, and unless Delirium hires a new bunch of bouncers that don't look and act like convicted felons (we get it, it's a gritty bar, but as a general rule, staff shouldn't feel comfortable using derogatory language directed at customers), I'm not coming back here, none of my friends are coming back here and none of their friends are coming back here and so on. This bar has nothing going for it.


Note I created a Yelp account just so I could tear Delirium a new one, and hopefully spare other people from having the same unpleasant experience. That's how bad Delirium sucks.
author: Brittany R.

description:
Alchohol begets drunk people who, in turn, dry-hump one another.

It's all such a charade, though! There I was, dry humping this girl. So I figure, "I'm in here". And we get outside when the bar closes, and I skip the small talk, and say "So, wanna come home with me" and she said, "No." 

WTF?
author: Nate L.

description:
... and quoth Mark Twain:  "There is nothing quite like slam dancing with androgynous, skinny, sweat-drenched, B.O.-emanating hipsters."

The drinks are really cheap too.
author: Steven R.

description:
My favorite bar in the mission..depending on the time of day.  Best times had are day-drinking sessions that occur between Zeitgeist mornings and Kilowatt/Thieves Tavern evenings, at least on the weekends.  Sun thu Thurs nights are fun but Fri and Sat nights can get pretty crazy (as you've heard). The hard working staff do their best to keep up.  No credit cards!  Thank God!  Lotta talk about the back room but there is no bar there so I wouldn't know.  4 stars for opening late (Zeitgeist has spoiled me!)

overheard saturday afternoon:

random drinking buddy: 'hey, Steve, wanna shot of Powers?'
me, finishing a shot of Powers: 'fuck yeah!'
joe, bartender, as he hits my glass again: 'you NEVER say no, do you?'
me, grabbing my glass: 'no'
author: STEVE L.

description:
The name of this place speaks for itself.  

Actually, it should read, "Delirium Cocaine Bathroom".  There, much better.
author: A. N.

description:
One of my favorite bar moments EVER happened here about two weeks ago. A friend and I were walking towards the exit past a 'gentleman' . His pickup line?

"Heyyyyyy ladies"

Cue our complete avoidance of eye contact.

His response?

"That's weird, that usually works in North Beach."

Also, I've noticed that lately there is an alarming ratio of martini and wine glasses to the normal pints and whiskey sours. Since when did the Marina decide it was cool to go slummin?
author: Jb O.

description:
Great location, ini a perfect area for bar hopping. take a few steps over in any direction and there is dive bar upon dive bar to be explored.


 small dance floor in back room, usually plays some fun music.
author: thensamsaid

description: I like this place a lot..  If you are a hipster this is your bar.  A lot of really friendly young adults here.  The back rooms ceiling on friday night is dripping swet its so packed and hot.  The music is very diverse, indy oldschool top hits to random classics..  $2 tecates/ pbr $2.50.   There as definately a lot of guys I went with my gf so I wouldnt recommend a place to go with a group of guys if you are looking for girls just a place to get drunk and have fun, it is a bit small though..  The bathrooms are stinky as hella a bit dodgy, the que to the loo is huuuge.  peace
author: Chris B.

description: Theres a slight touch of awesomeness that comes with the feeling of dancing in a garage (like you're in HS, at a house party)- that's what it felt like in the back room of Delirium. My friends and I danced the night away to some awesome 80s music in the back room which was pretty packed but we managed to make it work. Interesting crowd but if you go there with a group of fun people, you can make it work.
author: Lynn C.

description:
If I wanted to contend for the Guinness World Record for "Most Alcoholic Beverages Consumed in One Hour," I would go to this bar, because I swear to God I can't get drunk here.  I think they water down their beer and put an eyedrop of whiskey in their whiskey and cokes.  If you come here, buy cans of Tecate: they're $2, and you won't have to blow $50 in a (fruitless) attempt to get drunk.

There's a back room where you can sit at tables, dance, and smoke cigarettes. My friend was sitting beneath a leaky pipe and water kept dripping on his face.  Story of his life.
author: Brian C.

description:
I'm a dive bar kinda girl, so on a monday night, this was my kinda place.

It was fairly populated for a school night, just barely found two seats at the bar for me and my companion for the evening.

Drinks are priced fair, mixed well.  Beer is even cheaper, if I drank that sort of thing.

It seems to have potential to be quite fun, but I'm only giving it three stars because I've had a SERIOUS case of tinnitus since I went here over a WEEK ago.

yeah. DJ fucktard (not his real name) had the music up SO DAMNED LOUD that I'm worried I have permanent damage in my left ear.

and as punk rock as that fucking is, i'm just not really feelin' that kinda vibe.

I shouldn't have to wear earplugs to a dive bar.
author: Roachie D.

description:
Delirium is a typical dive bar, perfect for a chilled out night with cheap drinks, pool and good music.  Saying that, the drinks are not that nice...whenever I have ordered a g&t, it never tastes refreshing and delicious like it should (I think it's the tap tonic that I don't like) and I avoid the whisky sours/margaritas because they are too sweet.  

I'm quite happy to stick to a vodka/soda though, have a little dancey-dance in the back room where the dj booth is, or just (try to) play pool.
author: Melanie B.

description:
After a free Wild Turkey giveaway at the super-lame Skylark, I stumbled into Delirium (pun intended). Tattooed ladies, okay drink prices (since when is a $2.50 pint of PBR a good deal?), and a punk rock dance dungeon in the back behind the pool table. Being able to smoke on the dance floor is a plus. When you're too drunk to talk to anyone, go for the pinball machines.

UPDATE: Since the last review I've been here countless times (it became my apartment's bar of choice) and took over the PhotoHunt Machine. Even when the initial excitement about the place wore off, the PhotoHunt machine brings it back to 5 stars. 

NOTE: What does everyone have against hipsters anyways? Hipsters are just unattractive people trying to prove their worth by being "trendsetters." Just let them be.
author: Dave S.

description:
Just a little quiet on a Saturday afternoon made it the perfect place for a little SantaCon wind-down.  Hotdogs and bbq chicken made for a fine snack while sipping on my generously poured bourbon.  

Thumbs up all around.
author: Mike I.

description:
"OMG I'm gonna fuck a pro skater tonight.  How do my tits look?" 
This WAS a skate bar until the owner read Chelsea's grumpy ass review of the time she went to the D and was the only one of her friends to not get laid, and they figured she was better clientele than all the skate rat kids (myself included) who love this place and come here 6 nights a week selling out the $2 Tecate and $1(.50 now) high life grenades.  
They buffed all the graffiti in the bathroom and there are too many pro-hos from the marina spilling their Coronas on the pool table.  
Go to the D to get wasted not to take a shit.
author: Matt N.

description:
Too many hipsters. Too small and bartenders don't know when to cut the jack asses off! Door guys seeling coke in the woman's bathroom! And a riot broke out at closing time when I was there.
The one door guy John was being a jerk to a girl he had tricked into sleeping with him.
This place is a nightmare with a bunch of tools running around loose in it!
author: Jason K.

description: live hard, play hard. Delirium is a place to dance all night, to get totally wasted, to return home or to someone else's home smelling like 9 million cigarettes we extinguished in your hair, to get in a bar fight, to totally hate how much you truly like it. Here, you can light your cigarette on the dance floor, drink pabst, and hear boys don't cry followed by bon jovi all to your hearts content. fookin a.
author: Nikki M.

description: A great bar in the mission, with cheap drinks and a really good atmosphere. The DJ plays a balanced, good selection of music and there is a back room thats just a dance floor where it doesn't feel that crowded in there. Also, the bartenders are really friendly you can get their attention easily without having to wait long.
author: Henry C.

description:
What the hell happened here last night?

I saw 3 friends from Alameda.

I drank.

I think there was something annoying going on outback.

What?
author: Patrick G.

description:
Cheap booze with 80's beats...can't beat that now can u? 

It can get really packed at times...the Wednesday party is the happening thing in the city and to have a dance floor and a pool table adds to the treat.
author: Teddy d.

description:
