It was surrounded by people that I thought were homeless at first glance, but then realized they were way too young to be in such tragic circumstances.  I once heard the term "emo" applied to such a crowd of wannabe homeless/bohemian/idontwannashower people, but I find that to be a bit too generous a classification.  My Chemical Romance is emo.  These people are just dirty.

Such was the theme of my experience in this delightful establishment.  For example, upon entering the black bathroom, I was immediately suspicious of the graffiti on the wall.  I highly suspect they at some point they hired someone to graffiti the bathroom to make the place seem more *divey.*  Being a native New Yorker, I'm no stranger to graffiti.  Real graffiti involves curse words, line art of genitalia, and gang tags.  People do not write "hahaha" or "pork" in big letters, or have tags that say "Frederick Edgar Jameson, III, Esquire."  (Okay, so I made that last one up.)  The final clue: toilet seat covers and toilet paper in the bathroom.  I've seen McDonalds in Flushing with scarier bathrooms than this one.

Sigh.  Another San Fran bar that pretend to be more divey (aka poverty stricken) then they actually are so that skinny white men dressed in corduroy jackets, pants with chains, and a indy rock band tshirt can come feel "hardcore."
author: Fen Z.

description:
Wow.
Not sure if it was the music or everyone dancing or the plume of smoke in the air. Whatever it was, I love this place...just wish I hadn't ordered that last boont...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Not really a fan of this place.  Sure, it can occasionally be good for dancing, but in that hopping-up-and-down-because-I-have-no-room-to-move-my-legs kind of dancing that happens when a dancefloor gets way overcrowded with rowdy drunk 21 year olds.  

It's divey but not in a charming way and not in an authentic way either.  Cheap PBR but it's not like you can't get that anywhere in the Mission.

Maybe it's better on off-nights but I haven't really spent much time here except for trying to dance because it's like the only dance bar in the damn Mission without a cover and I guess that explains why it's always so crowded with "woo girls" and the skater punks who love them.
author: Kevin H.

description: Not a great place, crazy crowded, super trendy. Not really my scene.
author: Aaron R.

description:
I am amazed by how few people know this! There is a super chill dance floor in the back of Delirium. Usually 80s music and/or punk rock. The PERFECT place to close up a night of Mission bar hopping...

As well, I just saw an ad the other day where they proclaimed to be the "Best Straight Pickup Bar in the City". Or something like that. The goods are pretty good in there, I agree...

Just prepare to get sweaty and have beer spilled on you and cigarette smoke creep into your clothing.
author: Trey F.

description:
Oh, Christ... am I really writing a review for Delirium? Sure am. Insomnia at it's finest.

Delirium is an endup. Because you never plan on going there, but everyone always seems to end up there. You all admit it's not that cool of a place or that great of a bar, but it's just so... convenient.

Anyway, it's diveyness at it's best, and it actually is a pretty good time. It's consistent, that's what I'm saying. You can usually find girls keying in the bathroom, darling bearded hipster boys arguing at the tables and quick, competent bartenders behind the bar. 

It works.


PS: This bar has scarred me (literally), so it will be with me forever. I was on rollerskates last Halloween and I fell while trying to make my way out the door. I tried to catch myself and gashed my wrist on the doorframe, which is now a hideous scar. Oops.
author: Megan B.

description:
This place stinks. Literally. 

I went here for the first time on Friday, and had a few drinks with some friends. Sitting here, I was thinking of how much i'm not really into the Mission bar scene, I noticed a pack of Depends in between the booth we were sitting at and the next one. WTF kind of place has a pack of Depends just chillin, waiting for someone in need? The place radiated of grimy hipsters, I should have known by the two Vespas parked outside. I had some unfiltered beer on tap, that was one of the most hideously looking and tasting beers EVER! It was like drinking dirt water! And the guy walking around asking if anyone saw his pack of cigarettes. Like get with the program dude, nobody saw them, but everyone smoked them! This place reminded me of Trees Lounge, that movie where Steve Buscemi plays a pervert...and I swore I saw Gary Busey in here too!!
author: rich s.

description:
5 years ago I'd've (that's right bitches, double contraction) given this place twice as many stars.

Think about that band you loved that not that many people knew about that you just had to hate for selling out once they blew up, even though they're essentially the exact same band. Really you just  can't admit what it says about you that all these douches like the same thing that you do.  These things happen.

Think Common, "I Used to Love H.E.R."

And then skip the Dirty D. If there were any more cocaine residue on the lids of the toilet tanks Gary Busey would be fighting through the retarded throngs to lick them.

2 stars instead of 1 'cause of $2 Tecate in a can.
author: Trav W.

description:
Only been here once, with some Mish-living friends, and what the fuck? 
What is the appeal of this place, again? I am probably too white/old/suburban to get it, but do people really like the stink of this place that much? Are the drinks that good? I wouldn't know because I don't drink cocktails anymore. All I know is the beer selection is crap. 
I give them one star because they DID have these two girl DJ's the night I was there who were playing a SICK set. I think it was a Thursday night.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Goddamn, I sure seem to end up here a lot. Why? There's really nothing shocking about experiencing this particular Delirium. It's a bar. Some small tables along one wall, a booth in front, the usual stools, and a black-hole room in back where DJs spin after 10 pm. Checkered tile floor. Gray walls with lithographed rock posters. Enjoyable jukebox. Pool. Pinball. And the crowd is usually just fine...although, as with most things at the nexus of 16th Street and Guerrero/Valencia, you're better off going early, before the lemmings swarm in and take everything over.

Frankly, the most instantly outstanding characteristic of Delirium is its motto: "Service for the Sick." Now THAT is a manifesto worth supporting!

But the real reason I love Delirium is this. Let me tell you a story....

[...insert flashback waves here...]

Picture it: December 2006. It was, as the cliche goes, a cold and rainy night. And, so it happens, the date of the annual SantaCon pub crawl and chaos party. For those who don't know, SantaCon is a yearly excuse for Cacophony Society weirdos to dress like Santa, get completely trashed, and terrorize every boring bourgeois drone they can find. They call it "Santarchy" and it is just a few Jaegermeisters short of a riot.

So on this chilly, wet day in December, there is a group of people dressed in Santa suits and sipping beers at Delirium. Note that I said "sipping" beers...because it quickly became clear that this was not the real SantaCon, just some bland-ass Marina types who had heard something about dressing up like Santa and hitting a few bars. They were quiet, respectful, and utterly, shamefully BORING.

The bartender at Delirium, thankfully, knew all about SantaCon and, had he not been scheduled to work, admitted he would have joined the alcoholic holiday fray himself. Thus he was becoming increasingly agitated by the non-antics of the wack wannabe Santas.

"Come on!!!" he shouted. "I thought you guys were supposed to be the crazy drunken Santas! Do something!"

No response from the polite, preppy Santa squad.

"OK, free whiskey shots for anyone who jumps onto the bar and starts dancing!"

No response.

"You people are pathetic! You make me sick!"

No response again. Finally, the bartender had had enough.

"All right, all you assholes get the fuck out of my bar!! Santas, get out! You're pathetic! Cock smokers!!! Get out now!"

Confused, our sad Santas sorta shuffled towards the front door and left the bartender red-faced and huffing mad.

Finally, with Poseurcon 2006 (as I had decided to name it) taking its lifeless party to some other venue, the bartender was able to calm down. He served up a round of free Jameson shots for those of us who remained. We drank. We swore. We cursed the poseurs. And everything got better with a quickness.

[...end of flashback...]

Long story short: Any beerhole where the bartender encourages costumed mayhem and kicks out those who fail to comply...well, that's a place I'm glad to spend my money.

Hell, there's still time to go there right now!

PS: Lest you think I'm making this up, read another Yelper's previous post from 12/11/2006. Clearly we're "on different pages," as my former yuppie boss would have said, but the fact remains: Delirium doesn't endorse boredom. Be "sick" or be eighty-sixed.
author: John G.

description:
Pssssh....

I can't find a single beer here that is worth drinking.

Good thing too because the bartender will walk by you 5 times doing nothing before she thinks it's appropriate to wait on you.

I can think of a million bars I would rather try than this one. I have no idea why I ended up here on a Saturday night with my drunk ass yet NOT crackhead book club and my girlfriend depressed because she thought her boyfriend was fucking some other broad.  

I was done by 11. Too depressing and irritating to keep drinking.  I needed to smile.
author: Alexis B.

description: $2 Tecate brings me in, and the bumpin' 80's Saturday night dance floor keeps me there. I always meet pretty okay people, sometimes extra-okay but the place is a great dive-hipster establishment. Don't expect the world and you shall be truly happy going to Delirium!
author: Caitlin F.

description:
I can't help it.  I kind of hate this place.  Even though you can smoke, they have good DJ nights, and pinball.  It still sucks.  I think it's the clientele.  They ruin it for everyone.

EDIT:  I was about to review this place, but then realized that I already had.  What I say stands.  It blows.  It has the most nastified restrooms I've ever seen after Zeitgeist, but I happen to think that they are still better than DNA's.  Oh, and the DJ played my song last night within 20 minutes of me requesting.  Cheers to that boy.  Nobody ever plays my song.

EDIT:  One more star for Delirium because it really is magic.  It's all about going on a Sunday night when you know you shouldn't, but say fuck it because you're drunk already so you might as well make tomorrow suck.  Wasted dance with a bunch of dudes, maybe physically asssault a bike messenger or two, run into people you haven't seen in ages, and harass the fuck out of them.  Good times.  Dope rhymes.  A fun way to ruin you life.
author: Coco D.

description:
This place is a little wacky, but in a good way.  You've got all kinds off different people in here.  It's not too big, but not to small either.  It's sort of narrow in the front then it opens a bit to a pool table, and a back room where you can shake your tail feather to the best tunes, like Michael Jackson and Depeche Mode.  Does it get any better than that?

Once again, drinks are cheap and strong, and it's not to hard to work your way up to the bar to order, 1, 2 or three.

P.S. Eww...who is sn*rting c*ke in the back room?  Gross.  JUST SAY NO!!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
So I used to come here all the time.. then I realized it's actually pretty gross. 

You can go there to dance in the back room.. if you feel like having an asthma induced stroke from all the 2ndhand smoke floating around.

Yeah its affordable, yeah there's no cover charge.. but it always seems to take AGES to get a drink and every time, without fail, I have had SOMEONE have SOMETHING stolen. No seriously. 

I'm also not fond of the fact that every time I go there I find at least 5 people that have slept with an acquaintance of mine who is an std ridden pony ride.  yeahhh..  that gets old quick. 

Not the best neighborhood and parking is awful.. take the 22 or take a cab better yet. actually my full recomendation is to not even bother because you'll need a huge scrub down bath by the time you get home. =/
author: Diana R.

description:
It's a bar.  I went there to watch the Warrior's game a few weeks ago because I was in the area and was fascinated by the rowdy 20somethings in skinny-jeans, they were like thug-hipsters.  I didn't get it.

cheap drinks, it's a bar.
author: Segue P.

description:
Delirium is one of those bars where it's possible to have a conversation with the person sitting in front of you without yelling at the top of your lungs. The drinks are very inexpensive (4 dollars for a gin & tonic)! It's hipster-divey, but I don't mind that so much. The crowd is polite (believe it or not!) and the bartenders are friendly. The bathroom is a bit disgusting, but we ARE talking about a bar in the Mission. 

Only 3 stars because I didn't love it or hate it.
author: Christine N.

description:
I was one of the original Albion regulars when Todd owned it, 15-20 years ago. Snuck back  into S.F. after years away, and had to check out the old hangouts. It is exactly as I left it. Drugs, sex, rock n roll. 
On the weekends, the want-to be cool people show up, start fights, act like teenagers. SOS. By the way youngsters, the "Service for the Sick" sign came from a hospital emergency room!! FYI. No mirrors in the bathroom...arseholes broke them for years.
author: Tif B.

description:
i've been going here for at least a couple of years now. i'm friends with most of the staff ... i used to DJ 80s night on saturdays with my friend, Jules (he still does it every saturday). I also had a residency here on 3rd mondays every month where I played 70s punk and uk stuff. I like DJing here. I like the VIP section for my friends. 

people who complain about the dirty bathrooms?? are you a f*cking marina yuppy "slumming it" in the mission? i've never once complained about a dirty bathroom in a bar. have you ever been in the greyhound bus station bathroom in cleveland? if not, then shut up. it's a bar ... you get drunk ... is a little piss on the floor going to make you cry? pull the silver spoon out of your mouth or go across the street to double dutch or blondies around the corner.
author: James J.

description:
I have a high score on one of the pinball machines here so the four stars might be a little biased...but I don't have a high score on any other pinball machines in SF so cut me some slack. 

Yes, this place is full of Mission rats. 

Yes, they are most likely fucked out of their gourds on flour cut with Metamucil (that's coke y0!)

Yes, this joint is pretty filthy. 

Buuuuuuuut, the Tecates are cheap and the staff is actually pretty damn friendly. 

I bet this joint has created some new strain of Mission HPV  and for that I've got to give it propz.
author: Cliff C.

description:
I know so many cool people who like this bar, but I just can't vouch for it.  I like my dive bars, but this one is too gross for me.  It smells like b.o. as soon as you walk in.  Show up absolutely wasted and it isn't as bad.

If you were there on Friday night, I'm sorry I knocked your drink over.
author: angela k.

description:
hmmm.... ah this is among a whole string of bars in the mission that i frequent from time to time. all i can say is that on the right night the dance parties in the back room are off the hook. yeah i said off the hook. 

so grab your vans and your favorite stunners and go and get out there!
author: kevin C.

description:
Small, Dirty-ish, generally stuffy.
I've come here on a lazy day.
Too many hipsters, but its the mission so I guess I'm screwed.
author: Tom S.

description:
You have to like music if you wanna go here, cuz otherwise, the BO and the shear mass of people will turn you away. However, ive had enough practice going to Co-opt parties in berkeley to train myself for this rigorous condition.  

Having that said, i like this place. 80s music on weekends, friendly people who are down for meeting new folks, and cheap drinks.  Bring folks who like to dance here. Cuz if they dont, they will not have fun.  Just a great place for a solid weekend night to blow off some steam.  People arent the must attractive, but hey, you got anyone else better to make out with? just go, ya dork!

oh yeah, wear shoes you dont mind getting beer spilled on. that ground is nasty
author: Michael N.

description: Their slogan is "Service for the Sick"...how can you not love that?  Been popping into here for years.  One of the divier bars in the area, but hey, at least they have a pool table in the back.  Good for a pop along the way.  I've heard of them having BBQ in the daytme on weekends before, but I've never been here in the day.
author: Roy N.

description:
I am not a Mission fan. I guess I'm just your typical conservative. The district totally grosses me out on almost every level.

That being said, I still forage into this dirty neighborhood if my friends want to go. I don't mind... but I'd rather be somewhere a little less dicey.

I've been to Delirium a couple times. It gets really packed on weekends and is pretty narrow. This is the punk/emo/nonconformist weirdo crowd's hangout. I ordered a $2 Tecate with a lime and surveyed the scene. I counted 10 normal haircuts in the whole place. As I was gawking at this one freak's black "Simply Red" haircut, a brouhaha broke out.

Some fired up vato was screaming at an off-the-boat Irish hippie.

"Let's go homeboy!" Repeating it over and over. He had to be dragged away, and almost threw down fisticuffs. Typical degenerate. Tattoos all up and down his arms, black Dodgers hat cocked askew, probably had a criminal record. Obvious Raider fan.

This marked the first time in history that I would have defended a hippie if needed be.

Anyway, this place isn't all bad. It's an interesting mix of people, the tunes are pretty good and the prices are reasonable. I love drinking out of a can in a bar too, it just makes a man feel good.
author: Dan P.

description:
This is one of my favorite dives. perhaps because it was the first bar I ever went to, ohhhh 3 years ago or so? $2 tecate, $2.50 PBR (on tap) yes yes.. classy with a capital K! their jukebox rules for having murder city devils on it, I heart wet panties is a great time. Their DJs are way legit. The bathrooms... not so much, 1 stall is no fun. It can get pretty sweaty in the back when it starts packing in with folks after 11, you used to be able to smoke in the back but then they got mashed in the butt for it and had to put up signs and scold people.  Dunno if theyre still being nazi's about it, though the review below me claims otherwise. I like the area, you can go accross to kilowatt, double dutch, gastault etcetc.

all around a good grimey time. PLUS the hotdog fools outside after coming out are a god sent.
author: Katie R.

description:
Typical divey neighborhood bar.  

Can't say I remember anything about the place.  

Can't say it was bad though either.  

I think I just have a neutral feeling on the place.

I strongly believe that if you have good company almost anywhere will be fun.  That said, I had fun here but I don't remember anything about the bar, just the company I was with.
author: Denise B.

description:
Smells a lot better than when it was the Albion.

Good stiff drinks.
author: Marz W.

description:
This is the place to be if you like shitty cocaine and leftover hipsters.

Sometimes it's alright, though.  I like beer!
author: slayerela b.

description: If you can stand being ignored by bartenders or surrounded by hipsters then this is the place for you. Good music.
author: Maren A.

description:
El Delirium, (my term of endearment for you)

 I guess I owe you a review since I spent much of my first few years in the city in your dark, dingy backroom getting sweaty from dancing (dancing and only dancing mom i swear!) 

We have a love/hate relationship.

You have provided me with several dating partners and many memorable after parties. Your bartenders have always been kind to me and service has always been quick. (tip: don't be a jerk at the bar, yelling and waving money around and this might be your experience too). You've been a haven after a hard day of work on many an occasion during the week. And for this I thank you. 

You have also ruined countless shoes and jackets with the mysterious liquid that coats your back-room floor and the various areas I stash my coat. You will be responsible when I get cancer later in life from all the second hand smoke I have inhaled and holy sh*t where did all these 21 year olds come from? For this stuff, I curse you.

Still, I always know when I walk through that door a good time will be had.
author: Zoe s.

description:
I hit up this place every once in a while usually on the Thursday night tip, its almost always the last stop on the Valencia Drunk roll, and must say, im loyal. Two Tecates and a Jager Shot for 5 bucks...prices like that make you wanna slap yo mama!. Cool spot, coo crowd, music is good. Delirium NEEDS to employ the hot dog guy, jesus that guy gets a fuckin star too, perfect night cap for a belly full of booze. 

funny story, after we all got the boot from Delirium, this car drove up in front of the place, full of Stale Bread, Best bread fight.
author: Joe J.

description:
A damn good shit hole dive bar.  I only usually go on Friday when the 80's music in the back is playing.  Usually this place gets packed around 11ish, but its not that bad usually.  Fortunately, the bartenders are pretty good, I never have to wait long for a drink even with a large crowd.  $2 Tecate can't be wrong.

Last call comes fairly late and the crowd on the dance floor is not too shabby.  I've had a ton of awesome nights here.  Get drunk before you go, it'll be more fun.  If you're complaining about this place, what the hell are you doing here (or in the mission)?  Who cares, everyone here is out to have a good time.
author: Chris R.

description: Oh the fun I've had at delirium.  Smoking, dancing, drinking, tamales, bacon dogs and on and on.  This place is a blast.  Sure, it's over run with lost little hipster losers, but still a kick-ass place to let loose.
author: Kathy H.

description: Ive only been here once but I had fun. The bartender was nice and I really like the decor. They also have back room for DJs which is cool if you are in the mood for dancing. If you are easily scared by dirty bathrooms, maybe avoid this place..reallllyyy run down and gross.
author: stella b.

description:
The first bar I went to on my 21st birthday (well, I guess it was still the night before my birthday), got there at last call, my friend bought me an irish car bomb, I left. Yeah, I think it's kind of like that...

This is THE place to go for an awesome mix of San Francisco's finest! ....finest coked out mission sluts, college duuuuudes, random stripe shirts, and underaged people who think they are having a good time. Hot damn!!!
author: katharine s.

description:
I love dive bars and this had the right atmosphere.

We decided to pop in on St Patties and the crowd was decent except for the table behind us that had a girl who was screaming at the top of her lungs. Tad annoying but I'm sure she had one too many. They left shortly so there was definitely a relief. 

Drinks are strong and fun. :)

People were friendly but well, most people are when they're intoxicated. A guy that was sitting next to us offered to play some 2 player iPhone game with him. Icebreaker I guess. It wasn't cheesy so it didn't bother me too much. We were just out to have fun and socialize. 

I'll be back. For sure.
author: Jacinta H.

description: BBQ, rock n' roll and beer?  this place rules....plus Travis is dreamy....
author: Gabriel F.

description:
I like to get a $2 PBR here before and/or after I tutor the kiddies at the clubhouse a block away.

It relaxes me.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
I've only been here on Mondays because they have decent dj's playing psych music. It would be nice if there were more people dancing, but eh, whatever.

The bartenders haven't gypped me on my whiskey and sodas (no offense to gypsy yelpers...please don't put a curse on me). Gotta like a bar that doesn't just kill your wallet but your brain cells as well.

My friends have warned me that it's a meat market here on weekends. I guess I should eventually roll by (I only live three blocks away) one Saturday being that I'm a fan of vaginas and all.

Joke.

Well, kinda.
author: Paul W.

description:
Delirium basically sums up the attitude of the Mission...

All the patrons there think that everywhere else in the City sucks, and doesn't bother to hide those thoughts.  I went to Delirium after having a really nice dinner in the Mission, I was dressed up a little (jeans and a collared shirt) and I've never gotten so many dirty looks from people who thought I should 'go back to the Marina'. 

Don't get me wrong, the drinks are cheap, the bartenders are friendly and the place is a great dive bar, but the attitude of the patrons is ridiculous and completely brings down the entire establishment.  All the Mish junkies need to get over the attitude and embrace the fact that there are great bars that people from other parts of the City want to come to! Lose the attitude!
author: Craig E.

description: Thursday night Built for Speed rocks my ass.  Cheap strong drinks, cool bartenders, and hot rockin DJs.
author: Alice S.

description:
Well, if you need to dance on any given night of the week, and you don't fancy a cover-charge, at least Delirium is there. (But, I didn't say it was GOOD music, mind you.)

Nevermind that the crowd can be a little...iffy. Or that my friend got her purse stolen, and found, emptied of cash/cards/IPHONE, near the men's bathroom....or that the doorguy said it happens a lot just at closing. Also turn a blind eye at the immense amount of homeless just outside the door, doing what they do best. 

At least they have cheap booze and a dance floor when you need it most.
author: Danyell K.

description:
Here's a tip, albeit a mighty stupid tip if you are hip to these sorts of rules, but a tip nonetheless:

If you show up here after midnight, you will hate yourself.

Especially if you're sober and looking for friends inside the dark, packed, humid bar.

I've given Delirium 3 stars to be fair, but man oh man I docked myself 4 stars for being stupid enough to come here after the witching hour.
author: Jen I.

description:
Wow.. ONE STAR? Who are you people!?

Delirium is a great bar. I actually got to know it because I used to frequent another bar that has since closed. One of my favorite bartenders got a job at Delirium and I visited her there when she moved.  

I live in Seattle, WA now but whenever I go home I try to visit her at Delirium and every time I go I enjoy myself thoroughly. 

First - drinks are a good price, they're strong, and the staff is friendly and helpful. I've never had to wait more than a minute to get a bartender's attention to re-order a drink.

Second - the people who frequent the bar seem somewhat rowdy and fun. It's not really a quiet bar but its not pretentious or too seedy either. It's a very happy median. 

Third - it reminds me of some of my favorite bars in Seattle. 

It's an all around great bar. I recommend it to anyone who doesn't think they're "too cool" for a nice stiff drink.
author: Katy H.

description:
Guhhhh ok. So I got called out for not really "writing a review" on this one by a few folks, so I thought I'd revise this to be more review-like, and especially to defend myself from being called a hipster-hater (my original review: It's true, this is where hipsters go to die).

Before we commence on the actual review portion, it should be noted this is a review subjective to my own experiences, feelings, etc. and  that I have nothing against those who claim to be "hipsters" or people who call me a "hipster", or people that hate on hipsters. I don't even know what it means to be a hipster. I just dress the way I dress.

That said, it's not that I don't like Delirium. I do. I really do, and it's one of the first places I used to regularly hang out at when I was new in town. Often a hit or a miss, but this is in the block where you're bound to run into someone you know, and it makes for a good time, generally. delirium isn't necessarily a dirt cheap or a fancy bar. It's a dive in the Mission, a place where neighbors and kids come out to play. Drinks are decent, and the bartenders are always nice. People mind their business and there's never drama. I enjoy the laid-back nature and the variety of music played here, as well as the occasional billiards, but having been offered a crack rock next to the pin-ball machine by some cholo, provided that I ditch my boyfriend, kind of made me like the place less. I know that's not necessarily an experience related to the bar operating itself the way it does, but this was kind of like just another reason to try to scope out another place to go in the Mission. it's not like this is the only bar.

The other thing that started to get to me was the amount of East Bay bros that obviously crossed the bridge to come here on the weekends. Or the ones from North Beach that decided it was cool to branch out. There is little place in the Mission for popped collar and sport coats, and especially no room for hair gel and silly pickup lines... please. It is menacing. Who behaves this way anymore? I could look past this if it weren't for the fact that everytime I'm outside smoking some creep who claims to be an artist would start talking to me and try to get me to go home with him. Or the fact that each time I go, the bar seems emptier and emptier and there is something so sad/pathetic about a few scattered individuals getting wasted alone in an empty bar, drowning their sorrows in vodka. I haven't hit mid-life crisis yet and I'd rather hang out somewhere more lively.

All that aside, if I'm invited to hang out I always stop in.
author: Y K.

description:
Where are these debauched good times?  The times I have gone it has been pretty mellow.  Strong drinks, decent jukebox.

Damn you, yelpers...I went in expecting 'Velvet Goldmine' and I got 'The Brady Bunch'.  No coke orgies? Pbsst...later.  ;)
author: MakeUp M.

description:
This place is kind of small and most of the action takes place in the back. For the first round, I recommend trying to saddle up to the bar in front. The bartenders at Delirium are fun to talk to. It's even more fun to watch the crowd socialize with one another. 

After you order your second round, head straight to the back room. Can't find it? Pass the pool tables and follow the loud music. In the back room you will find plenty of darkness, room to dance, drink, smoke and flirt with all of the other hipster kids. Yes, you can smoke in the back room.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
My four-star review is mostly based on the fact that every time I go here I meet a girl.  I typically don't meet girls at bars because I'm typically not into the types of girls you find at bars, but somehow I enter this place and interesting girls gravitate towards me.

Outside of that it's your average ultra-hip dance-dive bar where smoking is somehow allowed indoors . . . I hate dancing but I'll grab some $2 Tecates and get wyld.
author: Alex K.

description: Delirium is known as the place where 'Service for the Sick'. I don't know if that suppose to bring hardcore drinkers in here, but it's far from being ill. ( in a good way). Most of the people that come here, are social drinkers and the music they play match their mood. They play a lot of 80's music, nothing too heavy or hardcore. While the slogan says that, the place is far from being like a biker bar or something like a rough crowd. The place is open daily as the Happy Hour starts at 7 pm. 2 dollars for tecate, $2 for PBR Pints. Once in a while, you might want to check out the free BBQ on Saturdays and Sunday.
author: Ivy V.

description: I've been here twice - once on the weekend and once during happy hour during the week.  The back room had a DJ playing music on the weekend and I thoroughly enjoyed people watching.  The happy hour crowd was interesting.  It ranged from the nearly homeless to older professional.  I enjoyed the snark the bartender gave me when I ordered my Midori Sour sans fruit (why yes sir, I am a tough guy ordering a Midori Sour.  No silly fruit for me).  The drink was fine and cheap.  No complaints.
author: Marie B.

description: This is seriously the WORST BAR EVER. I grew up in the mission, I have accepted its changes. I enjoy most of the bars on 16th but every time my friends drag me to Delirirum, I hate it. The music is so cheesy, the crowd is a terrible mix of unattractive hipsters and overly aggressive nerdy men. I have seen the bouncers pick random people and kick them out for no reason. I WOULD NOT GO TO THIS BAR.
author: eliza s.

description: This bar is pretty fun on a weekend but watch out for the bitchy bartenders on the weekdays. I went there last night with three good friends (all local) and because we didn't look like hipsters, I think the bartender assumed we were tourists. She automatically asked us for our ID's and gave us the stink eye when we asked for PBR. Sorry if I don't have neck tattoos or carry a Chrome bag, doesn't mean you have to have a 'tude with me, sheesh.
author: Carly W.

description:
A case study in a good bar ruined, Delerium took the neighborhood divey goodness of the Albion and has managed to turn it into pre-packaged, douche-filled, marina-safe awfulness. While it's nice that all these hateful people congregate in only one or two places making them easier to avoid, why couldn't y'all have stayed at the Skylark (a bar created for you)?

P.S. Stop ruining Dalva as well.
author: Andrew L.

description:
they don't accept cards!!!
they don't make anything blue or wtvr they said.
i was quite disappointed of this place.
author: Annie H.

description:
I loved it in here! The beer was cheap (Blue Moon was especially nice) and I found myself revisiting songs that I thought had been long forgotten.


 I loved 16th Street in the heart of the Mission. This is the best part of SF to hang out in.
author: cleoisaleng

description:
Many drunkin' nights here and many more to come!

The only way this could be better is if all the people that gave it a bad review would never come to Delirium again.
author: Jimmy S.

description:
Serious drinks. But this dark-walled, graffiti decorated dive bar gets so insanely crowded sometimes, it's almost impossible to get one. I've definitely had fun at this place in the past, playing pool, dancing, and sitting at the bar with friends, but last time I went, all of these things were impossible. 
The bathroom toilet actually had a piece of shit on it. No joke. Not to mention the pool of pee gathering at the toilet base. This place is just dirty. And full of dirty looking hipsters too. But of course, some people like that kind of thing.
Delirium is the place to head to when you're already schlitzed, broke, and just don't give a fuck. Cheeeeers.
author: Leah E.

description:
$2 Tecate.
You can smoke in the back.
Sexy underage hipster girls.
And, you know, the music and stuff.

I love you Delerium.  You are tied with Geshtalt for my Best Bar on Your Particular Block award.
author: Michael F.

description:
Ok.  I admit I can be a bit bourgeois (*cough* just a bit *cough*).  But even I can acknowledge a solid addition to the dive bar genre when I see one.  Whiskey Thieves on Geary near Larkin, for instance, is a solid addition to the genre.  2Lips on Market near Fell is another solid addition to the genre.

Delirium CAN not and SHOULD not be added to that list.  One of the most recent reviewers called it a "dark, stinky, smoky, gross, shithole".  I have to agree with her... and I DO mean that in a bad way.

Just because you're a divebar doesn't mean you have to be nasty, does it?  Where in the rule book of dive bars does it say that you don't have to unstick the gum from underneath the tables and bar stools?  Where does it say that you can't run a mop over the bathroom floor more than once a year?  Maybe you can get a little bit of Lysol and use it on the bar itself?

And hey, in this day and age to not accept credit cards at a bar should be a crime punishable by death.  Seriously, people!  Stop trying to get MORE money out of me by charging two dollars to get money out of YOUR ATM so I can spend money at YOUR bar!  That will always start me off in a bad freakin' mood.

I give up on finding a decent dive bar in the Mission.  I know that the Mission is supposed to be this hip spot for places like this, but come on people... we can expect better out of our alcoholic watering holes!  We SHOULD expect better.

My name is Kurt C and I approved this message.

That is all.
author: Kurt C.

description:
This place makes me just a bit nauseous, but it's not like they aren't trying to.  That's the cool thing about Delirium; it's a self-aware sleazepit.  

If you must go wearing long pants, roll up the bottoms to avoid contact with the floor.  And try to leave your jacket at home or in the car, because you will be sweating inside.

Back to the plus side, you really will have fun here if you're willing to rough it a little.  Delirium is a fantastic place to be drunk.  First of all, there's the music they play: the likes of "Come on Eileen," "Walk Like an Egyptian," and "Tainted Love," so in the room that's supposedly for dancing there are really just people jumping up and down and singing along, and everybody is loving it.  Second, everyone else is drunk and the collective good mood is likely to rub off on you.  Also, for some reason the customers there tend to be on the attractive side.  And finally, and perhaps most important, immediately outside the bar is a guy selling those Mexican bacon-wrapped hot dogs from a little cart that deserves its own review.

I mean to give Delirium 3.5 stars, taking into account that experiences may vary greatly.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Gimme a D
Gimme an E
Gimme a L
OK who in the hell am I kidding...I can't spell DELIRIUM if I had too many to drink!!  $2 PBR!!  You can not go wrong!!!  I am not sure if it is happy hour or if its their regular prices...I don't care..I was there and it was $2.  What time was it?  5:00PM.  Maybe it was happy hour.  Maybe it was our charming personalities!  Hehehe  $2 tecates too!  The cute guy sitting next to us reading his book sure was enjoying his tecate!

I definitely enjoyed myself here.  Surprisingly did not have to visit the lavatories.  After reading all these reviews I don't think I wanted to.  I will be back for more!
BTW the bartender was nice!!!  I was not her friend and she treated us well!!!
THANK YOU!!!

Definitely a dive bar.  But back for more!!!
author: Elisa O.

description:
This bar is one of the ones I miss the most from SF. I always had such a great time here. It is some what of a hole in the wall but its great! drinks are reasonable. Not pricey, boy are cute, music is good. Great environment. The bar always gets crowded but the more the better right? If you are a girl and want to meet boys, this place can be a cock fest so..... you get to pick your man. lol

I have met so many good people in this bar. Great times !
author: Berenice D.

description: nice try...giving me change for a $20 and not the $100 I gave you.  You noticed it was a $100 bill.  You took time fumbling around in the cash drawer.  You nonchalantly gave me change, looking away and quickly moving along.  And when I called you out on it, you said "Oh, you gave me a hundred, right?  Don't be mad at me."  Whatever.  You knew what you were doing.  No need at all to be pulling that jive on your customers.  None at all.
author: Derrick D.

description:
Can we say, "deliri-YUM?"

I'm sitting on the bar here a few weeks after moving to SF, chatting with the woman to my left, and all of a sudden there this wierd ripple goes through the place and everyone starts moving toward the front of the joint. I saunter over and in the middle of all this is this older lady with a couple of huge Igloos on a little red wagon.

Bwuh.

The woman I was talking to gave me the fill-in, and this is how I met the Tamale Lady, and discovered that tamales didn't have to be nasty dry things with zero flavor. The ones I got made me feel a little better about getting my FUCKING CAR TOWED after, lemming that I am, I parked in the middle of Valencia Street because everyone else was.

The back room is cool when you want to smoke and pretend you're still a badass (if you ever were: your friends dispute this).
author: Karsten P.

description:
Hmmm....You walk into a bar full of Santa Clauses and no one else on a Saturday night...it's a strange evening.  Really bad, loud music...and I'm pretty tolerant. The beer was cold and the bartendress was nice enough. 

Not a fan but apparently some people are since they sell T-shirts at the bar.
author: Angela N.

description:
Truly a dive bar, but in all the ways you would want it to be. Its dark, dingy and full of enough graffiti to keep annoying marina types away and they have $2 tecates (fancy fresh from le can). There's a coveted pool table that I usually don't get a chance to use, but its not to say you can't grab one of the extra pool cues whilst wearing a cowboy hat and start poking the dance room ceiling during your wait. 

The dance room I should mention is where the magic is really at. You can smoke (anything) in there and usually meet some fun people who might want to throw champagne around the room whilst dancing to blue monday or the Ramones. Sadly the music can be a bit predictable sometimes and some nights its overall a miss, Delirium is one of the few places you can dance to rock and for that I thank it, some of most memorable nights were held there. If only i could remember them more clearly.
author: Eric O.

description:
This bar is dirty, usually crowded, smells funny, and serves PBR on tap in a plastic keg cup.

I am in love.

It's everything a grimy Mission dive should be. Granted the scene kids tend to hang out here (you know the ones with the too tight skinny jeans, multi color emo hair, and grandma sweaters on), I still tend to gravitate to Delirium. I always either start off here or end up here at some point in my night of Mission bar hopping and I always end up taking a few drunken flixs in the their bathroom. All that graff in the bathroom makes a most perfect backdrop.

However I do have to agree that the crowdedness does suck. Good luck finding a seat or trying to play pool. Oh yea...and I almost NEVER go to that mysterious backroom people are talking about.

Oh yea, one more thing: the tamale lady usually makes this one of her weekend stops and I f***ing love her and her tasty treats.
author: Carly C.

description:
This place is a dark, stinky, sticky, smoky, gross shithole. I don't exactly mean that in a bad way, I'm just sayin. It is what it is. 

Fun place to dance and hit on marina chicks and spit beer and then black out at.
author: Raquel M.

description: Best bar there is for a nice hang out with the friends. Staff are really cool and laid back. Best and coldest beer there is in town.
author: Valdeir F.

description: Delerium used to be named The Albion, where I spent quite a lot of time at in the late 1990's.  Back then it was a bit more sleezy, which was great.  We went there on Friday, and there was free food, which was a total plus. The bartenders are friendly, the drinks are reasonably poured and priced, and it's dark enough so that any vampire can kick back and relax...  I hear it gets annoying at night, but isn't that any bar in the mission these days?
author: Sam A.

description:
Love the 80s/90s music. 
But mostly, the cheap beer =)

The down side is that it's really cramped in the back. Small dance floor and it needs a little touch up. Other than that, it's a good place to chill with old friends and play "thumbs."
author: Jamie M.

description: I gots the Saturday Night Fever dancing here, it gets Fing HOT in that backroom. But I like sweating and smoking and moving so thats alright by me. I could stand for a little more elbow room, but bumping ass  with strangers is alright too. Sorry if my sweat rubbed off on you. Oh and I got a burn on my forehead from that carpet lined pole.
author: Velcro F.

description:
Hipsters anyone? I follow the queen of the hipsters with her flowing Joan Jett locks , skinny jeans, and giant Nike high tops to this super dive. She left her 80's sunglasses at home because it is pretty late on Sunday night. 
DJ Rooster has a regular night on Sundays and he kicks ass. If you want to dance your tale off in the back, this is the night to do it. I Will admit that after a big weekend and Sopranos I don't get it out there that much,but it is worth it for those who can.
author: Roxane S.

description:
Why oh why must nights too often end at this hell hole? The only redeeming qualities are the cheap drinks and back room smoking.

p.s. Why "shots only" at last call? SO lame.
author: Whit P.

description:
What isn't great about Delirium?  The drinks are super cheap, the music keeps me dancing, and the boys are tragically hip.  

If only Delirium stayed open past 2...
author: Jeni D.

description:
Delirium is about 2.5 stars on most nights.  It's one of those places I end up at because either I'm meeting people in the Mission, or I'm trying to avoid people who'll be hanging out at those "other" spots in the Mission.

While I love the music, I can't stand to die of lung cancer from dancing in the back room.  Spend just a few minutes back there and you'll stumble out with a few bruises, and smelling of sweat and ashes.  But the drinks come cheap, fast, and stiff; and there's plenty of interesting folks to check out.  Really, it's entertaining if you've got nothing else to do.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
Not really feelin this place. Maybe becuase I've only been on Saturdays, I heard weekdays are much better. 

$2 Tecates kinda suck because everybody knows Tecates DON"T GET ANYONE DRUNK, unless you drink a shitload of them. Which in that case you might as well buy half as many good beers for your money. 

The people are okay. At least everyone is out to have a good time, but in a extremely self centered kinda way. 

The music- so so. I dig 80s and New Wave shit, but that's all they play. Seriously, I feel like I'm listening to the fuckin radio every time i come in there. The same 8 fuckin songs every time. There should be a list somewhere of "every song your guaranteed to hear at Delirium on a Saturday night". Please believe "Come on Eileen" would be in there. fuck "Come on Eileen".

Anyways, enough blabbin. Do I like it, not really. Would I go back, probably, but not by my choice, If I were in the area again I would probably go to SKYLARK, or DOUBLEDUTCH. But skylark had some weird no hat policy last time I tried to go there.
author: Lawrence A.

description: stopped by this bar briefly while bar hopping with a friend & my bf. my first experience with a "dive" bar-- i still don't get it haha. it gets very crowded, therefore very stuffy. HOWEVER, service is prompt and the bartenders aren't shady at all with shots. most importantly easy on your wallet!
author: Erika R.

description: 1 bathroom for a huge cash only bar?!?!  no way!!  it is always humid in here, the lines are crazy whether it be to order to a drink, move 5 steps, or use the toilet.  I have no desire to frequent this place on a weekend.. I am just so over it... and somebody took my drink!!  the patrons are just as obnoxious as their 1 bathroom!!!
author: blair k.

description: Friendly atmosphere.  Randomly spied a bicycle and a dog on a leash inside.  A little crowded, but good vibes for sure.
author: Sabrina G.

description: way too overcrowded on weekends. the space was too small and it wasn't pleasant having beer and drinks being splash everywhere. Its a shame because beer is for drinking and not bathing. however the music is the only reason why I gave it 2 stars as oppose to 1.
author: Richie W.

description:
I don't drink, but I still like to visit bars for social reasons.

Anyways, if you don't drink and you're not eating in a bar, you'll quickly notice that if you order soda only, its more than the price of a two-liter in a pint glass.  For me, the queen of "That cost HOW much?", this is one of the primary factors as to why I like Delirium:

Go in any night aside from Friday, Saturday or possibly Sunday, and you can usually pay $1.50 and get all the soda you want.  (Or at least the two or three times that I've been there on a weeknight this happens.)

Plus, the smoking room in the back is a absolutely brilliant idea.  I wish more places had these- and I don't really smoke much anymore!
author: Hannah N.

description:
Like the SFBG said about a year ago...
"If you can't get laid at Delirium, you can't get laid anywhere."

$2 beers are great, but sometimes the DJ SUCKS...perhaps it is to encourage inebriation so that people will loose their inhibitions and have sex on the dance floor.  I've kinda always wanted to see that.
author: Katie Sue A.

description:
One of my favorite spots in the mission. Period. 

I like this bar because it's in the center of it  all. Amazing mexican food, the tamale lady, and if i feel like going to a different bar for awhile before coming back there's at least 8 good  bars i can head to in the area. 

They play great music, have a dance floor and it's cheap! 2 dollar tecates all night every night. 

They have everything you could possibly want - You can smoke in the back and it's got pinball, a pool 
table and other arcade games.  

The only gripe i have about this place is it gets crowded and I mean crowded, which can seriously harm you getting a drink and fast.  Unless of course you know the bartenders and then well, you're a pig in shit.  So oink oink!
author: California G.

description:
Good drinks.
Great music.

Delirium can get pretty crowded when the sun goes down ... personally I like it this way. Kinda boring when there's not enough drunk people to make fun of.
author: Vincent B.

description: CASH ONLY! I didn't realize this and spent my taxi $$ on my drink. Mistake :( The place is ok - overly crowded and for some reason, everyone and their mother felt the need to step on my sandal laden feet --sad life. The music was cool (80s/90s) and the crowd was ok. It gets mad sweaty in here, though - especially the back room, so dress appropriately.
author: linda t.

description: mission hipster bar.  cheap beers in a divey rock atmosphere.  kinda small in the front but spacious in the back with at least one  pool table and a DJ later in the night.  i'd go back.
author: Eliot J.

description:
Has this place watered down since the last time I was here? Is there more deep woods and cleaner surfaces? I'm not sure, but has everyone ditched the tattoos and leather belts, and have they all left their nose/ear/eyebrow/unmentionable piercings at home?

Came here on a tuesday and wednesday night. Was expecting to get into a fight, judging by the last time I was here like a year ago. But it's changed. Dive bars shouldn't be this clean...
author: Andy A.

description:
One of my first trips out to the bars, I attempted to go to Delirium. They shot down my faux id with a vengeance. Since becoming a legit adult, the tables have turned and they've treated me right. 

Yes, it's dirty. 
Yes, it gets crowded.
Yes, that is the scent of smoke wafting around. 
No, I don't like that.
Yes, that's my friends number on the bathroom wall.
Yes, they're playing Murder City Devils.

I love this bar. It's like an old shoe. I begin my night thinking I won't wind up at Delirium, we always wind up at Delirium. Let's go somewhere else.

But you know what? I always have the best time. So I salute you, and I encourage you, my friend to go out, but please drop give me any more cigarette burns. Really, you all should quit smoking because it gets on my nerves.
author: Jessica R.

description:
As much as I would have liked to see people doing coke in the bathrooms - or as much as I would have liked to get further than 10' inside the door - it was impossible, because on a weekend there are too many mutha-uckas uckin' with your shi at this place.  

FYI, a place should not be called a dive if there is no room (due to excess of humans!) to take an inebriated spill.
author: Sam M.

description:
Coolest graffitied walls ever!

Bathrooms are nasty, music is okay, dancefloor is tiny.

My friend said this place is hipster land, which is to my liking. teehee.
author: Angela H.

description: Ahhh Delirium the name says it all from the rad security guys to the hot drunken mess that seems to never end i love this bar super fun i just wish the marina douche bags would mosey back to thier side of town, lately there has been a surge of them on the mission with thier overtly worked out bodies shitty additudes ugly plastic girl friends fuck that go home! leave the mission to the hot greasy hipsters and party kids!
author: Christopher R.

description: Came here one night while bar hopping in the area. We were all pretty faded by the time we got here so I don't remember much, other than that we sat in the back area of the bar. My friend was pouring everyone captain and cokes and we were downing them like water. Since I was wasted when I was here, the hipster factor didn't really bother me.
author: D J.

description:
you go here on a friday because you are drunk and everyone around you will be as drunk/more drunk then you are. its a dive thats names proceeds it. 

you should check it out.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Kinda cool, typical sorta dirty mission dive bar. Someone complained that this is a cash only bar. Well... most SF bars are cash only only so... It does get very crowded but we had fun.
author: Sailor N.

description: After coming from Double Dutch, with their $8 whiskey sour, I decided to get one here.  The price was good, but the drink was really, really weak.  I've learned now, to stick to beer when I'm in the Mission.  That being said, I like this place.  It gets really cramped, but there's a decent-sized room in the back where you can dance and watch the DJ (who was spinning great tunes when we were here).
author: Taylor A.

description:
I always start my Mission nights here. The drinks are dirt cheap. ($4 tap beer and mixed drinks!) This place is on the smaller side so as the night progresses and more poeple show up, the less room there is to breathe.
There is one pool table that is inconveniently placed by the door to get to the smoking room (only during the week days). The smoking room is also a dance room on the weekends! I always have fun here!
author: Katy D.

description: Love the $2 tecates and the low-key atmosphere. Can get a bit crowded because it's so narrow. Many people come here a few times before realizing there is an entire back room. Overall, a very solid dive bar.
author: Nathan L.

description: I hate it here. And trust me, I like me a good, grungy, divey bar, but this place is straight up hell on the weekends. It gets really really packed, and not in a fun way. People insist (with attitude) on playing pool when there is *zero* standing room. The bathroom looks, smells and feels like that shitmonster from the movie Dogma exploded all over it. And I'm pretty sure it's *the* destination for freshly of age, grungy bridge and tunnel hipsters. I hate slamming places, but if a friend asked me if I liked Delerium I would say, "Hell no. I-will-never-step-foot-in-here-again," so I think that's good reason for a 1-star.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Let me be clear about one thing:  I like surly bartenders.  Seriously.  You know the ones I'm talking about--gruff and mean on the outside, but totally made of gold on the inside (gold that was paid for by your tip money, suckas).  But A-hole bartenders...  well, that's another story.

When Delirium was the Albion, it was a true dive with an amazing jukebox.  And it had all the grouchy bartenders a girl could ever want.  But, damn it the drinks were strong and if you minded your own business and didn't act too much like a drunken fool, you could develop a mutual, surly peace with the person behind the bar.  

The other night, Jay H and I happened to have the strange (mis)fortune of wandering into Delirium with a pack of corporate types dressed like Santa Claus (I however, was dressed like Santa Claus' hot, dirty mistress)...  anyway, the story goes, the Santas were drinking and talking stocks and bonds or whatever they talk about, I was taking a shot of whiskey at the bar, and another lady Santa lost her wallet.  Now, I'm sure that in a "dive" like Delirium, this was just too G-D much.  And, I'm sure the bartender was thinking the whole time "Get the eff out of here you stupid *#@$%!-ers and I don't want to serve your G-D @#%#$^ers a single G-D drink.  Go back to the Marina!"  (if he had said that out loud, I would have been like, "Ha!  Shows how much you know!  I'm totally Bridge and Tunnel, jerk!").  But, is it really necessary to throw coasters and other flotsam from the bar at your paying (albeit, annoying) customers?  I felt like I had gotten trapped in bad out-take of a primate documentary--the dancing monkey suddenly unleashes his mounting irritation by picking up and throwing everything in sight at the apparent offenders.

One star for surly.  Minus four for devolution.
author: vicarious c.

description:
delirium /delirium/ (de-lere-um) pl. deliria   

a mental disturbance of relatively short duration usually reflecting a toxic state, marked by illusions, hallucinations, delusions, excitement, restlessness, impaired memory, and incoherence.

let me breakdown that definition....
1) a mental disturbance of relatively short duration- I don't think I've ever stayed here more than an hour.  Cuz it drives me crazy and i must exit.

2) reflecting a toxic state- I'm usually hammered and thats why i get dragged into here, and probably motivation for me to leave early.

3) marked by illusions, hallucinations, delusions- the smoke filled rooms filled with pretentious hipsters and cokeheads always make me question my reality.

4) excitement, restlessness, impaired memory, and incoherence- all very true too, especially because Delirium is usually just one stop of many in Mission pub crawling.  So many mediocre bars in the same area make me jump from one to another, drinking, stumbling and the occasion puking outside of kilowatt....but thats another story all together.  The excitement usually comes from knowing that the Bacon Dog Cart is right outside. mmmmm...bacon wrapped hot dogs.
author: Lauren F.

description: Look, I've been to dive bars.  This place was a nicer dive bar.  Had stiff drinks, but talk about hipsters.  Yeesh!
author: George U.

description:
What do you do when the love of your life leaves you broken hearted and all alone in the big, scary world? Well, I get drunk and make an ass of myself. And let me tell you, Delirium is one fine spot for those kinds of assinine antics. Seriously, I rolled into this place four cocktails deep and proceded to the bar, where I was served up the STRONGEST vodka-sodas (yes...plural...oy...) this side of Russia. I then proceded to the back where it was an all-out freakshow dance party and gave that dancefloor all I had to give. It was a worthy performance and I got the cute boy to prove it. 
What I  really love at  Delirium is the people- these are some hardcore drunks. No one cares what you're wearing. No one can even see straight enough to pass judgement. These are the kids who, had they been born 10 years later, easily would have been diagnosed with ADHD and heavily medicated. That's what  I call good times. I'll be returning again soon (who am I kidding? I'll be there tonight) for more drinking, dancing, and forgeting...
PS- Did I mention that the folks running the place (bartender, door guy, random people on staff) are the NICEST ruffians in the entire Mission district? Service with a smile...what a nice change of pace!
author: Autumn K.

description:
Delirium won my heart and now I can't stop talking about it. Everything in the other reviews is right on. To add my two cents...The music is by far the biggest selling point. It is the perfect mix of 80s and 90s jams that make it impossible not to sing at the top of your lungs and shake it for all your worth! 
I loved that everyone else on the dance floor is having just as much fun as you are. Everyone is there to dance and I didn't have to deal with the usual drunk guys trying to grind on me.
I found the crowd to be a pretty eclectic mix of people. However I did have a pink haired hipster girl stop me to comment "Look at you! You look all America's Next Top Model. I think you are in the wrong bar!" My friends were all how sweet! But I am pretty sure it was not a compliment and for the record I do not look model-ish at all! That must have been too many $2 Tecate induced beer goggles on her part! 
You will have at leaast one drink spilled on you and you will be jostled and knocked around on the dance floor but if you're there to dance...you will have fun!
I will be here shakin it every Saturday I can! I love you Delirium!
author: Aubs J.

description:
not so bad auctually.

last time i was there was the day of my little black out....so i couldnt remember liking this place or not.

since i kept my alcoholic self in check this time i was able to get a better feel for this place ..and i liked it.

thursday night is becoming my new friday night..then no. every night is a good night to have a few drinks so scratch that...

the bartender..who apparently i have met before but never remember..she is cool. drinks strong. always some good tunes and interesting things on the tv..looking around the bar i like who i see. 
us hardcore folk who arent afraid to drink strong on a thursday night. ...

i just have to remeber to not get more than one margarita here..and good lord no more shots of jamies. 

just might have to become a regular.....
author: dawn a.

description: For a long time it was the Albion- same grungy bar same cheap drinks same unencumbered scene- no one really cares what you wear or where you work.
author: Amy J.

description: Loved this place I felt like i was at home!.. Played awesome music.. The crowd was great to be around... Only thing that sucks is that they kick you out at 130... other than that rad people dancing to rad music and drinking rad drinks...
author: Amber S.

description: Loud Music.  Moderately priced drinks. Dark. Pool Table. Large back room ( perfect for drunken dancing, and making out with strangers)  Dave G. ( every time I come here he is here ? ) Good place to stop on a bar crawl. Oh and yes it is bart accesible ( 3-4  blocks)
author: Camille A.

description: I went to Delirium for a little birthday gathering on a Thursday night.  this was my first time to the location.  Drink prices are definitely worth the trip over.   I was having stoli/tonics for only $5 each..I had heard that it was motown thursday which was our reason for choosing to go to delirium.  I was a little disappointed b/c the music did incorporate some motown but i wouldn't say it was enough to call it "motown thursday".  definitely a hipster spot which doesn't make or break the bar for me.  overall i would go back if i was bar hopping but not sure that I make it a point to go there..
author: Brittany E.

description: A dive bar in Mission that was our first stop during a 14-hour pub crawl. I don't really remember it. Not because I got too drunk, but because it was so early into our epic drinking marathon that it's faded from memory. I'm sure it was just fine.
author: Pierre Trudeau I.

description:
mixed crowd of trashy fashionistas and hipster wannabes? -check-

strong drinks that'll knock your knickers off? -check-

ass groped trying to make your way to the dance floor? -check-

smell of cigarette butts left overnight in empty beer bottles? -check-

nasty as hell or hell-a nasty bathrooms? -check-

dark, devilish atmosphere? -check-

music ranging from dirty 90s rap hits to 80s danceable classics? -check-

feeling schwanky and drunk-ass fabulous? -check-
author: Margie B.

description: An incredibly good looking hipster boy rubbed up against me, pinning me to the wall. This was a significantly less sexy experience than it sounds as said good looking boy was merely trying to push past in order to get to the bar where the crowd waiting for drinks was at least 4 people thick. This bar can be great - if you go before 7 p.m. After that, the door people let WAY too many people in and it ends up being wall to wall people. On the plus side, I can never get too wasted here because I can't physically get to the bar to order drinks. On the negative side, I can never get too wasted here because I can't physically get to the bar to order drinks. If it's evening and you feel like getting accidentally groped by attractive hip looking people stop here. Otherwise, try one of the 4,000 other bars in the Mission.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I don't really understand why everybody likes to go to this place so much. It's either way too packed or practically empty. Not bad, I just don't see anything special about the place. I would have appreciated better music as well. I hate to say it but it is hipster infested. And since they only have one stall in the ladies room (one stall at a bar where everyone is doing nothing but drinking is so stupid to me), people choose to do coke out in the open. Classy.
author: Katie S.

description: You know, everytime I go here I feel like I'm 50.  From the girl screaming and crying because she lost her purse, to the dudes fighting with skateboards, to just a lot of hightschool bullshit, I am kinda over this place.  This is the place to go to if ya wanna screw a 21yo.  There is nothing wrong with that.  It certainly strikes my fancy from time to time.  But afterwards, I always feel dirty.  Oh well.  Oh yeah, strong and cheap drinks run amuck here.
author: Brandon C.

description: Great dive bar.  I always have a good time here, whether it's jam-packed on a Saturday night or a quiet Thursday evening.  The music playing on the jukebox is usually great, and the DJ they had in the dance room in the back one time played Gang Of Four and Wire and Television and all the punk classics.  $2 Tecate cans for happy hour.  Interesting people and cute girls sometimes.  When I'm drinking in the Mission this is a place I'll try to stop by.
author: Andy B.

description:
the sauce is good.

great music.

cute boys.

i didn't slip.
author: elisa g.

description: Hipster fuck-fest. Smells bad, way too crowded, and the same 80's/70's songs are on heavy rotation every night at this dump. 1 star for the stiff drinks, besides that this place blows. The kinda place you need to bring your track bike and a bag of coke in order to fit in.
author: Vilen G.

description: There's a back area with some room to sit down and chill.
author: Matthew P.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the city. Mostly because i was introduced to this place by one of the first people i met in this city and she took me around and introduced me to everyone she knew, including everyone here. No matter what time of day, you can walk in here and strike up conversation with whomever, the bartenders are chill if you aren't acting like a giant douchebag and the dance area, no matter how packed, is always fun.

oh, and it's dog friendly :)
author: John G.

description:
I used to really enjoy this bar,
Cheap Beer and Good Times,
But last time I was down there
The Femal bartender with all the tattoos stole my money.
I ordered A shot and a Beer Equaling 6 bucks, I gave her a 20 and then my drunk friend tosses in a 5 dollar bill. You know what change she gave me, Three freaking dollars. Then when I politly asked her about it she gave me freaking attitude. I guess she thought I was drunk and wouldnt notice, she did it to several other poeple that I could see but they were drunk and didnt notice. So if you go there dont order your drinks from her.
She is Tall, Black Hair, Tattoos on her arms, fairly atractive if you like that type.
author: Jay S.

description: This place is totally divey, but nothing special. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy dive bars. This place just wasn't spectacular, nor was it that bad. The beer is relatively cheap and the pool table is broken (or something) b/c there's really no need to pay there's no glass where the balls collect. The bathroom....that's another story. If I want to deal w/that, I'd rather just go to Lucky 13 and get the full punk rock experience. When not full, this is a good place for a beer on the way elsewhere.
author: Veronica W.

description: WEDNESDAY NIGHTS is where it is at YO!  $2- Tecates and PBRs...talk about heaven.. I can buy a round of drinks for my friends and not feel that I just spent my weeks pay check on it!  The dancing in the back is the best part.  I like to twist and this place allows me to get down!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description:
it is only already clearly wasted that i would set foot in a bar like delerium on a weekend night, but THAT HAPPENS. because i like to get drunk. and stuff. it seems like all the time i end up in bars where i'm smelling everyone else's gross b.o. & maybe vomit & i'm sweating even though i'm not moving & to top all that off, can't even get a muzzfuzza drink for like, ten minutes.

i know these bartenders are trying, it's not their fault, it's the fault of ALL OF THESE OBNOXIOUS PEOPLE in here.

however:

meeting cool girls in the bathroom is always nice, even when it's super gross.

& unfortunately i'm often attracted to a certain sort of smary hipster type of dude, which means i kind of like the smelly dudes up in here.

sigh.
author: Irene S.

description: Delirium has cool deejays who play decent 80s punk, but I won't venture here on the weekends much anymore- it gets too crowded with wasted sorority chicks and creeper dudes.
author: Liza W.

description: I'll pass on this bar.  Forever.  The "dance room"  has really poor ventilation and is really just kind of gross.
author: Maria F.

description: We stopped in here while waiting for a table at the nearby Monk's Kettle. It's located on a hip little street in the Mission District, and this venue reflected that. It was definitely a dive, with an assortment of countercultural patrons. PBR on tap. Little loud. We would definitely frequently this place if lived in this area.
author: Dara S.

description: Eh, it's an okay bar, kinda dinerish in style but the bartender was friendly, the tequila was good and the beer decent.  I've been back a couple of times but it's usually after I've already begun tying one on.  It's not where I go to start drinking but often times, if I'm in the Mission, it's where I finish drinking.
author: Jill D.

description: incredibly crowded, incredibly weak drinks.  AND to top it off, i was sitting in a chair, minding my own business when this giant creepy man walks up to me and says "ey.  you chi-neese?"  i nod.  he continues "ey.  check out those lez-beens.  you a lez-been?"  i shake my head.  "not that i got anything 'gainst them.  but sometimes i think they should be wiped off the face of the earth."  i smile politely, excuse myself, and get the HELL out of there as quickly as possible.  delirium, never again.
author: Katherine K.

description:
this is MY bar.

if i have a serious girlfriend again, 
and said girlfriend and i break up,
this is the place she will not be allowed to go.

so many legendary things have happened for me here
and i dont dare to regale you with my anecdotes

because evertime i come here its an adventure.

pros:

booze cheap
doormen remember the JT
usually an EXTREMELY favorable girl to guy ratio
this bar's layout encourages mingling! it does it does.
usually good music on the dance floor
weekends get CRAZY. crowd surfing crazy.
mexican bacon wrapped hot dog dudes out front (sometimes)

cons:

weekends get CRAZY. packed in like N-Judah during rush hour
occassionally DJs play some undanceable BS
bridge and tunnel and marina content high on weekends
i have always hit it off with girls here that are on vacation in SF (JT dont do HIT AND RUN. not my style)

bottom line: this place is a popular hipster bar that almost everyone goes to. cheap drinks. cool dance floor/smoking chamber, 80s on the weekends and crowded as F.

fun-o-meter: like playing spin the bottle. lame, until you get to kiss the hot girl and you thank god you decided to participate. (or you get to see two hot girls kiss. that's good too.)
author: JT X.

description:
Somehow, I always end up falling down on the dance floor here.  There are several reasons why.  First, I am usually destroyed from the cheap drinks.  Second, the floor is slippery from puke and spilled beer.  Third, I am usually a bit too enthusiastic on the dance floor due to the quality eighties mix the dj spins on  Saturday nights. 

Falling on the floor here is something you want to avoid because it is also an ashtray. This place is disgustingly dirty.  I just now figured out why I like this place so much -- it reminds me of my 18-21 yo days dancing in Tijuana discos while smoking indoors.  Oh, a few people get singed in the process, but everyone is always too drunk to notice that I just burned a hole in their arm.
author: t l.

description: You can bitch about it being hot and sticky and sweaty and packed but that's exactly why you go there in the first place.
author: Stef A.

description: There is nothing special about this dirty bar, except it can be used as a cheap alternative backup when other places are temporary closed around. If you're looking for a place to have some beers and you don't mind the music and the environment and the curious doorman, you'll enjoy it.
author: Tamas K.

description: I don't know. I guess if you like sweaty bars and doing key bumps in the ladies room, it's fun. But the only time you'll find me in here is if the stars are align just right and I'm hankering for a Tecate at the exact moment I'm walking by other than that I usually go elsewhere.
author: cindy n.

description: Don't go here sober, but when drunk, don't go anywhere else. Being inebriated inside Delerium is like getting to return to the womb and having a 100 or so inebriated twins in there all rocking out. And your mom's rocking out too.
author: Yussef C.

description: What i like about you, is you shook me all night long, you make me walk like an Egyptian, and when you take me on, baby got back.  Sometimes I feel like I'm dancin' with myself, but don't stop believin' because I love rock n' roll and girls just wanna have fun, have fun, wanna have fun have fun...
author: Katie S.

description:
delerium doesn't try to be something it isn't. they don't church themselves up with fancy stools or clean floors or even classy beers. the bartenders would just as likely serve you a can of tecate as much as simply glare at you for even attempting to order a drink. it's like that slutty girl in high school everyone knew that, if you simply asked, she'd probably blow you in the janitor's closet. there are no lies here. no deceptions. when you walk in the door, you understand you're going to be drinking PBR, inhaling smoke, having your credit card ignored, dancing with sweaty people, sitting in spilled beers, stepping on what-the-hell-was-that?, getting your clothes scrutinized for levels of authenticity, and probably seeing about twenty people you know. it's a dive bar, people. in the mission. this isn't the ambassador. quit getting so heated over it.

and quit hating on the hipsters. they're a harmless breed. it's the bikers ya gotta worry about. they'll cut ya.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: If Dalva is the generic swanky bar of 16th St, Delirium is its generic trashy bar counterpart.  And while I do love the punk rock soundtrack here, let's face it, you can get a way more charismatic version of the black-walls-and-grafitti scene at Lucky 13.  Anyway, as 16th St patrons go, I'm definitely on the yuppier end of the spectrum, and with so many bars to choose from, I don't see much reason to include Delirium on a typical visit here.
author: Wes M.

description:
I finally made my way out to Delirium last Saturday afternoon, and I have to say, I quite enjoyed myself.  If you're into sunlight, they have a lovely booth surrounded by glass bricks in the front, but if you're practically a vampire, like myself, then the back of the bar is for you.  

On Saturday's from open until 7:00pm they have a great happy hour.  $2 PBR (on tap, not in a can), and $3 for all other tap beers except Chimay.  They give you free freshly popped popcorn, free pool, and there is even a free BBQ.  Sweet.  I did burn the crap out of my fingers on a braut, but that was my own fault.

The bartender was super nice, and the crowd was surprisingly eclectic, and friendly.  I spent a good deal of my time chatting with a hot Irish drummer... Nothing wrong with that.  

The cons...the women's  bathroom is kind of awful.  There is only one stall, and there is a huge tripping hazard as the actual bathroom floor is about 3 inches lower than the floor on the other side of the door.  That might not sound like a big deal, but when you're drunk, that sucks.  There also aren't any mirrors, which I also was not a fan of.  I think the jukebox could use a little updating.  I tried not to keep playing songs off the same 5 or 6 albums but I failed.  I just couldn't find anything else.  

If you like grungy places, as I do, you will like Delirium.  If you can't handle a little grime, you'll want to stay the hell away from there.  The regulars probably wouldn't want you in there anyway.
author: Roxanne P.

description: I always feel like I'm trespassing into some weird "cool zone," because you can't see each individual testicle through my tight black jeans. The bathroom makes me throw-up in my mouth a little every time I go in, and it's always crowded. I would rather pee in some strange homeless' mouth, than in this bathroom. The music is fun, the DJ has a dog, the dance floor stinks like shit, and people are chain smoking, but I still dance. I just force myself to have fun, and it usually works!
author: Ben R.

description: Oh god.  I think some of my most tragic nights have been here, and I don't know if thast's a good thing or a bad thing.  Regardless, I always have fun when I'm here, and I always get WASTED.  The crowd is okay, nothing stands out about them, mostly a bunch of college kids and some older people I suppose.  The bathroom grosses me out, but what bar takes hygiene into priority?  It's okay.  I'll do my lines somewhere else.  I love that you can smoke in the back, because Little Miss Drunkyface over here loves to cause cancer with her death sticks.  And, when I get sick of Delerium--because I always do, Skylark is aroudn the corner.  Sometimes I'm feeling ghetto.
author: Angela H.

description: A convergence of white afros and abercrombie chic, crowded with Marission (Marina meets Mission) types. Loud and ugly.
author: Davi M.

description: Great place to end the night. Saturday night - $2 Tecate in a can. Cant beat it.
