Just when your liquored up enough to deal with it, there is a small room in the back where masses of bodies get together to cabbage patch to "Sweet Child O Mine" and "Goin Back Ta Cali". 9 times out of 10, you will run into someone you know.
author: Mick F.

description:
i am so not the target customer... let's just say that my expensive jeans, heels, etc. were not the standard look. 

if i hadn't felt such strong glares, i would talk about how fun the place seemed to be.
author: Heidi L.

description:
i love you delirium. 

this is my favorite bar in the entire world, for all the reasons all the other reviewers (both good and bad) have stated. theres really nothing more i can add about this bar that hasn't already been said, except for my two cents stating that i love, love this bar.

especially the back room.
and primarily on wednesday and thursday nights.
author: Andrea H.

description: I love Delirium. I usually stick to the $2 tecates and the dance floor. Thursday nights are prime, Build For Speed always plays a great set of tunes to dance to. Friday is good as well. Throughout the night it gets harder and harder to move around. earlier in the night and afternoon it has a loungey feel to it where you can hang out and wait for everyone to start pouring in. Fun fun fun though, this is my favorite place in the mission. Consistent as hell.
author: Aaron Q.

description:
If the smell of piss, cigarette smoke, and BO turns you on then Delirium is the place for you.

Don't get me wrong. I am not a snob. I don't detest dive bars. I lived in Portland in for 6 years. I spent most of my pre-21 and post-21 days sitting on a bar stool playing photo hunt at some not so classy establishment. But...Delirium just takes the dive bar classification to a new low. 

I am actually  surprised they even let me into this place as I am pretty sure they have a 3 tattoo minimum to get in here.

Sure the drinks are the cheapest you can probably find in San Francisco but even that can't entice me to brave this place.

Curse you Delirium for making me sound like an uptight yuppie!
author: Sierra d.

description: Rarr, I want to love you so much Delerium! I have tried, and tried, and tried again. But alas, still no room to breathe, too often getting pushed by the crowd into the bathroom hall! I  would rather hang out at Amber where at least I can scan for hot girlies at a distance without being shoved into them every 2 seconds.
author: Mango D.

description: This place was amazing.  I think.  I remember good loud music from the DJ, people having fun, and people buying me really stiff drinks.  Good times.
author: Eric S.

description:
okay here's what you gotta do to have a good time at Delirium:

dress like you didn't give a shit about going out
slam some beers, or a cocktail or two
wiggle to the back
dance
dance
and 
dance some more.

if you don't do that... then this pace was a waste. 

I think tha bar portion is tiny and really annoying when crowded with folk, but the dance floor is perfect if you want some down and dirty close up dance in a stank place- and trust me, stank is good from time to time.
author: Nnekay F.

description:
*disclaimer* i must state that ive actually only been once...

but its cheap and divey which earns it the first two stars, and some random chick did grope my junk there, so it gets a little bonus.

which reminds me... i should really go back there again.
author: N. B. K.

description: Please. I don't mind dive bars. I use to be  a frequent visitor to Radio in Oakland. But this is more like a dive hall. No where to sit, no where to walk, fuck that no where to even stand. Usually with dive bars you can look past the dirtiness and claustrophobia because its kitchy but this is just the former.
author: Chris L.

description: Coolest bar in the Mission within walking distance from my hovel on Sanchez St.  The other reviewers have already notified you to the extremely high level of hipster activity and to the excellent selection of quality cheap beer (oxymoron?)... but despite whether or not you see these as positive qualities, I want to double stress the awesome dance floor- good tunes, DJs in high heels are always fun, the lighting is moody, the smoking is laced, the dancers are Tokyo hip hop tourists, Santa Cruz transplants or possibly local trannies... all in all... good times.  PLUS $3 bacon-wrapped hot dogs with tons of jalapenos around 11 PM and after from the street cart out front on the weekends... best drunken meal ever... it completes the package.
author: Maximilian P.

description: this place can be kind of hit or miss, but the drinks are good and the atmosphere is dirty (just the way i like it).  some nights there is good music and other nights it just sucks.  there are a lot of hot guys (and girls i guess if you are into that) here on any given nite, but everyone here just lurks, like honestly seriously how long can you make awkward eye contact  with me without coming over and making conversation or possibly even (i know this is a novel idea) asking for my number.  so ridiculous.
author: Morgan B.

description: My friend dragged us here a few times.  I heard it was a hipster bar, but I never saw many hipsters.  I suppose they have migrated elsewhere, which is fine with me.  I don't feel judged here, I like their jukebox, the drinks are okay, it's not overpriced and the bartenders are nice.  The bathroom is pretty nasty, but I tend to like places with nasty bathrooms.  I'd prefer a nice bathroom but if it's a choice between that and clientele that I don't hate, I'll take the dirty bathroom.  I don't eat hot dogs, but they excite my drunken friends.  A couple times they were showing "Jackass" (show, not movie) on the TVs and I thought that was pretty brilliant - you don't need sound to appreciate that one.  Speaking of noise, after a few hours here I still have a voice, no sore throat, and my ears aren't ringing.  I like being able to talk to people without screaming all night.
author: Ljótur H.

description: I don't like this place. It's so trashy and it makes me feel like i'm in a grunge music video. Once i stepped in i felt like shooting up (just kidding). What's up with the random pinball machine in the back inthe room with all the tagging... random.
author: Rhoi C.

description: When was the last time anyone actually went to a dive bar and if they did would they really want to share it with the internet. My Bar hopping is secret but some places do just feel like home and maybe cause it's a hop skip and a jump from the house I grew up in.
author: Jetsetgirl B.

description: A reasonably good bar, kinda divey but in great location. They have a back room with a DJ and sometimes some great dancing, but too many smokers!
author: Cyrelle D.

description: I have to admit, I'm too old for this place but I just love it. I always go with the intention of hitting on some hipster child with jeans that I would have to peel off their ass but end up dancing in the back to 80s with my friends. It's a dive but has every walk of life you could think of. I always end up here on a Sat night. I would recommend leaving before close if you want to catch a cab.
author: Jessica S.

description: A good place if it's your scene. The back room is kind of small (so it always seems crowded), and I guarantee that your clothes will REEK of cigarette smoke. If are looking for 80's music and low key dancing in the mission, this is a good place to go.
author: Dana L.

description:
anyone who gives delirium a bad review, clearly went there with no intention of dancing. delirium is the BEST bar in the mission to go dancing at. not only do they play super fun music (wednesdays are the best, 60's pop & soul) but there is a whole back room to dance in, and it's always full of people who want to ACTUALLY dance, not just hump each other.

sure, it's super dirty and the bathrooms are scary. but who cares?! almost every time i've gone there they've played prince's 'raspberry beret'. & that's enough to make me happy.

if i was just going there to get drunk and sit in the SUPER crowded bar area, i might hate it too. but i don't! and i always have so much fun. 

i seriously have never had a bad night at delirium. so if you care more about dancing than you do about drinking, delirium is the bar for you.
author: Jana G.

description: Where people that don't go to dance clubs go to dance. The back dance floor is a sea of ironic robots and smoke, but it's a super good time, especially when the front bar is packed full of dirty members-only jackets.
author: Shannon V.

description: I am usually here on Wednesday's for Monkey Time with Sergio and friends. The bar is pretty cheap considering since it's a school night I tend to stick with beer. Pool table which is usually taken and a little back room for dancing. Small tables and an area to sit. I mainly go for the music which is always toe tappin' good stuff!
author: Mother L.

description: I'm sure peeps like me only visit here when waiting for a table at Monk's, but still a fine bar with $2.50 pbr's and awful death metal background music.  Bonus points for bartender attitude and sneer.  Also 2 urinals laughably close together.
author: Matt S.

description:
I do like Delirium... or at least I like it in theory.
It has all the makings of my kinda of a place. It's a dive, the drinks are super cheap and somewhat stiff, the bartenders are cool, they have a somewhat mixed crowd, good music, a pool table, a dance floor and no lame cover charge. 
But some how every time I go there I end up just NOT having a good time.  I can't figure out why this place has all the ingredients and still just tastes funny. Maybe it's that the dance floor is just way to smoky, hot, and crowded that I find myself unable to move. 
Or maybe it's that everyone there seems to either be pissed off and walking around with a chip on their shoulder or obnoxiously drunk stumbling around, knocking you over and spilling their drinks on you. Maybe it's like the chicken and the egg... the people are pissed off because they are having drinks spilled on them by the drunks or people have to get drunk just to feel normal when everyone around them seems pissed off. 
Anyways, I'm still not going to write this place off. I am convinced that one of these days I will go there and end up actually having a good time. One day.
author: Justine L.

description: Ugh.  Crowded.  Smoky.  Inattentive bartenders.  No redeeming qualities.
author: Rachel B.

description: Cheap drinks & late night dancing...need I say more?  Plus, I lost my brand new cell phone here and I got it the very next day from the nice bartender.  I like the music whenever I'm there...it's a dive, what more do you want?
author: Freckles D.

description:
Cheap Tecate and probably the only bar in San Francisco with aggressive girls (not cougars).

Biggest complaint is a hot dingy dance floor in the back and a gross bathroom.
author: Henry C.

description: 2 dollar tecate, good music, a pseudo smoking area, the only downside to this bar is that the bartenders are always busy and the bathrooms are really shitty. LOVE THE MUSIC! and dancing.
author: Ryan O.

description: This place is the ultimate dive bar. The bathrooms are gross and the beer is cheap. Bartenders are kind of slow but it was busy.
author: Darius A.

description: I was dragged to this place on a Friday night.  It was way too crowded, it took forever to wait to get a drink and then forever to go to the bathroom.  The dance floor is tiny and people smoke cigarettes here.  So if you are disgusting and like to smoke cigs then I guess you'll love it here.  I asked one guy to smoke outside and he was nice and left.  Then I realized there were about 4 more people smoking and my battle was lost since all these people were rude wanna-be hipsters who didn't care that I didn't want to smell their smoke, in California, where it's ILLEGAL.  If you're into trying to be super-cool and waiting around for everything come here!
author: Polly P.

description: Best bar in the Mission, even if they didn't have $2 Tecate...but please do not stop the $2 Tecate.
author: Natedogg C.

description: So, I gave Badlands 5 stars because it doesn't try hard. It's just a place off Castro where people go to just, well, go. Delirium, however, is a haven of ultra trendy hipsters that are a bit on the smelly side. It's a bit grungy and dingy. I swear some of the people that go there look really mangy but there's a pool table and the beer is cheap for your buddies that like to drink. I think this place just tries too hard to be divey and trendy that it becomes a not so nice place. Overall, I would not come here, especially if you have an aversion to men in drag who love wearing thongs. Ugh, yeah, don't ask, please...
author: Dorothy S.

description: The dancefloor smells like weed and other smokey scents.  They played really fantastic dance songs when I was here.  The occasional radio band made it into the mix but that doesn't bother me so much.  It's a tad crowded and small but still fun.  We got pretty drunk off some shots if I remember correctly.  (Which I don't really.)  Then ate at some place across the street which I'd like to review but also can't remember.  All in all it was a very good night.
author: Mary R.

description:
i love love love delirium.

if you're lookin for a place to floss your newest douchbag friends this is not the place for you.

if ya wanna meet friendly people, dance the night away on thursdays for built for speed. those girls know how to rock it.

the $2 tecates are pretty sweet too.

the bartenders are awesome and if you do make the mistake of lighting up on a friday the bouncers are pretty cute and they'll tell ya to put it out in the nicest way. that is, unless you're a douchbag who wants to fight about it, then they'll kick your ass out.
author: tinkerbell e.

description: I only go here on my way home from Puerto Allegre on Sunday afternoons. Good cheap beer. The Sunday bartender gentleman that served me a while back was cool. He made a decent margarita. We have had a shot or two together in the past. I like their juke box. Morrisey, Depeche, you know the usual. Like their $2 dollar Tecates.  Add a lime and some salt and you gotta meal. I doubt I'd really go on any other given day, but I don't live in the neighborhood. I think it's a good pit stop for sure.
author: monika l.

description: Forget this place on the weekend. The bridge and tunnel crowd come out in swarms. I'm not being a snob.... just saying. On a week day however, Delirium has all the grit and character of a good Mission bar. There aren't many spots in the Mission for dancing, but this place has a small, very, very dark room in the back were people get down. The music is indi rock and 80's. They allow smoking in the back, just so you know.
author: jake c.

description:
fuckin coked out hipsters, get out of the bathroom and let me pee.



i mean, i'm not gonna stop going here or anything, but still..
author: Jessica L.

description: By the time I ended up here I was soo done that I actually ordered a Shirley Temple! Met some cool bikers, got a bacon dog,used the really gross bathroom and lost all the Yelper's.
author: Douggers M.

description:
this place is ok.  i've only been here when i was already drunk.  it's fun to dance there.

by the way, sorry for interrupting you, girl doing coke in the bathroom.  nice shoes though.
author: Ryan S.

description:
"Ode to Delirium:
How I love your cheap stiff drinks
but even better is your bathroom.

Ok, thats not really an ode, but I mean it, that bathroom is a whole party in itself.  I have never seen so many crying girls in one place since boy bands used to come to town!!!  

Seriously, Delirium Bathroom--you should have your own reality show.  I'm working on it, but first I have to figure out the legality of putting cameras in a bathroom.  Who am I kidding?  Delirium bathroom doesn't give a f*** about legality!!!!"
author: Emma H.

description: I was finishing my beer as they were closing the place. Two men were pushing through the crowd with trash cans and yelling at everyone to leave. I was finishing the beer I had just paid the bartender for a minute ago. I tried to make a joke with the men screaming at the crowd to leave, but he wasn't having it 'leave, or I'll take that away from you,' he yelled at me. I tried to finish my beer, but less than 30 seconds later he grabbed it from my hand, looked at me and poured it on my shoes before throwing it in his trash can and telling me to 'get the hell out.' Having just had a beer (that they had sold me minutes before) poured on my shoes and screamed at, I asked to speak to a manager. I was told there was no manager at which point I was called a 'stupid white marina bitch' and told to leave. I got upset, asked to speak to the manager again and was repeatedly called a 'marina bitch' and told to leave. I told them I would call their manager tomorrow and they repeated their taunts calling me a variations of 'white marina bitch'. Do not go to this bar. There are many other great bars in the Mission and this is not one. Zero stars.
author: Kate S.

description: really, really strong drinks. good to linger at one of the tables.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Unpretentious, funky and a down-right good time! The crowd is fun-loving and the music is refreshingly alternative. Great stop during your bar hop in the Mission.
author: Natalie T.

description: I had fun dancing and watching the cross-dressing dancer gyrate.  Fun was had by all for my birthday this evening!
author: Tracy A.

description:
breathe / forfeit erection / toxical injection / geriatric f--kface / we still believe in lies


 So there I was, on a Monday night, sipping a nicely poured vodka soda with a friend, singing - or rather, gutterally screaming - along with the lyrics above, with a chihuahua, a schnauzer, and an English pit all barking at each other in the background. The song is industrial-metal band Ministry's Breathe, which was blaring from the jukebox at full blast.


 At this moment, a group of elderly, gray-haired folks walked in and ordered a drink and sat down. They didn't even flinch.


 Sometimes, when I'm sick of the crackheads and broken windows and stolen bike parts and lousy transit and other things that royally suck about San Francisco, I walk into a place like Delirium and it always throws me a quirky reminder of why I love this city anyway.


 DJs and dancing on occasion in the back room Very worthwhile for the alt. set.
author: Omid T.

description: Best Sunday I've had since church in 1999.  I like this place on a Saturday, so I was ecstatic on Sunday.  I didn't even feel bad about smelling bad from jiu-jitsu because I was wearing a t-shirt with a skunk on it.  Also $4 shots.  Also spitting distance from burritos.  Also a resident transvestite.  Does anyone know if she's (PC) on retainer?  Does she do Bar Mitzvas?  I noticed she's circumcised.
author: Mark W.

description: Nothing like a dark, sweaty club to dance the drunk off. Or make the drunk worse. It goes both ways. Anyhow, if you can't figure out what to do on a weekend night (or during the week, but I haven't been) this is usually a good standby. And if it's too crowded, Kilowatt is across the street.... drinks are usually strong and fairly priced.
author: Veronica B.

description: I love dancing to "Psycho Killer" in the back room.  Yeah it gets hot and sticky and some douche will usually try to grab your ass, but hey you can smoke in there.  Also you can get Baby High Lifes for like $2 which is the best drink when you are not sure if you can drink anymore.
author: Katie M.

description: Pretty fun for a Wednesday night.  Got to see some extreme PDA (NC-17 rated).  Cool, dark dance area that reminded me of Berlin.  And there's a pool table to kill some time.
author: Kelly H.

description: This is like the Urban Outfitters of bars in SF. Way too many wannabe hipsters.
author: Rae H.

description: I like this place because they have a pool table which doesn't require you to put in coins to play (or at least not the times when I was there).  And sometimes when you're drunk (or on your way there), you just wanna play pool.  Some weird girl grabbed my butt here so watch your butt.
author: Naomi N.

description: I love this bar!  Cheap drinks, great music (both the jukebox and DJs) and awesome staff.  The weekends get crazy busy, which sometimes rocks and often doesn't, but it's still my favorite bar in the city, especially for a daytime/happy hour or early evening drink.  Marina folks and bridge and tunnelers beware - this is definetely one for the locals.
author: MonkeyPants S.

description: Cheep, strong and no wait. You can dance- play pool- and meet people who can't stand up to do either. If you're lucky they'll have a cool shirt on that dances to the music for them.
author: Marianne s.

description: Didn't this used to be a tweek bar?  I liked it better when it was a tweek bar...
author: Gustie L.

description: This has become one of my favorite bars mostly because of the cheap drinks and dancefloor in the back...  It's so dark that no one can see me dance (if I can call it that) and everyone's so drunk off cheap beer that no one cares anyway!  I also like that there's dalva's and kilowatt just a stumble away.  At the end of the night, I sway, wating for the 22 whisk me away on home.
author: Sarah S.

description: Mission bar with a dancefloor in the back. The crowd is easy, music is usually good, so it gets pretty busy.
author: Mitzi Y.

description:
$6.00 for Jameson and  mini miler high life does the trick every time. There is a machine to buy 'hot condoms" (freaking gross) and 'p#$$y photos" (awesome) in the mens room. After a long debate inside of my head, I decided to pay my 50cents for option number 2. The money went in but no picture came out. What.A.Rube.
I came out of the mens room, furious at myself for another wasted bit of cash that could have been spent on.... well, I am not sure on what. Anyways, the bartender heard about my plight and drew me her best impression as to what I was missing. 
Heaven.
Like any bar, it is easy enough to block out any douchenozzlery perpetuated by revelers behind me with a couple of drinks. I do only frequent this place on weekends (early) and right after work, but as far as bars go, this is like it. Basic bar. 1/4 step above a dive... all it is missing are the old drunks. I think I am helping to fill that demographic.
author: Jason S.

description: I fear the bathrooms & suggest a full body condom upon getting within 2 feet of them. The staff, however, make up for the tragic state of the bar. I remember back in the day, when the Albion bathroom was a coke den (it's totally not that way anymore..nope) and there were roaches crawling all over the pool tables, what happened to those poor critters? I figure they moved over to the liquor store next door. Delirium sells swag now, so make sure to get yourself some, then go in the back room and dance to whatever great music Alabaster or Scott are spinning for your sexual gyrations.
author: Colleen B.

description: Walking by this place I thought it looked like a total dive but we ended up going there later that night and it was actually a really good time. They play decent 80s music and go heavy on the nostalgia inducing tunes rather than the really obscure stuff some places play. It does get a little crowded and the back room is stuffy but big plus for me is that the people are not pretentious and the crowd is diverse.
author: Cathy T.

description:
i spent my 21st birthday here, and lemme tell you:  it's loads of fun.  it gets really crowded really fast, but you can also get really drunk really fast.  

the place was actually a little bit smaller than i expected, at first.  however, once i got to the "blue room" in the back, i was pleasantly surprised and i had a blast dancing the night away with friends to pop 80s tunes such as "white wedding" and the "safety dance" 

and everything ive read or heard from other people just equates to the word "phenomenal"
author: Emily K.

description: Friendly (and cute ;-) bartender. Laid-back ambiance.  Strong, happy-hour (aka cheap) drinks.  What else could you ask for in a bar?!!
author: Tiffany L.

description: I always end up having an obscenely good time here and usually meet worthwhile skanks as well.  The music box keeps you in the mood for hijinks all niight + decent drinks deals + dance floor. . . how can it end badly?  Not really a good weekend joint unless you're in the mood to choke a bitch.
author: Margaret L.

description: If you 30 and still listen to punk rock then this is your place , bad beer selection and no ciroc - I enjoyed the place when I was 19 but the lack of swag turns me off
author: boy boy l.

description: Not a bar I would visit again. The bathroom was covered with graffitti and diseases (I'm assuming) with a huge line out the door. There were  a lot of wasted weirdos, but maybe thats what you're looking for if you're going out in the mission.
author: Chelsea S.

description: I remember the sweet 80s dance parties and I enjoyed dancing with just girls while all the guys tried desperately to dance with you. SO FUN! Anyway, it's just too dirty and the other night I witnessed a couple getting kicked out of the bar. It was too funny. There's a lot of attitude wrapped up in Delirium. It's been around for ages and it's a fairly dirty dive bar. I think it used to be dirtier with the drug use and smoking in the back during those crazy dance parties, it was bar none (no pun intended) one of the grimiest bars I've ever been to in the city. But they have cheap beer and booze so it's definitely a good time for the don't mind the grime hipster crowd.
author: Gina R.

description: I ended up dancing here late one evening.  I was actually not having a terrible time, even though it was super packed.  I was singing along to cliche eighties tunes, when suddenly I looked around and realized that I was by far the oldest person there-- not counting the huge group of girls who had dragged me in-- and we were definitely the only people who had showered in the last 24 hours.  Would not go back...willingly.
author: Jessica T.

description: If you make a trip to the 16th/valencia, be sure to start here. There's a small dance floor in the back. This place attracts everyone, from mission hipsters to dot.commers.
author: John M.

description: It was ok, although I don't remember much.... I am not sure how it got so popular, but the drinks and prices are good so that's probably a start. Dancing seems like it would be way crowded.
author: Rachel B.

description:
another great stop on the usual mission bar-hop

good crowd, strong drinks, and a looks-like-a-dive-bar-but-isn't mentaility carry this place a long way

does get kind of crowded on weekends, but that's to be expected. at least you don't need to shout to hold a conversation.

just watch out for the nintendo geeks

EDIT 3/12/07

met a few frineds here this past weekend and went in earlier than usual, so we were able to get a table. the drinks were strong, and the outlook was positive.

just when we were enjoying our drinks and greeting more of our group, we broke into a rousing rendition of "feliz navidad" to greet the birthday celebrant. to the uninitiated, it goes as follows:

"Feliz Navidad
Feliz Navidad
Feliz Navidad
Prospero ao y Felicidad

I want to wish you a Merry Christmas
I want to wish you a Merry Christmas
I want to wish you a Merry Christmas
From the bottom of my heart "

as soon as we got to the last line, happy as we were, the bartender throws  a cup of ice at our group, hitting me and about 3 other people.

nobody treats me or my friends like that. if you want people to shutup, and they're not drunk beyond belief, tell them rather than throwing ice.

due to that tattooed slut behind the counter, yeah, i'm not going back there. ever. the music was especially bad that night, as well.
author: Charles C.

description: Came dancing two nights in a row and I wasnt disappointed with this place. The DJ's are super friendly and there is a great little dance floor surrounded by couches. A perfect chill spot! Also a good sized bar and pinball machines for added fun times. Monday night was oldies night - a blast to dance to. And saturday was flashback and current hits. The crowd varies from young to old but not pretentious or rude. A great place to shake it!
author: M K.

description: We had a good time!  (although I admit it was all a bit hazy and we might have behaved badly... er sorry!)
author: Pelle Y.

description: Good drinks, WAY TOO CROWDED on a Saturday night. Seriously, took forever to walk through the crowd indoors to get to the bar, and had to wait another good 10 minutes to finally get a drink.
author: G G.

description: OK, here's the deal: It's good for dancing. Don't come here to drink unless you plan on going elsewhere once things get crowded. Like I said before, the key to having a good time here is to claim a corner table in the back for yourself and your friends. Unfortunately, there are only two corner spots -- so it's probably not going to be your night.
author: Amy Z.

description: This place is still the shit and you know it. Dirty, sweaty, and all around fun. Just make sure you're with the right people. It's easy to get drinks if you know how. Just enjoy the hipsters smoking on the dance floor, you're in the Mission for crissake, you asked for it! Get on it.
author: Linda M.

description: It gets really gross in here when it's packed, I have had some fun here but it's very hit and miss with the crowd, and music so I'd rather not go.
author: Constance C.

description: I spent the entire night dancing here.  Fabulous 80s music.  Great cheap beer and drinks.  All in all, a perfect dive bar.  My only complaint is that I came out reeking of cigarettes.
author: Joanna S.

description: Once you get past the bar there is a back room that reminds me of an old skool warehouse party style vibe with some great 80's obscure beats. Even if you don't like the music you have to sit back and appreciate the music they're playing. It's part of history! Bonus for me and adding to the vibe is the fact that you can smoke in the back room. This place is worth going to. In it's own unique modern way...it is quintesentially San Francisco. Go an experience the neo-80's movement to it's fullest. DO IT!
author: Steve H.

description: This is definitely not my kind of scene so my opinion is biased. Total grunge dive bar. Theres a bar in front and some pool in back, not very big. The crowd is wearing dirty tshirts and untrimmed facial hair. I guess if its your thing but its not mine.
author: Joshua G.

description: I know, I know. But there will always be a special place in my heart for this spot. The drinks are cheap and good (order a double from the guy with a pompador and there will be no need to return to the bar for the next 40 minutes) and the music is usually great, when they're not repeating the same 10 new wave songs. Plus, you can smoke in the back room after ten.
author: Ron A.

description: It's worth pushing your way through the awful crowd up front, for the hot dancing ACTION in the back.
author: Scott M.

description: This is a good bar for just about everything assuming your activities require alcohol.  I've had a first date here that went well and many of nights of debauchery.  Though I often find myself outside the bar brown bagging it when it gets too crowded inside.
author: Derek D.

description: Fine. I like it here. It's cheap. There's a good crowd...most of the time. It's also the ideal place to make fun of hipster douche bags who are talking loudly about indie music and Vincent Gallo.
author: Jackie I.

description: you get what you get when you head there, Its a mission bar... i don't go here for the classy ambiance. I go because they have kick ass bartenders who remember your drinks, are down to earth, and quick on their feet. The music is usually good, Genea hooks up free pool on the weekends. I will say i like this bar a lot more in the day than night, gets a bit too crowded but whatever. its usually a good time regardless. Always something random going down. All and all a good place to kick back and hang with friends.
author: jamie z.

description: Delirium is definitely a dive bar. It's got a lived-in look; writing and random stickers all over the walls and overall grungy feel. Drinks are super cheap, so it's a great place to start out. For the most part, you can usually find a table to sit at, especially in the back room. If there's a DJ, it's pretty loud in the back, which isn't great if you want to talk. You may encounter a man in fishnets and short denim cut-offs giving you a dance performance, though-- added bonus or drawback? I can't decide. Good punk rock/indie soundtrack, not the classiest clientele, but you get what you pay for.
author: Julia W.

description: The bartenders @ this bar serve some real mean drinks actually the whole staff is coo, but the owner is a real asswhole specially when he's drunk, I don't remember his name...he is short, white, the type of guy that rolls his pack of cigarrets on the sleve of his black t-shirt. One time I playing pool and I was about to win all I had to do is sink the 8 ball, when this short mothafucka comes over and grabs the 8 ball and puts it in a pocket, I was ready to knock this fool out when the doorman rush over and told me to excuse him cuz he's drunk. Ok ok back to my review the bathroom stinks like shit and the armpit room I mean the dance floor is coo.
author: Angelisimo G.

description: I actually love this bar, it's crowded but the people are cool.  And the bacon cart lady is usually right outside the bar.  My favorite mode of transportation (BART). Is right down the street.  I still can get drunk, great fresco dining, and a way home that even MADD would approve of
author: Rossi C.

description: Meh. Not really a bad place. Just a little much. But you'll always seem someone you know.
author: Matt L.

description:
The Saved-by-the-Bell of bars.  Seriously.  The back room?  Filled with all the "cool" kids who were kicked out of Gillman by the red shirts because they were drinking in the parking lot.  Plastic cups?  Come on.  Really?  I thought this place was supposed to be the cool dive.  Heh.  The only "cool" people I saw there was Screech, Slater, and Zach look-alikes.

Also, what's going on where you try to cram two urinals into the space for one?  The buddy system?  I don't need help nor do I appreciate someone trying to elbow their way into the urinal "closet" while I'm trying to pee.  Wait your turn, Mr. Belding.
author: Chris D.

description: I have too say. I love hanging out in the afternoon. Getting off work having a place to chill and write and enjoying a Stella. Some of the best people I met. So many good times. To hang in the front and have a smoke watch the people walk by. Miss it. The staff the DJ's all of it. I do have to say you know when the B&T's are in town its time to go home. peace to all
author: kristen s.

description: I love the music. I used to think it had a punk rock vibe, recently it's just a bunch of hipsters fixing their hair in the mirror on the back wall of the bar. I always wondered why everyone drank Tecate when I went there. I soon realized it was because Saturdays are $2 Tecates, why am I always the last to know about the drink specials? Maybe because I only go here when I feel like being splashed with beer, told I look cute dancing, singing to The Smiths at the top of my lungs, and checking out the fashions. They have cameras EVERYWHERE in there.
author: Monica R.

description: I think this might be my favorite SF bar so far. I'm nostalgic for cigarette smoke and eighties music, so this place really satisfies. Or maybe it's just the really awesome Tokyo Tea that the cute bartender always makes me...
author: Shannon R.

description: Living in Ireland i'm used of packed bars with funny people,so when I come to the city this place is a breath of fresh air.The bar is full of happy people and the staff are brilliant..The best bar in the city,no doubt....Cheers
author: ed m.

description: This place is pretty rad, They used to let you smoke in the back which was pretty cool, But I guess you can understand with the law and everything. Anyways, cheap drinks, good music ( most of the time ) but the crowd can get pretty random and its pretty hit or miss. Sometimes the  bros from the marina seem to find their way out. lammme. Hip hop nights on Sundays are always good.
author: Ken P.

description: For some reason this is where people want to go - and unfortunately it is one of the closest bars to my place. I've given it a few chances, and every time it sucked. Too crowded, and I haven't met any of these cute girls everyone speaks of....
author: Lisa P.

description: a little bit too trendy and overcrowed, especially on the weekends. I usually get dragged here by my friends when I really just wish I could go to some place different for once. after a few beers, which range from cheap tecate to moderately priced IPAs on tap, etc. I still wind up dancing a lot of having a helluva a time. if it's too hot and crowded inside, I can always enjoy a brown bagged tall can of PBR in the alley around the corner.
author: Coffee ..

description: I was trashed when i got to this place, so i didnt buy any drinks, it was crowded and i went straight to the dance floor where they were playing James Brown and Stevie Wonder, so i danced my ass off. I liked it cause it had loads of people and there was an actual dance area. Decent place, ill for sure go back!
author: Charles C.

description: 2$ tecates+80s pop+dance room in teh back & getting laid on account of all 3 = the best pickup bar ever. though it's been going downhill lately
author: Naz V.

description:
[edit]
had to drop my rating from 2 stars to 1.  my phone was lifted from my pocket here a few months ago, by one of the stinking piles of meat whom i mentioned in my original review.
[/edit]
i used to think i hate places like this because i'm antisocial.  then i figured out that i'm not really antisocial, i just have an avoidant personality disorder, which can only be cured by drinks.  and then i started thinking i must hate places like this because i'm old.  then i realized i'm not old at all, i just don't have as much energy as i used to have before i started drinking so much.  and then i started thinking, i actually don't hate this place at all, i like it a lot early on a weeknight, when it isn't full of loud, stinking piles of walking meat who get in the way of my next drink.  and then i realized why i hate places like this: because if i wanted to be packed like a ruminant mammal into a cramped room full of vacant sweaty bodies stumbling all over one another, and forced to inhale a thick fog of poisonous, carcinogenic smoke, i could have just been born a jew in 1930's eastern europe, and everything would have been set.  no, that's not it.  really i'm just a drunk with odd standards, and i'm more interested in sharing my appreciation for another drink with a like-minded comrade or two than i am in explaining why i don't want to dance in an unventilated room full of smokers, or that i'm doing both myself and the annoying, coked up skank that just tried to sit on my lap a big favor by blowing her off now instead of tomorrow morning.
i wonder if anyone ever noticed the hole i added to one of the walls here...
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: good cheap drinks. i love the dance floor. it's like the crowded, sweaty 8th grade dances i used to go to at the JCC when i was 13, except with beer and sleazy guys. i have fun basically every time i come here, even when i'm using that scary toilet or having some creepy dude try to take grievous liberties with my thighs while dancing to mstrkrft.
author: Jane P.

description:
before delirium: "i'm a big fan of dive bars."

after delirium: "i'm a big fan of dive bars with clean bathrooms."

if there's one thing i can't stand is a filthy bathroom. everything that i like about delirium (cheap drinks, music, atmosphere) was offset by its disgusting bathroom last saturday.

ok, now that i'm in my 30s, i need to drink coffee if i know i'm going to stay out late. thus, i pee quite often. anyway, we arrive at delirium for some 80s dancing. she likes hip hop. i like rock and breaks. so 80s is a good compromise. "babe, i'll be right back. i gotta pee." when i enter the bathroom, i immediately sense a pool of urine, and stand on my toes. wow, that was close. i take care of business and go back to my girlfriend who's getting bugged by a frat boy. "hey man, be cool and don't wear your baseball cap backward." he apologizes and moves on. after a beer, i have to go pee again. shit! the pool has turned into a puddle. effing gross. i tiptoe my way around and take care of my business. i go back to my girl who's now getting bothered by an uber skinny hipster kid. "hey man, be cool and eat some chicken." he apologizes and moves on. after another beer, i have to go pee again... as the night went on, the urine puddle was becoming a small pond. effing disgusting. now when i'm peeing, not only i have to tiptoe my way around, i have to use one hand to hold my jewel and the other hand to cover my nose and mouth. effing gross. it was time to go.

i'm not coming back here on saturdays. weeknights are still ok.
author: frisco j.

description: I used to love this part of the mission and delirium. Now....not so much.  maybe in my maturity I have come to disdain tight pants, symmetrical haircuts, and  hipster hoppers, naw that's not it, I think it's just all those things plus the dash of pretension and the " I'm a Local" bullsh!t that permeates this room full of idiots who try so hard, to like they don't try so hard, to look like the F@CKIN idiots they are. I came in here with people from all over the Americas, my rastafari friend from Mexico, my punk rock friend from Argentina, a soccer player from Honduras, and a bunch of my girlfriends from the city. 6 dudes 11 girls actually. We walked in and immediately out cuz  some skinhead poser F@CK started wanting to fight my friends the second we walked in. none of us had even ordered a drink. WTF? I decided to leave cuz my friends from south of our border were actually contemplating showing mister Adolph Hipster and his two friends what a Das Boot Party is really like. I'm a lover. I just don't love delirium anymore. a few of the girls I was with told the doorman the deal and he didn't even respond to them. WEAK. I might go back one day when the whole soccer team is in town and kick the ball around, and possibly a few heads.
author: santiago g.

description: so like, i kinda dislike this place.  i ONLY come here occasionally on thursday nights with a large group of friends, and they only come for the Built for Speed DJs.  gotta say, Built for Speed are some excellent DJs, playing songs i love, and songs i didn't know but now love.  the crowd is ok, i guess.  a lot of confused straight boys acting out, and a fair amount of desperate pussy in need of some self respect.  but other than the occasional douchebag, the thursday night scene is pretty cool hiding out in the back room.  but you will NEVER see me here any other day, haha.
author: eric i.

description: I still haven't mastered the art of yelping bars yet. It's the chicken or the egg scenario. Did the bar attract good company or did good company make the bar? I had a great time at Delirium the other night. There are so many bars on that strip to choose from and I rarely opt for Delirium. I found though that it has something for everyone. Bar area, pool table, arcade game, dance floor. It did get extremely crowded on Saturday night but people streamed in and out so quickly that you just had to bear with it for a few minutes and then you could breathe again. People watching was great - I found the crowd to be pretty diverse for a Mission divey place. I also enjoyed me a PBR. Delirium loses a major star for bathroom quality. I expect pretty nasty shit but this was bad. Plus, only one stall for women? The line was so bad that I rallied a couple girls around me, busted into the men's room and had them guard the door for me. Survival of the fittest, and I won.
author: Susan L.

description: hate to rag on a cool place with really nice / cute girl batrtender, but the piss stench is so overwhelming in the men's head it's unreal. i probably will never go back because of that. too bad, nice girl pouring drinks on fridays.
author: Brandon M.

description: Okay, worst first: the bathroom is quite likely only slightly less gross than a public restroom anywhere else in the city. Ladies, do your kegels because you may be in for a long night of holding it in. Gents, exercise your enviable right to pee elsewhere, while enjoying the in-and-out privileges I so adore about this place. Sure, it's hot. Sure, it's packed. You may find yourself conversing with a dreaded musician who is clearly too high to be anywhere but Taco Bell or in the presence of a gallon of Rocky Road. I can't stand it when places are so packed it denies me the capability to move without some 'bows in my ribcage. This will likely be the case, but you'll be too busy enjoying your deliciously stiff drink and then eloquently explaining to your friend after closing that you're on the corner of San Pablo and A**hole. She'll understand. Overall, you're in for a fantastic night, and you may even manage to coin a new phrase.
author: Dru V.

description: i always get sucked into going to this place.  it takes about 20 minutes to get the the back of the bar. they allow smoking indoors(which, last time I checked, is illegal).  I have to hold my breath if I want to dance or even go say hi to some friends.  then my clothes wreak when i get home.  that shits not cool
author: Joey R.

description: i forgot how amazing happy hours are.  stopped in here after a saturday at dolores park and paid very little for some anchor.  free bbq and one of those strange japanese game shows on tv.  a great place to drink in the afternoon.
author: Markus B.

description: perfect little dive bar to gather after a day of riding the city. not packed at all on a monday night...great space for a group and beer is cheap and cold. what more could you need?!
author: Rachel G.

description: I hate writing bad reviews.  This place was awful.  Didn't think anything of it, thought I would just pop in for a chill night with friends.  In fact, I was excited because I wasn't even drinking and I still thought it'd be a cool place just to hang out and shoot the shit with some of my buddies.  The bartender however, expected something different.  I was hanging out at the table, minding my own business when he came over and asked for my ID - after I had already been in there sitting, not drinking a drop of alcohol - not even a glass in my hand.  I told him I wasn't drinking and the bartender went into a hysterical fit.  He demanded that he see my ID - which I showed him, and I'm 25 - and he kept on going off into hysterics.  My friends and I got up to leave, because he was really being strange and he started shouting vulgarities at us as I walked out the door.  I seriously think this guy had either a nervous breakdown or lost his mind and my friends and I witnessed the whole thing go down.  Really unfortunate because I thought this could be a cool place.  Not cool with bartenders who jump on their high horse and go off on power trips.
author: Scottie M.

description:
I hate Yelp.  These idiots just want to glorify there own opinions.  No one really cares what you have to say... including me.

Drinks are affordable and strong.
The bartenders are efficient if nothing else, but most handle the nonsense with great patience.
The music is good (both jukebox before 10 pm) and Dj's (after 10 pm).  People are stupid.  
The bathroom is not a place for socializing, its where you piss.  Go shit at your Mom's house.  The ladies' room only has one stall 'cuz you idiots don't anything about zoning laws.  If they put in another one, modern ADA laws would have this place shut down due to the necessary renovations.  If you don't like it, don't go there.
Credit Cards are not accepted (so you can't spend the money you don't have and so that everyone else can get their drinks faster.... derrrrrr).
This bar isn't trying to be anything its not, skater, hipster, douchey brigde and tunnel, marina "slummers."  It's all of them and none of them depending on the time of day and day of the week (just like every other bar in The Mission).
Take your pick.  Choose wisely...
author: liquor n.

description: Perfect size dive bar. Loved everything from the crowd to the music to the location within other bars. Highly recommend
author: J K.

description: So my good friend was dating this weird gothic girl that was pretty hot.  She didn't talk much but when she did she had an eastern european accent.  We all got drunk at delerium and smoked cigarettes and then on the way home we hooked it up in the back seat while my friend was driving.  Luckily he wasn't mad at me.
author: Cody R.

description: If you actually happen to live in the Mission, then Delirium is your guilty pleasure. Nobody who lives within such close proximity to the City's highest concentration of bars, entertainment venues, and house parties is going to make a night out of hanging out at Delirium. So why the fuck is everyone always here you wonder. Theoretically, it makes no sense. Realistically speaking, you're here. Debt collectors should quit wasting time making prank calls and writing ransom notes and just come down here in person to kick your defaulting ass. But seriously, how many more times of rubbing elbows with a frenemy will it take to teach you a lesson? Actually, how many more times of watching a pair of bicurious hipsters flail about vaguely in sync to the Knife's Heartbeats before it gets old? I thought that the time I'd ever hear a bridge-and-tunnel girl proclaim Delirium as "a really awesome bar" before bolting for the bathroom stall to snort a line would just about  do it. But inexplicably, I came back (again) and threw away (yet again) what basically amounted to an $12 six-pack of Tecate. I don't know, I've basically accepted the fact that if I ever have a bad time, I can at least walk away with free packs of Camels from that one dude that makes this bar his first and last stop of the night. Plus, there's always the liquor store next door for tallboys in the park after last call.
author: Jenn W.

description:
delirium? more like nauseum. 

mainly because of its patrons. the bartenders are good, though. normally i'd feel weird about writing a sub-par review for an establishment i always end up at, but there are so many anonymous glasses-wearing asian girls in the mission, i feel pretty safe with this one
author: Erica C.

description: i like delirium if you manage to snag one of the booths by the front door. i always randomly see people that i know but don't talk to anymore at this bar. sometimes it's too smoky for me which is really annoying since i hate cigarettes. and sometimes i hate pushing my way through the sea of hipsters. delirium also brings up memories of my now boyfriend who was my ex boyfriend at the time playing pinball in the back and subtly ignoring me.
author: Melanie C.

description: your typical dive bar.  they did have dewars to my delight.  i think my buddy lost his keys here :(.
author: Roni L.

description: thursdays the djs rock, cheap booze, good music, pool, pinball, scuzzy bathrooms.
author: kiki b.

description: i dug this joint. it reminded me of cbgbs for some reason but that just might be the grafitti everyhwere and the general rundown-ness of the danceroom. there were boys outside drinking PBRs from brown paper bags, and if that doesn't steal your heart, i don't know what will.
author: ms.kiki g.

description:
this place earns major point for location alone. close to bart and across the street from the monks kettle? awesome! 
this is a great place to wait for a table at the kettle (probably where most of their non-stinky-mission patrons come from) and if you're looking for an unapologetically gross mission bar, this is it. yes, there are a lot of hipsters (which doesn't bother me much, my neighborhood seems to be a weird hipster vortex) but you eventually get used to being the only one in the room with a symmetrical hair cut. they only take cash, but it seems like most dives do. last time i was here they played van morrison, wanda jackson, and the arcade fire in a row. that alone earned them an extra star from me! the pints are decently priced, and there is almost always somewhere to sit and enjoy a night if bullshitting with friends while watching skinny kids get into fights. not a bad place to spend an evening
author: Meta K.

description: poor ventilation, weak mixed drinks, crappy pool table, high levels of b-o... nonetheless, the good djs, the smoking room in the back , and the little lady that sells tamales from a cart are the only reasons i come here.
author: rachface -.

description: if you like the ruby room, this is a good sf alternative. the back room rocks cause its all cigarette smoke and dancing, but overall im not a huge fan. for a good dive i prefer the kilowatt.
author: jenna p.

description: loud dive bar, but the pool table is pretty damn comfortable
author: Ali L.

description: This is a bar that wishes it was a divebar, but gets much more business than most dive bars.  It looks trashy, and whether or not you think it's a good or bad thing, this is bad trashy.  From all the people that come here, they're either already really drunk or have already sunk so low they just don't give a shit anymore, the quintessential San Fran emo hipster.  For the love of god, they serve their beer in dixie cups and their liquour in plastic condiment cups, and charging up the ass for them.  The cups don't hold that more than 8oz beer, and the condiment cups hold less than half a shot while the barkeeps don't even fill them.  Ironically, it's the poor hipsters who decide to frequent this overpriced craphole of a bar.  No wonder they're still poor hipsters, but I guess they want to fit the 'profile'.  There I said it, hipsters have become a stereotype much in the same vein as yuppies.  I thought they were supposed to be nonconformists?
author: Leroy H.

description:
sweet, i think i just made eyes with jeff spicoli. i'll never shower again, just so i can cherish this dizzying moment of b.o. and smoke.

do i jump around with the crowd for a few minutes to play along? yes. good cardio opportunity.

but the light at the end of the tunnel is the hot dog cart outside, where i purchase one wrapped in bacon.
author: Mia L.

description: this place does get packed on the weekend...but whatever i heart the hottie door guys!
author: claudia o.

description: you still sorta blow, but nobody smokes in the back anymore which is probably a good thing because it was a sweaty smokey nightmare when you could.
author: Lauren V.

description: i've been going here the past several years, and i've almost always had a good time here.  i like it earlier in the evening when it is less crowded, and also on nights when they play music i like.  actually, most nights they play good music, but black tuesdays is my favorite.  the drinks are fairly strong and there is a back room with room to dance and a dj.  you used to be able to smoke back there, but i'm not sure if you still can.  this is a good mission bar!  lacks a little in the area of Good Lighting, except in the back room.
author: Kate W.

description: good for dancing, pool and drinking, but kinda icky.  it's a dive bar but fun for a couple drinks and then a stumble to the bacon wrapped hot dogs around the corner.
author: regina k.

description: theyve got mid evil madness pinball in the back and you can smoke inside sometimes. gets pretty crowded on fridays and saturdays.
author: Paul Q.

description: i've been here a plenty. i live around the corner.  it smells like dive bar and people are obnoxious.  the service is good, but it gets cramped late at night..which is good for them.  i still dont understand why marina people come here.  what i can say is that  i love the drink prices. god i love $4 drinks.
author: Ann M.

description: although ive never had a truely fun time here at delirium, there are reasons to come to this bar.
author: christopher a.

description: superstar skaters from the mid-'90s converge somewhat often. what's with people complaining about bathrooms in dives? dives are supposed to have shit (filled) bathrooms. stay home. leave the party spaces for the partyers
author: ultra p.

description: whatever asshat sent me a "compliment" trying to defend this shitty bar, you can go eat a bag of dicks. you'll probably find said bag of dicks for sale in the back room at your favorite bar.
author: Becki L.

description: i used to pass by delirium with my friend almost daily. we would remark on how grungy and disgusting of a bar it looked like. then one nite. i went inside to use the bathroom ( i was desperate and disgusted). the walls are covered in graffiti from humorus (the famous:ladies give head its good for you) to heartwrenching (my dreams are eraser dust i blow off the page). after my trip to the bathroom i wound up with a drink in the backroom dancing the nite away. the room was sweaty, crowded and smoky. there was a tranny in a fish net body suit and gyration all over the dance floor. i realized that this was a good place. i havent stopped going since. i like the crowd...a mix of "hipsters", thugs, cokeheads, pretty girls, bikers (the fixie kind), and theres even brown people there. also, its dark. i love that place. one of my favorites to dance and get wasted. and btw...i havent really had a problem getting a drink when i need one.
author: shawna s.
